story:
Aloha!

My name is Bo Bergemann and this is my daughter Bree.   I am an award winning world renown original doll artist from Hawaii.  Bree is a full time student.  We are quite the dynamic duo in all things in life for 17 years now and we are hoping you will join us in our newest adventure!

My daughter, Bree, is deaf.  Our family has lived her lifetime trying to help her grow skills in both expressive and receptive communication so she can effectively connect with others and our world.  Communication and connection are so important to a person's spiritual, emotional, physical & psychological well being.  Something most of us take for granted.  I know I did before I met my daughter.  Communication is also the key to learning and education which is key to growth and independence.

I took care of some of Hawaii's most medically fragile foster babies for 15 years, during which time I fostered a sweet baby girl who was deaf that stole our family's hearts.  So, when she became adoptable, we were very grateful and immediately made her our own!  A lot has happened in the years since, but the journey to assist her to communicate and connect with the world is a demanding, continuing and ongoing process for us all.  

At her request, she and I recently moved to Fremont, CA for her to be able to attend one of the nation's leading schools for the deaf.  It is an American Sign Language (ASL) immersion program.  She wanted to go there because she wanted to be with other kids who are also deaf and to be immersed in an ASL and visual learning environment.  The opportunities for her abound in this environment, so we are very grateful she is attending there now.  She is an A student and we are all very proud of her!  This is one of only a handful of such school in the USA doing a really great job for the deaf and hard of hearing today.

Sadly, the opportunities for deaf children to learn and grow in ASL (American Sign Language) usage are far and few between in most other places nowadays.  Even in the USA of today.  American Sign Language and it's very real impact upon those who need it is far too misunderstood.  The resources are few.  The demand is spread out, not centralized, so no one is as aware of, nor well informed nor enabled as is truly needed, in my opinion from our own experience.

I believe something as simple as a doll can make a huge difference!  Realizing the deficit between ASL educational opportunities and the real need in most communities in the USA Today, I decided to make an ASL doll.  Anyone can role play with and learn to communicate using such a doll.  Dolls can go into homes, workplaces, vehicles as well as educational and therapeutic environments where the children who need to learn ASL are.  Dolls are simple early developmental stage tools to teach both communication and connection.  Key reasons for American Sign Language to be taught to the deaf, hard of hearing, and other non-verbal children through dolls.

Check out this brief video which shows the preliminary prototype in action!

There is a longer video with more to it at the bottom of this campaign explanation.  Read on for more detailed facts.

What Makes Me Think I Can Do This?

I have been making dolls for 25 years.  I've run a successful business selling my fine art dolIs for 7 years now.  I also created my own award winning vinyl doll line known as Trendy & Swag which won Dolls Magazine's Industries Choice Play Doll of the year in 2015 & 2016 as well as People's Choice in the latter beating out others worldwide in the 18" Play Doll category.  I designed, sculpted, produced, fulfilled and oversaw every aspect of this line.  So, I know the industry and have the skillset, connections and experience to make this happen.  Frankly, so do companies like AG or other well known doll companies.  But, I also have the desire to see this very real need of the deaf & non-verbal communities met.  These two factors work together to make me uniquely qualified for this project.

If you would like to learn more about me and my qualifications, take a look at Dolls Magazine cover & feature article Oct 2017, or Stampington Art Dolls (both the current issue and the first one out in 2018 have articles on me now). Hawaiian Airlines Award Winning HanaHou magazine, Puppen Speilzig in Germany and many other magazines from around the world have featured me and my work for years now.  I own my own gallery on the North Shore of Oahu in the famous surf town of Haleiwa.  See video below or Check out my website at www.BoBergemann.com.

Important & Realistic Goals:

My sincere hope is to use these truly unique patent pending dolls to meet three goals.   I will move through the following goals in sequential order as time, energy and funding is made available to do so. 

1) Produce & Deliver a valuable educational tool (ASL Educational Tool Version DOLLS) to qualified therapists and teachers to help them teach ASL to young children in need in a hands on fun and interactive way.

2) Produce and offer an affordable, child safety tested, actual toy version ASL doll to be enjoyed in the homes of the deaf, hard of hearing and others who may benefit, like autistic children who do not speak and other non-verbal people (with various underlying causes of their being unable to speak).  If a child can not vocalize but can use their hands, ASL will work for them! 

3)Raise ASL understanding and awareness toward it's more generalized incorporation in US society in general.  I hope these will help educate the public, raising awareness of the need for effective ASL instruction and immersion education throughout the USA and wherever the deaf, hard of hearing and non-verbal live.  For example: I'm hoping all states will begin Incorporating at least one ASL immersive special ed classroom and instructor into at least one school in each community ASAP as a result of serious reconsideration of needs for ASL instruction.  If this really takes off as I hope.  Then I hope it will spawn more people to champion making such opportunities a reality in every community in the USA.  Finally, I firmly believe ASL Dolls can be enjoyed by hearing toddlers too since most are only partially verbal.  Interactive role play with ASL dolls will actually heightened any toddler's later success in communication including such subjects in school as writing (a real struggle point in education in the US today.)

Raising a child with the challenges being deaf can create is expensive in time, energy and money. I know.  I've worked hard at my career in order to help make sure our daughter has every advantage at her disposal. She is blessed to have many opportunities that so many do not have, simply because my husband and I have been able to work very hard, save hard and make sacrifices to obtain these opportunities for her.  We both work 90+ hour weeks regularly.  I have also homeschooled her for much of her schooling because the opportunities for her to meet her own potential where we lived when she was growing up were sub par or non-existent.  A sad truth in many places in the USA Today.  I'm grateful the opportunities she needs now are available here where we live in California although it has cost our family dearly to make this move in order for this to happen for her.  She is worth it!

But, I know many families are not able to do the same for many and various good reasons.  I also know that as much as I long to be able to, our family simply can not afford to move this project forward any further completely on our own at this time. 

I've done as much as I can afford to put the time, energy and money into at this point entirely on my own out of love and longing to help others.  I will carry on in every way it's possible for me to do so in my passion to help those in need.  Just to be clear, my own daughter is long past the communication stages these dolls are meant to help teach.  Yet, I've poured a year of my life in addition to tens of thousands of dollars into this project to get it this far.  Now, I realize it's time I simply must ask for others who are willing and able, to help me take this project to fruition.

Next Steps Needed . . . We have a preliminary prototype!

I created a preliminary prototype in the form of an original fine art doll using a resin BJD created entirely by me as my medium.  You can learn more, see photos and video of this original fine art doll in action and get more info. on all of this by watching the 10 minute video below which has a lot more to it than the mini video at the top of this campaign.

What We Need Now...

My goals are lofty and come with a price tag to match.  But, every little bit will help us move toward our goals because I am not one to give up easily when I'm passionate about something.  

Progress toward Goal #1:  I am doing more work on my preliminary prototype to add changing face plates for expressive faces since facial expression is a huge part of American Sign Language communication.  This will result in the educational and therapeutic tool once every additional part needed is complete to include the 20+ words and letters the doll can already express plus keywords like Who, What, When, Where, Why & How, all the vowels, top 10 key consonants for early spelling and another 10+ early conversational word hand shapes.  Once this next more advanced prototype is designed and complete, it should be very close to the educational therapeutic tool we hope to offer ready for production.

Progress toward Goal #2 & 3 will be dependent on first meeting goal #1.  

The toy version doll is a whole other story, but one I believe needs to be told.  The bottom line is toys can become trends and trends sincerely effect the entire population.  My earnest hope is to create and offer a toy doll that will become a trend such that over the next decade every household in the USA will be learning "basic simple conversational and emergency needs" words commonly used in American Sign Language!  This would of course make a huge impact on goal #3!

USA Toy Testing standards must be met which are expensive.  Molds for vinyl doll pieces and parts are in the tens of thousands per piece.  This doll will have 23 pieces to make up the fully jointed body, add the back of the head and at least 3 expressive face plates and 25+ hands, will mean over 50 molds at thousands of dollars each!   Plastic may be a better & more affordable medium via new 3d printing tech. I'm looking into all of it now. Either route will be used to bring down end per piece costs to a point at which most Americans can afford such dolls for their children.  Now you know why I'd love for an angel investor to jump in to support this cause!

Any amount you can spare will help bring this project to fruition.  I will simply proceed as funding comes in for each step forward to be completed.  If you can give $5 and tell your friends about our campaign here, you will be a huge help to whom we, and those who will be truly helped by these,  will be grateful!

I'm hoping to raise the $775,000 needed to successfully and quickly meet goals 1 & 2 for limited initial offerings large enough to make them affordable.  The higher number of product in an initial run, though it may be more expensive to set up, results in the eventual per piece costs going down. 

Impact. . .

I honestly believe there is a real market in the USA for the toy version with ALL children even those who can hear since learning ASL as a baby and toddler actually increases brain connections and communication potential making for little ones who get along better and have a real advantage in education throughout their lives.  In fact, I believe the entire USA education system should be looking to use ASL in head start programs because then I believe kids who are at risk will become kids who are exceeding potential!

Obviously this project has far greater ramifications and long term potential than there is time or space to discuss here.  In time, every deaf and hard of hearing child as well as autistic and other non-verbal children could be able to easily readily obtain their own doll if this all works out as well as I sincerely hope!  Hearing babies & toddlers and their parents who want to communicate with them better will want a beautiful doll to help them learn ASL, gaining brain connections early that will help throughout their education as well.  All while simply playing dolls!  Wonderful stop motion videos and role play videos could be made to add to teaching potential as well.  Then, we can up production to bring down per piece pricing over time.  ASL is actually fast becoming THE sign language used in many countries besides the USA.  It is also the 4th most studied language in the USA.  However, we could also make BSL (British Sign Language) and other country versions in time as well.

In the meantime, looking at goal #3 Raising ASL Awareness in US culture, I sincerely hope this campaign and the next steps after it will help expand the American people's awareness and understanding of the key that ASL truly is to potential for the deaf and non-verbal people of this world.  Including everyone's own babies and toddlers!  

ASL has potential to open up a world of communication and connection for so many!  Cochlear implants are not necessarily the answer, as we ourselves found out.  Without going into too much detail here, suffice it to say putting a cochlear implant on a deaf person can sometimes be very much like putting glasses on a blind person.  There is so much more to it than simple mechanics and digital solutions can actually make up for.  Visual education in an ASL and congruent spoken language immersion program is truly the answer here.

Other ways to help . . .

​1) Check out www.BoBergemann.com to see a very special offer to purchase an original artist doll named Alice on pre-order now.  This doll will come with just a handful of ASL hand shapes like those shown in the video as my first stage preliminary prototype here to showcase how exactly this is all meant to work for those who want to see/touch/feel and try in person.   This Special Limited Edition Signed Artist Doll BJD Pre-Order will run contingent to this Indiegogo campaign and I will be donating a portion of my proceeds to this endeavor.  So, if you would like to buy a doll on pre-order now to be fulfilled next Spring please do so at www.BoBergemann.com.  I have a flawless reputation for delivering on time as promised ALWAYS!  And in this case you will be purchasing through my own business website, so you will be a customer and have an order I will also fulfill on time as promised as I've done for 7 years straight now!

Something everyone can do to help is . . .

2) Please Share this campaign with others.  This first doll showcased here is named Alice after the little girl whose charming personality and intelligence inspired Thomas Hopkins Gallaudet to begin teaching her Sign Language which later lead to the start of the first ASL immersion school in America. That man cared sincerely for someone he was not even related to.  Please choose to do the same!

Please join with my daughter and I in the same spirit of caring and connection Thomas Hopkins Gauladet had that saw Alice's very real need to connect and communicate so he did something to meet it.  Please partner with us here today.  

Every little bit, whether awareness is increased or funding is increased, helps!  So, even if you can't give now, share this to your FB page, your other social networks and maybe someone it reaches can!  In the end AWARENESS of a problem is key to the beginning of it's solution!  Everyone who sees this can share it which will help with goal #4 at the very least.

Together, we can truly make a difference in the life of someone who might otherwise live a  separated and unnecessarily disconnected lonely life in which their own potential is simply never realized or even explored.  The fact this is still so prevalent in modern America today is truly sad and unacceptable.  Please join with us to make a real difference today!

Mahalo,

Bo Bergemann
story_txt: Aloha!My name is Bo Bergemann and this is my daughter Bree.   I am an award winning world renown original doll artist from Hawaii.  Bree is a full time student.  We are quite the dynamic duo in all things in life for 17 years now and we are hoping you will join us in our newest adventure!My daughter, Bree, is deaf.  Our family has lived her lifetime trying to help her grow skills in both expressive and receptive communication so she can effectively connect with others and our world.  Communication and connection are so important to a person's spiritual, emotional, physical & psychological well being.  Something most of us take for granted.  I know I did before I met my daughter.  Communication is also the key to learning and education which is key to growth and independence.I took care of some of Hawaii's most medically fragile foster babies for 15 years, during which time I fostered a sweet baby girl who was deaf that stole our family's hearts.  So, when she became adoptable, we were very grateful and immediately made her our own!  A lot has happened in the years since, but the journey to assist her to communicate and connect with the world is a demanding, continuing and ongoing process for us all.  At her request, she and I recently moved to Fremont, CA for her to be able to attend one of the nation's leading schools for the deaf.  It is an American Sign Language (ASL) immersion program.  She wanted to go there because she wanted to be with other kids who are also deaf and to be immersed in an ASL and visual learning environment.  The opportunities for her abound in this environment, so we are very grateful she is attending there now.  She is an A student and we are all very proud of her!  This is one of only a handful of such school in the USA doing a really great job for the deaf and hard of hearing today.Sadly, the opportunities for deaf children to learn and grow in ASL (American Sign Language) usage are far and few between in most other places nowadays.  Even in the USA of today.  American Sign Language and it's very real impact upon those who need it is far too misunderstood.  The resources are few.  The demand is spread out, not centralized, so no one is as aware of, nor well informed nor enabled as is truly needed, in my opinion from our own experience.I believe something as simple as a doll can make a huge difference!  Realizing the deficit between ASL educational opportunities and the real need in most communities in the USA Today, I decided to make an ASL doll.  Anyone can role play with and learn to communicate using such a doll.  Dolls can go into homes, workplaces, vehicles as well as educational and therapeutic environments where the children who need to learn ASL are.  Dolls are simple early developmental stage tools to teach both communication and connection.  Key reasons for American Sign Language to be taught to the deaf, hard of hearing, and other non-verbal children through dolls.Check out this brief video which shows the preliminary prototype in action!There is a longer video with more to it at the bottom of this campaign explanation.  Read on for more detailed facts.What Makes Me Think I Can Do This?I have been making dolls for 25 years.  I've run a successful business selling my fine art dolIs for 7 years now.  I also created my own award winning vinyl doll line known as Trendy & Swag which won Dolls Magazine's Industries Choice Play Doll of the year in 2015 & 2016 as well as People's Choice in the latter beating out others worldwide in the 18" Play Doll category.  I designed, sculpted, produced, fulfilled and oversaw every aspect of this line.  So, I know the industry and have the skillset, connections and experience to make this happen.  Frankly, so do companies like AG or other well known doll companies.  But, I also have the desire to see this very real need of the deaf & non-verbal communities met.  These two factors work together to make me uniquely qualified for this project.If you would like to learn more about me and my qualifications, take a look at Dolls Magazine cover & feature article Oct 2017, or Stampington Art Dolls (both the current issue and the first one out in 2018 have articles on me now). Hawaiian Airlines Award Winning HanaHou magazine, Puppen Speilzig in Germany and many other magazines from around the world have featured me and my work for years now.  I own my own gallery on the North Shore of Oahu in the famous surf town of Haleiwa.  See video below or Check out my website at www.BoBergemann.com.Important & Realistic Goals:My sincere hope is to use these truly unique patent pending dolls to meet three goals.   I will move through the following goals in sequential order as time, energy and funding is made available to do so. 1) Produce & Deliver a valuable educational tool (ASL Educational Tool Version DOLLS) to qualified therapists and teachers to help them teach ASL to young children in need in a hands on fun and interactive way.2) Produce and offer an affordable, child safety tested, actual toy version ASL doll to be enjoyed in the homes of the deaf, hard of hearing and others who may benefit, like autistic children who do not speak and other non-verbal people (with various underlying causes of their being unable to speak).  If a child can not vocalize but can use their hands, ASL will work for them! 3)Raise ASL understanding and awareness toward it's more generalized incorporation in US society in general.  I hope these will help educate the public, raising awareness of the need for effective ASL instruction and immersion education throughout the USA and wherever the deaf, hard of hearing and non-verbal live.  For example: I'm hoping all states will begin Incorporating at least one ASL immersive special ed classroom and instructor into at least one school in each community ASAP as a result of serious reconsideration of needs for ASL instruction.  If this really takes off as I hope.  Then I hope it will spawn more people to champion making such opportunities a reality in every community in the USA.  Finally, I firmly believe ASL Dolls can be enjoyed by hearing toddlers too since most are only partially verbal.  Interactive role play with ASL dolls will actually heightened any toddler's later success in communication including such subjects in school as writing (a real struggle point in education in the US today.)Raising a child with the challenges being deaf can create is expensive in time, energy and money. I know.  I've worked hard at my career in order to help make sure our daughter has every advantage at her disposal. She is blessed to have many opportunities that so many do not have, simply because my husband and I have been able to work very hard, save hard and make sacrifices to obtain these opportunities for her.  We both work 90+ hour weeks regularly.  I have also homeschooled her for much of her schooling because the opportunities for her to meet her own potential where we lived when she was growing up were sub par or non-existent.  A sad truth in many places in the USA Today.  I'm grateful the opportunities she needs now are available here where we live in California although it has cost our family dearly to make this move in order for this to happen for her.  She is worth it!But, I know many families are not able to do the same for many and various good reasons.  I also know that as much as I long to be able to, our family simply can not afford to move this project forward any further completely on our own at this time. I've done as much as I can afford to put the time, energy and money into at this point entirely on my own out of love and longing to help others.  I will carry on in every way it's possible for me to do so in my passion to help those in need.  Just to be clear, my own daughter is long past the communication stages these dolls are meant to help teach.  Yet, I've poured a year of my life in addition to tens of thousands of dollars into this project to get it this far.  Now, I realize it's time I simply must ask for others who are willing and able, to help me take this project to fruition.Next Steps Needed . . . We have a preliminary prototype!I created a preliminary prototype in the form of an original fine art doll using a resin BJD created entirely by me as my medium.  You can learn more, see photos and video of this original fine art doll in action and get more info. on all of this by watching the 10 minute video below which has a lot more to it than the mini video at the top of this campaign.What We Need Now...My goals are lofty and come with a price tag to match.  But, every little bit will help us move toward our goals because I am not one to give up easily when I'm passionate about something.  Progress toward Goal #1:  I am doing more work on my preliminary prototype to add changing face plates for expressive faces since facial expression is a huge part of American Sign Language communication.  This will result in the educational and therapeutic tool once every additional part needed is complete to include the 20+ words and letters the doll can already express plus keywords like Who, What, When, Where, Why & How, all the vowels, top 10 key consonants for early spelling and another 10+ early conversational word hand shapes.  Once this next more advanced prototype is designed and complete, it should be very close to the educational therapeutic tool we hope to offer ready for production.Progress toward Goal #2 & 3 will be dependent on first meeting goal #1.  The toy version doll is a whole other story, but one I believe needs to be told.  The bottom line is toys can become trends and trends sincerely effect the entire population.  My earnest hope is to create and offer a toy doll that will become a trend such that over the next decade every household in the USA will be learning "basic simple conversational and emergency needs" words commonly used in American Sign Language!  This would of course make a huge impact on goal #3!USA Toy Testing standards must be met which are expensive.  Molds for vinyl doll pieces and parts are in the tens of thousands per piece.  This doll will have 23 pieces to make up the fully jointed body, add the back of the head and at least 3 expressive face plates and 25+ hands, will mean over 50 molds at thousands of dollars each!   Plastic may be a better & more affordable medium via new 3d printing tech. I'm looking into all of it now. Either route will be used to bring down end per piece costs to a point at which most Americans can afford such dolls for their children.  Now you know why I'd love for an angel investor to jump in to support this cause!Any amount you can spare will help bring this project to fruition.  I will simply proceed as funding comes in for each step forward to be completed.  If you can give $5 and tell your friends about our campaign here, you will be a huge help to whom we, and those who will be truly helped by these,  will be grateful!I'm hoping to raise the $775,000 needed to successfully and quickly meet goals 1 & 2 for limited initial offerings large enough to make them affordable.  The higher number of product in an initial run, though it may be more expensive to set up, results in the eventual per piece costs going down. Impact. . .I honestly believe there is a real market in the USA for the toy version with ALL children even those who can hear since learning ASL as a baby and toddler actually increases brain connections and communication potential making for little ones who get along better and have a real advantage in education throughout their lives.  In fact, I believe the entire USA education system should be looking to use ASL in head start programs because then I believe kids who are at risk will become kids who are exceeding potential!Obviously this project has far greater ramifications and long term potential than there is time or space to discuss here.  In time, every deaf and hard of hearing child as well as autistic and other non-verbal children could be able to easily readily obtain their own doll if this all works out as well as I sincerely hope!  Hearing babies & toddlers and their parents who want to communicate with them better will want a beautiful doll to help them learn ASL, gaining brain connections early that will help throughout their education as well.  All while simply playing dolls!  Wonderful stop motion videos and role play videos could be made to add to teaching potential as well.  Then, we can up production to bring down per piece pricing over time.  ASL is actually fast becoming THE sign language used in many countries besides the USA.  It is also the 4th most studied language in the USA.  However, we could also make BSL (British Sign Language) and other country versions in time as well.In the meantime, looking at goal #3 Raising ASL Awareness in US culture, I sincerely hope this campaign and the next steps after it will help expand the American people's awareness and understanding of the key that ASL truly is to potential for the deaf and non-verbal people of this world.  Including everyone's own babies and toddlers!  ASL has potential to open up a world of communication and connection for so many!  Cochlear implants are not necessarily the answer, as we ourselves found out.  Without going into too much detail here, suffice it to say putting a cochlear implant on a deaf person can sometimes be very much like putting glasses on a blind person.  There is so much more to it than simple mechanics and digital solutions can actually make up for.  Visual education in an ASL and congruent spoken language immersion program is truly the answer here.Other ways to help . . .​1) Check out www.BoBergemann.com to see a very special offer to purchase an original artist doll named Alice on pre-order now.  This doll will come with just a handful of ASL hand shapes like those shown in the video as my first stage preliminary prototype here to showcase how exactly this is all meant to work for those who want to see/touch/feel and try in person.   This Special Limited Edition Signed Artist Doll BJD Pre-Order will run contingent to this Indiegogo campaign and I will be donating a portion of my proceeds to this endeavor.  So, if you would like to buy a doll on pre-order now to be fulfilled next Spring please do so at www.BoBergemann.com.  I have a flawless reputation for delivering on time as promised ALWAYS!  And in this case you will be purchasing through my own business website, so you will be a customer and have an order I will also fulfill on time as promised as I've done for 7 years straight now!Something everyone can do to help is . . .2) Please Share this campaign with others.  This first doll showcased here is named Alice after the little girl whose charming personality and intelligence inspired Thomas Hopkins Gallaudet to begin teaching her Sign Language which later lead to the start of the first ASL immersion school in America. That man cared sincerely for someone he was not even related to.  Please choose to do the same!Please join with my daughter and I in the same spirit of caring and connection Thomas Hopkins Gauladet had that saw Alice's very real need to connect and communicate so he did something to meet it.  Please partner with us here today.  Every little bit, whether awareness is increased or funding is increased, helps!  So, even if you can't give now, share this to your FB page, your other social networks and maybe someone it reaches can!  In the end AWARENESS of a problem is key to the beginning of it's solution!  Everyone who sees this can share it which will help with goal #4 at the very least.Together, we can truly make a difference in the life of someone who might otherwise live a  separated and unnecessarily disconnected lonely life in which their own potential is simply never realized or even explored.  The fact this is still so prevalent in modern America today is truly sad and unacceptable.  Please join with us to make a real difference today!Mahalo,Bo Bergemann

story:
"Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world"

By Nelson Mandela

"Every Child has the Right to get better Education"​​

Frank Swai and Rev. Joshua laiser are the founders of Pambazuka Naisinyai School. The idea of starting Pambazuka Naisinyai School came to the mind of Frank and Joshua after seeing the challenges facing Maasai communities in Tanzania. Rev. Joshua is a Maasai by tribe and he was born and raised in the Maasai communities so he knows much about the challenges facing his communities.He says "Education has been severe challenge in the Maasai communities as most of families don't know the importance of education for future life of their children. So we are working hard to educate parents and community in general so that they can know the importance of education. So the Pambazuka Naisinyai School is for Maasai children and nearby communities. Please join us and donate something to support this project!!

Our School Started under the tree

Our school started under the tree as we do not have resources to help us for building classes for the Maasai children. Education should start with their parents to educate them so that they can know the importance of education to their children. Some of the parents are now aware about education to their children so they are allowing them to attend school. We are still talking to the parents so that they can give us a good cooperation.

Students and their teacher having class session under the tree

 

Early Marriage and circumcision for the young Maasai girls.

Imagine a world where every child is educated and can contribute to the development process!!

So many times parents in Maasai  areas tend to give away their young girls for marriage in exchange for just a kilogram of sugar, a goat, a cow , some tea leaves and sometimes for salt. These young girls are then subjected to domestic violence, torture, early child birth and many times girls have died while giving birth because their bodies are never ready to experience child birth.

Many times the parents to these girls need to be empowered with information about the benefits of keeping their children in school until they complete their education. Once these girls have acquired the education, they can provide all the above mentioned items to their parents for the rest of their lives. All that parents need to to practice some bit of patience and sacrifice a little in order to enjoy the fruits of their children.

Circumcision for the women is prohibited but Maasai societies they still circumcise their young girls. We are working hard to educate them so that they can stop this.

Its time to reach out to the parents in the Maasai land settings and sensitize them if we want a better future for girls. A future where they can participate in leadership positions. A future where they can make informed choices and start up families the the men of their choice.

The time is now. Lets teach the Parents because they need this knowledge.

Maasai girls

 

Young Boys:  Young boys normally are send to keep cows and goats far away from home and come back evening everyday. Others they like to go to school but not allowed to go!!

Young Maasai Kids in the bush keeping cows

Education: Most of Maasai children don't go to school due to the environment they are living. Their parent don't understand the importance of their children to get better education. So we are trying our level best to educate these Maasai societies so that they can allow their children to go to school. Also there are scarcity of nearest school in their areas so we are working hard to build school near them to attract and convince their parent to allow them to attend school.

Our effort made us to start building Pambazuka Naisinyai School http://www.pambazuka.sc.tz  for which this school started under the tree but with our own effort we have managed to build some two classes and bought some desks so we need to work hard to make it happen!!

 

WHY THIS CAMPAIGN IS IMPORTANT

We decided to start a school in Maasai society so as to convince the Maasai on Education. Maasai society is leaving a life with no permanent settlement, thus not getting a chance for schooling. Also the society lives a life of animal husbandry which is difficult for parents to allow their children in distant schools due to they depend of them for rearing animals. Therefore starting a school within Maasai society will convince parents allowing their children to attend school near by them. That is the school I started within Maasai society is purposely to help the Maasai children. It is called PAMBAZUKA NAISINYAI PRE & PRIMARY SCHOOL         http://www.pambazuka.sc.tz   . Already our school has grade one (1) with 65 pupils , grade two with 55 and grade three with 35  pupils and 4 teachers who use most of their time teaching the children for most of them can’t speak neither Swahili nor English, but Maasai language.

Student doing class work on the ground

 

 NEW TWO CLASSES

Through our own efforts we have managed to build two classes where grade one and two are using for studying. We have more 10 acres where we want to build more classes as we have more students coming soon. We want to build more classes up to seven classes, we also need to build kitchen, toilet as the one we have is not enough, computers and computer lab, well for keeping water as there is scarcity of water, desks, books, office for teachers, salaries for teachers.

Our two New Classes

Our future plans are to have secondary school up to university among Maasai society in order to have education nearby so as to fight poverty by getting good education.

  The importance of this campaign is to construct a school within Maasai society, also helping Maasai society withdraw from ignorance and illiteracy so a t cope with the changes of the world.

Under Construction please help a bit

What We Need 

We need to do the following so that we can get our school off the ground; Seven more classes, computer room, Library, computers, Office for the staff, Kitchen, Good toilet, Reading books, tank for water storage and bin maize and beans storage, lunch for the teachers and students, salaries for teachers, Scholarship and to build fence around the school. The estimation costs is $150,000.  "Every bit will help"

 

Desks: We have managed to buy some desks for one class so class one will not sit on the ground again. Please support us so that we can buy more desks and build more classes!!

Classroom

THE FOLLOWING ARE THE REASONS AS TO WHY MY PROJECT IS VALUABLE TO DONORS AND THE WORLD

  This project is very important to donors and world at large for it will connect us with Maasai society for they shall be able to communicate with different people of different nations of the world. Also this will give chance for donors to come and visit Maasai society and learn the real life and culture of Maasai. Apart from that it also helps to eradicate the number of illiterates in the world.

 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

1. Due to studying environment being of low standard life, it is difficult to get skilled teachers and faithful constructors.

2. Another challenge is teacher's salaries, where by in order to get good trainers you also have to pay them well.

3. Another challenge is that , the pupils are fluently speaking Maasai native language, while their teachers don’t know the language and thus difficult to teach them

4. Due to that parents couldn’t get education, and then they find no importance to take their children to school.

Men at work bringing  clean water at Pambazuka School, Please help

 

 HOW TO OVERCOME THE CHALLENGES

1. Improving the teaching environment so as to encourage trained teachers to come and teach in our school. Also getting enough trusted constructors for constructing the building.

2. Increasing teacher's salaries so as to motivate the coming of more teachers.

3. Educating parents’ house by house on the importance of taking their children to school.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please tell friends and family about our campaign and our socially-good mission!

Please share our campaign page through the IndieGoGo share buttons on our campaign page!

Please share our campaign on your social networks such as facebook, twitter e.t.c

Thank you very much for your support! Every bit is greatly appreciated!

What you get once you support us (The Perks!!)

T- Shirt (Will send your size and different color with different images)

 

Maasai Children Photo or post card!!

 

 

Big 5 Photo!! ( We will send you one photo of Big 5)

 

Maasai Shuka ( There are of different types for men and women) will send two pairs.

 

Hat with Kilimanjaro word or any other photo of wildlife in Tanzania

School website: www.pambazuka.sc.tz

Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/Pambazuka-Naisinyai-Sc...

Twitter:   https://twitter.com/PambazukaSchool

story:
Learn more about Us!

My name is Elijah Gilmore and many people know me a touring jazz drummer, but many don't know that I was raised in the inner city of Cleveland Ohio!

Yes, I've been blessed to work with many national artist, and yes you can hear my latest album, Return to Zen, over the airways, however my life could have easily ended up a total different way.. Music saved my life!!

This is why The Levite Academy of Performing Arts is so important to me; I realize the impact that music can make on a inner city child's life! Many of Our children are coming out of broken homes with high levels of stress and anxiety, and drumming acts as therapy for many of Our children!

Most inner city schools have removed music programs due to lack of funding, so if We are able to acquire 23 Djembe drums by October 11th this will allow Us to provide music for our inner city children, and additionally help Us to provide a sufficient amount of drums for our average drum therapy sessions! We believe that everyone child should be able to experience the gift of music!

 

Our Goal = 23 Djembe Drums

Learn more about Us!
My name is Elijah Gilmore and many people know me a touring jazz drummer, but many don't know that I was raised in the inner city of Cleveland Ohio!
Yes, I've been blessed to work with many national artist, and yes you can hear my latest album, Return to Zen, over the airways, however my life could have easily ended up a total different way.. Music saved my life!!
This is why The Levite Academy of Performing Arts is so important to me; I realize the impact that music can make on a inner city child's life! Many of Our children are coming out of broken homes with high levels of stress and anxiety, and drumming acts as therapy for many of Our children!

story:
*English below*


Nous sommes deux passionnés d'alimentation et de saines habitudes de vie. Ayant tous les deux eu un passé relativement destructeur, un jour, nous nous sommes réveillés et le désir de repartir à zéro était plus fort que tout. Nous avons fait le ménage dans notre entourage, dans notre vie et avons éliminés tout agents destructeurs. Notre vie a fait un virage dont nous sommes plus que reconnaissants. Ce nouveau mode de vie, cette passion, nous a amené à former notre équipe, à nous informer, à faire de multiples recherches, à faire plusieurs expérimentations et aller chercher de l'information auprès de différents professionnels. Nous constatons que l'alimentation est la base de tout. C'est ce qui nous permet d'être en vie. L'alimentation devrait, selon nous, être une priorité pour tous.

De nos jours, il y a tellement de discours différents voire même contradictoires sur l'alimentation, ce qui peut devenir tout un défi pour les gens. Il est très facile de s'y perdre et surtout, de se décourager.

Nous nous sommes positionnés à travers cette tempête d'idéologies et nous souhaitons servir de guide pour quiconque désirant enclencher un processus personnel vers une santé optimale.

Seulement un de nous a obtenu le certificat d'Alimentation Sportive 1 offert par Coach Export, à Montréal. Ce qui nous aiderait énormément à enrichir nos connaissances serait que nous puissions tous les deux faire les formations nécessaires dont Alimentation Sportive 2 de Coach Export ainsi que BioPrint de Charles R. Poliquin qui offrent une formation complète et grandement enrichissante. Nous avons les meilleures intentions du monde en voulant faire ces formations et ainsi changer la vie de plusieurs, voir peut-être la vôtre. Notre objectif est de bâtir notre entreprise de Coaching en alimentation.

Les coûts de ces formations sont pour nous, très dispendieux. Nous faisons de grands efforts pour y parvenir mais nous avons pensé faire appel à la communauté pour nous donner un coup de pouce dans la réalisation de ce projet de vie.

Nous sommes déjà très reconnaissants que vous ayez pris le temps de lire notre histoire et toute aide de votre part serait grandement appréciée. Que vous nous aidiez avec un dollar, 20 dollars ou 500 dollars, peu importe votre coup de main, pour nous, ça ferait une énorme différence.

Une bouchée à la fois, nous serons là pour vous, vos enfants, votre famille et pour quiconque désirant optimiser leur santé. Notre mission est d'inspirer, guider et épauler une personne à la fois, dans son cheminement vers une santé optimale.

Merci mille fois.

Eduardo De Albernaz et Marie-Michèle Fogarty

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

We are both very passionate about nutrition and healthy life choices. After years of leading a destructive life path, we both one day woke up and the desire to reset our lives was our driving force. We cleaned up our entourage, our habits and eliminated all destructive behaviour. This new way of life, this passion, created this team we are now and drove us to look for better knowledge, to do more research and a some experiments while consulting multiple professionals. We realized that nutrition is the foundation of everything we do. It is what allows us to be alive. We believe nutrition should be a priority to everyone.

Today, there are several different, even contradictory, opinions on nutrition and figuring out what's really best can become a real challenge. It is very easy to get lost  and discouraged in all that information and, specially, misinformation.

We have taken a stand among this storm of ideas and we would like to serve as guides to anyone in their personal process towards optimal health.

Only one of us has the Sports Nutrition 1 certificate, given by Coach Export in Montreal. If we could both have the Sports Nutrition 1 and 2 certificates by Coach Export and the BioPrint Seminar by Charles R. Poliquin would really help us tremendously to become more knowledgeable as these courses are extremely enriching and enlightening. Our intention in doing these courses is to be able to change lives, maybe even yours. Our goal is to build our own Nutrition Coaching business.

The cost of these courses are, for us, very high. We are doing great efforts to get there but we thought that asking for a little assistance from the community could  help us a lot!

We are already greatful that you have taken the time to read our story thus far and any help from you would be greatly appreciated. Whether it is one dollar, 20 dollars or 800 dollars, every little incentive will make a big difference for us.

One bite at a time, we will be there for you, your kids, your family and anyone wanting to optimise their health. Our mission is to inspire, guide and support one person at a time in their path towards optimal health.

Many thanks,

Eduardo De Albernaz et Marie-Michèle Fogarty

story:
When I learned about the devastating earthquake in Nepal, I was heartbroken. I spent two months in Nepal in 2014, volunteering for a nonprofit social services organization called Kopila-Nepal. Kopila-Nepal works to better the lives of women, children, and disabled persons and to foster the psychosocial well-being of communities in the Gandaki Zone in western Nepal and recently started a center for the management of child trauma in Kathmandu. Right now, Kopila staff are busy throughout the region affected by the earthquake, providing everything from basic survival supplies to trauma counseling. I am organizing this fundraising campaign on behalf of Kopila's efforts to provide relief and counseling in the Kathmandu area and in and around the earthquake's epicenter in Lamjung, which is located inside Kopila's work area in the Gandaki Zone. Given the exchange rate between the Nepalese rupee and the American dollar and the poverty in which many Nepalis live, a very small contribution from the US can go a long way in Nepal. Even a contribution as small as $5 could make a difference.

Kopila Nepal

What makes Kopila unique is its focus on mental health, which is a relatively new concept in Nepal. Nepali culture still stigmatizes the mentally ill, who are seen as weak and unfit for society and sometimes even as possessed by demons and spirits. Kopila has a staff of young, dedicated psychologists and counselors who go out into the community and work with the destitute, the abused, and the traumatized. Due to Kopila's efforts, clients in remote rural regions have received medical psychiatric care, including anti-depressant medication that enables them to enjoy their families and join in the social life of their villages. This emphasis on mental health come from the recognition that attending to quality of life can sometimes be just as important as ensuring survival and meeting basic needs.

Kopila has deployed  a team of psychologists to Kathmandu  to provide psychological first-aid to earthquake survivors, many of whom have lost their homes and loved ones. In addition, Kopila staff are bringing much-needed supplies into the remote rural villages in the mountains around the quake epicenter where some communities have been waiting for days without relief. Tents, food, and other supplies are being distributed to survivors throughout the Gorkha, Lamjung, and Kaski Districts. Staff are providing support and counseling to injured victims in the hospital in Pokhara. Kopila has strong, experienced leadership and a staff of young, dedicated counselors and psychologists. Each staff member has sacrificed two days of his or her meager salary to help fund these relief activities.

During my time in Nepal, I lived and worked in Pokhara, and also spent time in Kathmandu, Chitwan, Bandipur, and Syangja District.  The photos of some of the structures that symbolize this country's unique and beautiful culture and history brought tears to my eyes. But more than that, I was extremely worried for the welfare of the friends I made and of the warm, friendly, and resilient people I met during my stay.

Nepal is very poor; the United Nations classifies Nepal as a least-developed nation, and it currently ranks 145th out of 187 nations on the Human Development Index.  Nepal is still suffering the effects of a decade-long civil war that ended in 2006. Government instability and political infighting has made it difficult for the country to advance economically and socially, but Nepal has been making progress and has specified a target date of 2022 for emerging from least-developed nation status. The devastation of this earthquake will compound the hardships faced by the Nepali people, both long-term and on a day-to-day basis, and could potentially set back Nepal's economic progress by years.

Nepal will need a lot of help to move forward through this catastrophe. Kopila has a strong commitment to the communities it serves and a long track record of success in helping the needy and fostering psychosocial well-being in villages throughout western Nepal. They have well established working areas in the regions closest to the earthquake's epicenter, and they are in the earthquake response effort for the long haul. If you are considering donating money to relief efforts in Nepal, there are many large, western-based organizations to choose from.  But you may also choose to donate to a smaller organization based in Nepal that already has deepr roots in the affected communities and will remain on the ground in the weeks,  months, and years to come.

As a past volunteer, I have no reservations about urging to you to donate to Kopila. All funds donated here will go directly to Kopila. These are good  people, and they will do good things with your donations.

story:
Short Summary

The Open Floor Society is thrilled to launch a summer youth program at partner organization, Heart of Los Angeles (H.O.L.A.) on June 22nd!

In this 6-day workshop, students will experience and participate in the art of improvisation through live music and dance, lead by a culturally diverse collection of professional artists.  TOFS has been gearing up for this program by holding monthly "Introduction to Improvisation" workshops and exhibitions at H.O.L.A. since late 2014. Witnessing the enthusiastic engagement of both students and artists, we are excited to offer an extended program this summer. 

Professional dancers, Carolina Cerisola and Sascha Escandon, co-founded The Open Floor Society, 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization, as an outgrowth of their initial company, Floor Productions - a passion-driven enterprise that fosters creative expression in movement and live music, established in 2008.  Their experience, along with an incredible network of exceptional artists, instills in them the responsibility to help preserve the value of culture in our society by directly passing down live arts to future generations.  The Open Floor Society stands on the belief that artistic expression can change lives and empower young people, thereby benefit our society as a whole. 

The Open Floor Society means to amplify the already documented benefits of music and dance education by adding the powerful element of improvisation. We are dedicated to making improvisation-based music and dance education accessible to all young people, and in particular to serve those for whom the opportunity to participate in such activities is not a part of their educational or community life. Further, our vision is to connect young people with working artists, who as teachers and mentors can pass their craft to the next generation through dynamic and sequential free programs. 

What We Need 

  • The fundraising goal for our Summer Youth Program 2015 is $5000. 
  • Thus far, all of our instructors have volunteered their time to give back to the community and pass down their craft. Majority of funds raised through Indiegogo will go directly to our incredible instructors who will commit to a 6 day program, 3-4 hours a day. 
  • Funds will also be used for any extra materials needed for the program, such as additional instrument rentals or purchasing noise makers or prop materials, etc. to allow for more extensive participation. 
  • A small portion of the funds will be used to document our program, creating material for future sponsorship and promotional opportunities. 
  • Funds raised beyond our goal go right back to the cause, helping in the creation and enhancement of future programs.

story:
What Amal (Hope) will do for the world

For over a decade, we have all seen and heard about the horrifying war crimes that radical groups and individuals around the world are committing each and every day.  In response to this enormous threat to civilization, the international community has led military forces to begin the fight to defeat the radical groups. However, the unfortunate truth is that in order to eradicate the terrible ideology behind these groups, action must be taken to identify the origin of this horror and correct it. Amal (Hope) is a non-profit organization which aims to do just this; we are working to end extremism by tackling the roots of the issue and establishing a long-term solution so that this problem does not continue into the future.


Our Vision 

Our mission will be accomplished when we have an educated public and an engaged community, where vulnerable teens and adults feel protected and valued, when we win the battle of the heart and mind. Our vision will come when young men see extremism for the destructive lie that it really is, and when these young people make decisions to strengthen families and communities instead of defending violent ideologies. Moderate Muslims, like me, need to be on the front-lines of this battle, challenging violent and self-defeating belief structures, and helping to expose the horrible consequences of extremism. Extremism thrives when we obsess over insignificant differences (skin color, religion, etc). Our goal, then, is to help these bright young people to appreciate our similarities, soften hearts that have been hardened by an ideology that isolate them from the civilized society, and encourage them to 'Live and let live'

My wish for this campaign is to impress the world by what we can achieve together. This campaign will establish real change in the world, and provide an appealing alternative to extremism. The success of this campaign will be an affront to radical groups as we stand with the victims of terror, helping them overcome the reach of extremism and helping them thrive in a caring, effective, and civilized community. In order for vision, this campaign must stretch into even the most unstable and isolated populations. This will not be easy. We cannot do this on our own. We need the support of those who stand up for peace. We need the help of those who believe in civilized social values, and who have a heart to protect future generations from the violence and fear that extremists rely on.  

Your contribution will be the driving force that transforms Amal (Hope) from an idea to an active organization where you can be part of the change. This is our chance to unite our hopes and efforts with those of the international community in order to end the terrible ideology that feeds radical groups around the world.  Most importantly though, you will help us support the people whose lives can be affected by radical groups’ actions and make a strong statement to the international community,  and take real actions to solve this problem.  We believe that Amal (Hope) will benefit the public enormously and will contribute to tackling the social factors at the root of extremism.

With your help, we will be able to make real changes that will impact the world and help make it safe both for us and for future generations.


Other Ways You Can Help

There are many different ways that you can help 

  • Spread the word and share this campaign with your friends and family 
  • Share your feedback and thoughts with us so we can improve
  • Join the conversation on twitter #EndExtremism  
  • Like the facebook page and get engaged with the post
  • Share your idea of an anti-extremism movie with us  

Transparency

The organization will be registered as "charitable incorporated organisation (CIO) (based on Nottingham, United Kingdom) and all the information will be available publicly which will include the organization activity and financial details. 


Please feel free to reach us if you have any question or concern

story:
Please help us fund The first Sizanani Takoma Teen Leadership Camp!  We are bringing the best of Camp Sizanani, South Africa to Takoma Park, MD!  Please contribute here, all donations are tax deductible and go to MANUP and Global Camps Africa.  www.manupnow.org. and www.globalcampsafrica.org.
The Sizanani Takoma Leadership Camp is a co-creation of MANUP (Making A New United People) and Global Camps Africa, and will be run by Global Camps Africa with MANUP in TP.  Our camp is modeled after Camp Sizanani in South Africa.  MANUP has been mentoring African-American teenagers in Takoma Park for 10 years.  We are partnering with the City of Takoma Park for the location and outdoor fields.  We have a special group of very skilled and experienced camp counselors from Camp Sizanani in South Africa coming to join us for this unique, cross-cultural leadership camp for American teens.  For more than 10 years, Camp Sizanani has been teaching youth life skills, self-empowerment, as well as community, and fun (and all the joyful camp experiences of sports, arts and crafts, songs, adventure, dance, theatre).  Three experienced Camp Sizanani Counselors are traveling here from South Africa, to lead the daily camp experience in Takoma Park, MD.  They are Thembi Joja, Kutlwano (Kay) Phatlane, and Sifiso Tawane.  All are experienced leading sports, arts and crafts, adventure, songs, self-esteem, life skills, leadership skills, and community building. 
The Sizanani Takoma Teen Leadership Camp will be FREE of charge.  The camp is geared toward creating a leadership camp experience for teens who do not otherwise have summer camp options.  Participating families who are economically privileged will be encouraged to make a contribution.  All donations to fund the camp go directly to staff salaries and travel costs and the direct costs of operating the week long camp.  Contributions are tax deductible to MANUP and Global Camps Africa.  Our MINIMUM costs are: $3,000 for staff costs, $500 for lunches for the week, and $500 for other costs (such as art supplies and equipment).  We may need to pay for space/location needs, and potentially hire additional staff. 

We will be hosting a community wide Potluck Supper on THURSDAY evening AUGUST 27th.  We encourage all supporters to attend.

Please help us spread the word!  Please encourage donations to this unique, cross cultural camp experience for our local TP teens who will receive leadership training and a fantastic camp week.

story:
Short Summary


What is HELSUS?

  We have been measured, weighted and compared from the day we came into this world. During our lives, we are measured by our job, achievements, houses we own, cars we drive, income etc.

It makes us strive for more and more, and to become better than others and somehow it makes us feel more valuable.  It is a big competition as a rat race!

  We let the system to control us, we are working for the system, aren't we? We measure even our children by their achievements. We are transferring this model from generation to generation. Does this system allow us to be happy, to be healthy, to smile, to give and get, to follow our heart? Or does this system make us to run more and more, to consume more, to be better, to get more etc.?

  We have to realize that this life should be spent for the unity of mankind, as one body. 

  How can we encourage large amount of people to understand, that we are one body, one world. We cannot survive through our logical reasoning with the competitive mentality as one body in a long term.

  We have to go away from old limiting beliefs that brought us to the current situation, reconsider these beliefs so that we can take the next step forward to better world.

STOP! Get out of the rat race!

STOP! What do I really live for? Who am I?

  • HELSUS movement introduces schools with project "I choose to be famous", which means I choose to be truly me, as I like it to be, not as my family, teacher or friends are expecting. We are trying to get free from our cages.

  • HELSUS Festival. We inspire and encourage people for changes with HELSUS Festival. Helsus festival motto: follow your heart and learn to use language of hearth! Feed your soul and give this experience to the next generations. 

HELSUS Festival

We believe that we should start with ourselves.

HELSUS Festival works with following topics:

  • Who am I? How can I find it out? Different practices.

  • My interactions with universe. Academic studies and ancient knowledge.

  • Academic lectures.

  • Meet people, who are out of system and live their own lifes.

  • How to hear my HEART and how to follow it?

Helsus festival has 7 gardens. Each garden is devoted for a particular topic.

  • health,

  • healthy nutrition,

  • environment,

  • children,

  • soul,

  • self education,

  • practices e.g. yoga, Tai-Ci etc.

You can attend different lectures, concerts, workshops, student corners etc. at the Festival.

Our vision is that HELSUS Festival will become as international movement and will be held in different countries in the world.

HELSUS Festival will take place 21 and 22 May, year 2016 in Jelgava, Latvia.

Welcome, visit HELSUS Festival and our beautiful Latvia!




What We Need & What You Get

 

HELSUS Festival would appreciate financial support for following:

  • Main stage, lights, sound

  • Musicians

  • International lecturers

  • Toilets' rent for the festival area

  • Lecturers' equipment

  • Festival's area design

  • Rewards for our student project -Education of future

You are welcome to visit HELSUS Festival and spend wonderful days in Latvia!

You can get our assistance regarding festival and visit to Latvia by writing to info@helsusfestival.com or via Facebook page https://www.facebook.com/FestivalHelsus/?ref=hl.

The Impact

Why your help is needed.

HELSUS Festival is a movement about freedom from EGO, system, expectations, achievements, competition etc and that is not something that can be sold, but can be supported by society and movement members.

Annual festival is a good start to get new knowledge, meet amazing people, get inspired, widen consciousness, listen a lectures and celebrate the life!

All together we are one body. All together have the power to make changes, to step out of the system, to be truly OUR-SELVES. We can achieve it with knowledge, critical thinking and support from others!

Your financial support will make HELSUS Festival happen!

Risks & Challenges

We will not be able to invite important lecturers, and have nice big area for festival in the case we meet unsuccessful founding. We prepare whole year for this event by doing events, giving information, keeping relationships.

Our chalanage is to hand over knowledges to all people, so we together can live happy lives, treat ourselves as one body and keep our world healty .
We have many people around us with necessary knowledge and willing to be a helping, and we shall forward these knowledges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please, share the information about Helsus with your friends!
Please contact us, if you have surtain knowladge or experience that you want to share in the festival.

story:
• This is my time of asking,

    In a few days time I will arrive with 12 other people to attend a month-long process in California’s high Sierra desert to become a Vision-Fast  wilderness guide. Vision fast is a practice of bringing people into wild nature in ceremony. The role of the guide is to hold secure, ceremonial and practical space for the quester to find a deeper, more resilient self, an intimate connection with nature, and to experience a rite of passage. This process of stepping into a transition time, a letting go in pursuit of a vision or renewal has been an indigenous practice handed down, alongside Council, for thousands of years. 


    I invite you to become a part of my journey – With gratitude and in support of this opportunity, I am asking for community backing with my subsistence during this time, the food and water I will need.

    I have been on nomadic walkabout for the past 4 years, living into the practice of Council as a carrier, facilitator and trainer, answering the call to support a global community by training hundreds of people, sitting with youngers and elders, stepping into forums of indigenous wisdom. In order to do this work, I have lived principally from savings as I have not yet found a way for the Council work to sustain me financially.

    A clear presence came to me earlier in the year despite this lack of funds, to step up and deepen my connection to vision fast as part of my practice of living Council, a circle of life that will help me to carry forward the teachings held in essence with nature.

    If you feel inspired by this journey, please send me anything that would give you pleasure, and in turn I welcome your gifts and will carry them forward through this work and way of life.


    The details:

    The training takes place next month in the Owens Valley, between the Sierra and Inyo mountains in California. The photos I have used here were taken 2 years ago between these two ranges on the personal 12-day quest that affirmed the work I do with Council, and why I do it. That weird thing is a petroglyph that some say predates those who lived here over 9,000 yrs ago...

    The cost of my flight, food, equipment, month-long and gifting the trainers, comes to around £3,300, (an amount I normally live on for 6 months!) I have already used funds from my savings to pay for the flight and two-thirds the training. I have also qualified for a scholarship worth the final third. I am now asking for community support to complete the final part of the cost – namely food, water, equipment and a car share for a month. If I raise more than I ask, I will donate back to the School of Lost Borders so others may benefit from the scholarship. 

    In exchange!

    I am offering some of my creative and related work as perks, a cunning plan to another way spread and support the work of Council, share some of my other skills and give something back to those who are supporting me in this way. 

    £15 GBP – Council In-Flight Card

    Yes! Just what you needed, a quick reminder of the basics in council practice done in a fun way, like the airline card in the seat in front of you. A 2-sided A4 sheet with Council in flight ceremony instructions.

    £25 GBP – A novel about Council

    Even better, I am also happy to offer the novel I finished writing this year, about a successful rock guitarist's journey through disintegrating breakdown to the path of Council, near death experience, temple initiate to a message from the ancient council of Gaia.

    Over the threshold of £50 GBP –

    whatever you offer will be returned as a reduction in any quest you wish to undertake with me in the future.


    Other ways you can help

    If you cannot support me financially at this time, there are many ways to help me reach people, support future projects, and collaborate with me in ways where money is not the principle form of exchange. These might include:

    • Offer to help me organise a training or an experience to support you and your people by calling council

    • Support me in finding a place to stay, a more up-to-date Mac, ipad/modern mobile phone, land on which to create a centre for council...

    • Helping to fund others if you take a future training or quest that I will lead by paying the asking amount

    • Paying it forward - donating directly to family, friends and associates who would benefit from a training or experience, that they may return to your/their community, project or relation, share and spread the practice there.


    In sum, please ask your friends to support this campaign, get the word out, and consider the day you will call that council, take that quest...

    For all our relations

    THANK YOU!

• Support me in finding a place to stay, a more up-to-date Mac, ipad/modern mobile phone, land on which to create a centre for council...
• Helping to fund others if you take a future training or quest that I will lead by paying the asking amount

For all our relations
THANK YOU!

story:
Friends of the Chemistry Olympiads,

Amigos de las olimpiadas químicas en Venezuela

The Venezuelan team for the Iberoamerican Chemistry Olympiad needs your help! This year’s Olympiad will be hosted in Teresina, Brasil, and our team is ready to meet the talented students representing all the countries of Iberoamerica. Within this campaign, AVOQUIM (The Association of Venezuelan Chemistry Olympiads) aims to raise USD 7,000 which will go towards flight tickets, travel assistance and registration of the scientific observer. Join us in supporting our students and excellence in science education in Venezuela. Your help will secure their participation!

El equipo venezolano para la olimpiada iberoamericana de quÍmica necesita tu ayuda! La olimpiada de este año se realizara en Teresina, Brasil, y nuestro equipo ya está listo para encontrarse con los mejores estudiantes de iberoamerica. En esta campaña, AVOQUIM (La Asociación Venezolana de Olimpiadas Químicas), espera poder recolectar $7,000 que le permitirán a una parte del  equipo adquirir los boletos aéreos y cubrir los gastos de seguros de viajes y observador científico. Únete a nosotros y apoya a nuestros estudiantes y la excelencia en educación científica en Venezuela. ¡Tu ayuda hará posible la participación del equipo de Venezuela!

A bit more about Chemistry Olympiads in Venezuela:

Algo mas sobre las Olimpiadas  de Químicas en Venezuela:

In the past 12 years, the members of AVOQUIM have been advocating for the chemistry Olympiad program in Venezuela. The events organized by AVOQUIM reach every single corner of the country, motivate students and teachers, and ultimately enrich the educational system in Venezuela. They provide opportunities for talented students to further develop their scientific skills and become a beacon of hope for the future technologist that will propel the development of Latin America. 

En los últimos 12 años, AVOQUIM y sus miembros con el apoyo de varios entes académicos han logrado mantener vivo el programa de Olimpiadas Químicas en Venezuela. Los eventos organizados por AVOQUIM llegan a cada rincón del país, motivan a miles de estudiantes y maestros, y enriquecen significativamente el sistema educativo en Venezuela. Las olimpiadas le brindan la oportunidad a estudiantes talentos de desarrollar aun mas sus habilidades científicas y convertirse en símbolo de esperanza para los futuros tecnólogos que propulsaran el desarrollo de Latinoamérica. 

Throughout the history of the participation in International and Iberoamerican Chemistry Olympiads, Venezuelan teams have accumulated 2 gold medals, 18 silver medals, 38 bronze medals and 11 Merit Mention. Alumni from the Olympiads now occupy positions in the best universities around the world, have become industry leaders, and -most importantly- help connect Venezuela with the world developments and are a fundamental force that keeps projects such as the Olympiads alive.

A lo largo de la participación Venezolana en olimpiadas internacionales de química, nuestros equipos han acumulado 2 medallas de oro, 18 de plata, 38 de bronce y 11 Menciones Honorificas. Ex-alumnos de las olimpiadas han logrado ocupar importantes posiciones en las mejores universidades del mundo, se han convertido en lideres en industria, y son una pieza fundamental que mantiene a Venezuela conectada con los desarrollos científicos y tecnológicos por fuera de nuestras fronteras. Este grupo de ex-alumnos también son una fuerza muy importante en mantener proyectos como las olimpiadas vigentes.

This year our team is composed by 4 students: Jesus Colmenares (Miranda), Eduardo Jerez (Miranda), Minh Ngotien (Miranda) and Marco Pacheco (Tachira). They have been training for the past 6 months to be at their top level for the competition in Brasil, but their participation seems threatened by the profound economic crisis that Venezuela faces. In the past, local industry and educational institutions have helped by providing invaluable resources to secure the participation of Venezuela in the event; but resources this years are scarce besides the exchange control in the country from several years. This is why AVOQUIM has decided to call upon the generosity of all the friends of the Venezuela Olympiads. In exchange for your contribution, our students will have the experience of a lifetime, connect our country with the rest of Latin America and the Iberic peninsula, propel their future scientific careers and by doing so brighten the horizon of Venezuela.

El equipo venezolano de este año está compuesto por 4 estudiantes: Jesús Colmenares (Miranda), Eduardo Jérez (Miranda), Minh Ngotien (Miranda) y Marco Pacheco (Táchira). Ellos han estado entrenando los últimos 6 meses para lograr su nivel más alto en miras a la competencia en Brasil, a pesar de que su participación se ve amenazada por la profunda crisis económica que vive el país. En el pasado, la industria local e instituciones educativas han proporcionado los invaluables recursos que han hecho posible la participación de Venezuela en Olimpiadas Internacionales, pero este año los recursos se han vuelto tremendamente escasos, aunado al control cambiario que vive el país desde hace varios años. Dada esta situación, AVOQUIM ha decido acudir a la generosidad de todos los amigos de las Olimpiadas de Químicas venezolanas. Como recompensa por tu ayuda, nuestros estudiantes tendrán una experiencia inolvidable que conectara a nuestro país con el resto de iberoamérica, impulsará en un futuro sus carreras científicas, y se constituirán en la generación de relevo científico-tecnológico que  Venezuela requiere.

Olympiads alive.
