de la participación Venezolana en olimpiadas internacionales de química,
nuestros equipos han acumulado 2 medallas de oro, 18 de plata, 38 de bronce y 11 Menciones Honorificas. Ex-alumnos de las olimpiadas han logrado ocupar
importantes posiciones en las mejores universidades del mundo, se han
convertido en lideres en industria, y son una pieza fundamental que mantiene a
Venezuela conectada con los desarrollos científicos y tecnológicos por fuera de
nuestras fronteras. Este grupo de ex-alumnos también son una fuerza muy
importante en mantener proyectos como las olimpiadas vigentes.
This year our team is composed by 4
students: Jesus Colmenares (Miranda), Eduardo Jerez (Miranda), Minh Ngotien (Miranda) and Marco Pacheco (Tachira). They have been training for the past 6 months to be at their top
level for the competition in Brasil, but their participation seems threatened
by the profound economic crisis that Venezuela faces. In the past, local
industry and educational institutions have helped by providing invaluable
resources to secure the participation of Venezuela in the event; but resources
this years are scarce besides the exchange control in the country from several years. This is why AVOQUIM has decided to call upon the
generosity of all the friends of the Venezuela Olympiads. In exchange for your
contribution, our students will have the experience of a lifetime, connect our
country with the rest of Latin America and the Iberic peninsula, propel their
future scientific careers and by doing so brighten the horizon of Venezuela.
El equipo
venezolano de este año está compuesto por 4 estudiantes: Jesús Colmenares (Miranda), Eduardo Jérez (Miranda), Minh Ngotien (Miranda) y Marco Pacheco (Táchira). Ellos han estado
entrenando los últimos 6 meses para lograr su nivel más alto en miras a la
competencia en Brasil, a pesar de que su participación se ve amenazada por la
profunda crisis económica que vive el país. En el pasado, la industria local e
instituciones educativas han proporcionado los invaluables recursos que han
hecho posible la participación de Venezuela en Olimpiadas Internacionales, pero
este año los recursos se han vuelto tremendamente escasos, aunado al control cambiario que vive el país desde hace varios años. Dada esta situación,
AVOQUIM ha decido acudir a la generosidad de todos los amigos de las Olimpiadas de Químicas venezolanas. Como recompensa por tu ayuda, nuestros estudiantes
tendrán una experiencia inolvidable que conectara a nuestro país con el resto
de iberoamérica, impulsará en un futuro sus carreras científicas, y se constituirán en la generación de relevo científico-tecnológico que  Venezuela requiere.

story:
Quantity or Quality?

Is it better to give 100 abandoned kids living on the streets one meal or to take just one of those kids and completely transform their life?

After having served 8 years in the British Army, Ben Gillott the Founder/CEO of Moocharoo spent 3 years in University studying a BSc in Web Development. It was during this time that he travelled to the Philippines and met his future wife.

Whilst in the Philippines he saw sights on the streets there that in his words were "worse than anything I saw on the streets of war striken Iraq!" the poverty of these children is like nothing you could ever imagine.

Somebody should do something to help, why not YOU?
After University Ben created Moocharoo as a social enterprise to raise money to support childrens homes in the Philippines to not just put a roof over their heads but to give them education, discipline, confidence and a warm family environment.

NOW IS THE TIME!! In August 2015 WE are leaving the disappointing summer weather of the UK for the tropical climate of the Philippines.

We have done everything WE could to cover the cost of travel and living expences, WE have built connections and awareness of the region we are targeting but WE really need YOU to help make the difference and provide the support so that we can help more kids!


The BIG PICTURE...

How on earth did the Philippines end up with an estimated 1.8 Million orphaned and abandoned kids living on the streets of the Philippines?

Poor grown ups with children they cannot afford risk everything to head to the big cities to find work, most with the intention of finding work and returning to get their children.

What actually happens is they find more poverty in the city and never return, their kids grow up on the street with no education and then cannot find work so end up in a life of crime, prostitution and drugs.

Some of the girls will get have babies that they have no way of looking after so abandon them and the whole process repeats.

YOU can help BREAK THE CYCLE

$3,648 will support one child with a protective home, education, clothes and everything they need to have what we would call a normal childhood.

What We Need & What You Get


A $10 gift from YOU today will support a child for one day this year, but unlike mainstream faceless charities it does not stop there.

We shall keep you updated atleast 4 times each year with how the child you have helped support through text, photos and sometimes even video.

We want YOU to feel part of their transformation, because without you it would never have happened!


A $70 gift from you today will support a child for a week, just think of how important that is. Some helpless child out there on the streets of the Philippines right now, struggling to find food and with no one to ever go home to.
That child will be fed, clothed, housed and schooled for an entire week all because YOU have been willing to give just $70 today...

So as a special reward, not only will you have the same communications as those that could only afford $10 but you will also be recieving one of our bespoke "To Do List Pads".

Use this to keep life in order, put first things first and ensure that for once you actually manage to get those important tasks that you have put of done first.


A $304 gift from YOU today will completely transform a childs life for an entire month, 11 more people like YOU in the wolrd and this child will get an entire year of schooling living in a warm friendly environment for an entire year.
ALL BECAUSE OF PEOPLE JUST LIKE YOU :-) 

And this kind of generousity does not go unnoticed in this life as well as the next.

Not only are you going to get sent the previous two perks but you shall also be wearing the t-shirt!

Available in Navy or Blue | Mens or Womens sizes S-M-L-XL


A $912 gift from you today is going to transform the life of an abandoned and homeless child living on the streets of the Philippines for an entire 3 months.

This is a massive deal and is likely enough time to complete change the childs outlook on life and allow them to dream of better things to come for the very first time. 

So not only will you get all the previous perks but you shall also get to complete the Moocharoo package with a cup so you can share your philanphropic story with friends over a coffee.

PLUS we shall also be giving you full recognition as one of our main contributors on our site moocharoo.com.
In the British Army basic training is just 12 weeks long (3 months) but ask anyone that has been through that experience and they will tell you that during that time they changed significantly going from civilians into soldiers.
A gift of $912 is a very powerful and significant gift if you feel that you would like to make an impact on the life of one of these abandoned children.

A $1,824 gift from YOU today will provide everything that the child needs for half a year. That is six months worth of breakfast, lunch and dinners as well as schooling, clothing, discipline, self confidence building and a safe and welcoming home environment. 
Alot can be achieved in 6 months, lives can be completely transformed and this is why we are not only going to give you ALL of the lower level perks as well as FULL recognition on our website moocharoo.com.
FULL ONLINE RECOGNITION: This is the perfect option for businesses and bloggers as not only will your name be listed but your image/logo will also be shown with a text link back to your webpage.
All this to give you recognition as one of Moocharoo's MAJOR CONTRIBUTORS.


 

A $3,648 gift from YOU today is the ULTIMATE GIFT that you could give here today. 

We know that when you are giving a gift of an entire year of funding to one of these abandoned street kids it has nothing to do with tempting you with fancy rewards.
It is because YOU feel a deep desire to do all you possibly can to help set these poor children free from their difficulties.

Yes we will be giving you all the perks given to those that gave less but we shall also be giving you that little extra recognition by having your name engraved on the brass plaque that will be set at the entrance of Moocharoo's first childrens centre scheduled for 2016.

The Impact

As mentioned earlier there are estimated to be over 1.8 Million orphaned and abandoned children living on the streets of the Philippines.

WE CAN NOT HELP THEM ALL, BUT WITH YOUR HELP WE COULD TRANSFORM THE LIVES OF A FEW!

We have absolutely NO intention of ever allowing any of the children that we take on go back to a life on the street.
We wish to provide for these children all through school and University giving them every opportunity to succeed in life that you could wish for your own children.

BUT! We cannot do this alone, our pockets are not that deep... These kids need your help to give them this opportunity of a decent chance at life.


Risks & Challenges

We cannot support children close to where we are based in Iloilo, Philippines and they will be too close to there old way of life. 

There is a worry that ties to friends, and the street lifestyle could lure the kids back to a life on the streets which is why we want to have secured at least 12 weeks of funding before bringing them to a safe environment.

Fortunately our team benefits from being based in the UK as well as the Philippines and have secured extremely strong ties with churches and other charitable organisations located in Manila, Iloilo and Mindanao.




Other Ways You Can Help

We are always looking for more help from people that share our desire to rescue these children from a life of hardship and deliver them into a life of opportunity.

Unlike those large established charities  we value all skills that you have to bring to the table rather than money alone, so if you are a nurse, internet marketer, Rotarian, local volunteer, graphic designer, whatever your skill if you believe you have something to offer other than money then please GET IN TOUCH.

If you would like to get involved just head over to moocharoo.com and apply to help.

At very least, please remember to share this cause on Facebook, Twitter and where ever else you can, every little helps ;-)

story:
The Problem

There is a challenge of quality education in Nigeria and though the number of schools which provide quality education is on the increase, the majority cannot afford them. For children to have quality education in Nigeria, it is a major responsibility of parents and relatives to pay for it and the price of quality education is very high for those that are poor.  Due to this, a percentage of students in their 6th year of education cannot read, speak eloquently, reason logically, neither do they believe in their potentials and ability to be creative and innovative or be successful in life.

Nigeria needs innovative youths with a mindset towards solving problems and nation building and to be able to raise up such youths, their minds as children, need to be molded in that direction. Powerful Young Project (PYP) is a platform that facilitates discovery, growth, self-realization, creativity and innovation in Nigerian Children.

At PYP it’s all about the children. If they can’t read, we are there to teach them, if they lack confidence, we are there to inspire them, if they’ve got talent; we are there to nurture it. Every child deserves to be told they can be something in life regardless of where they are coming from. PYP is here to tell it and also help them be.

Who We Are

The PYP project involves providing classroom based lessons together with life studies such as time management, ethics, patriotism, creativity, peer pressure and bullying, etc. to children in public primary schools, grade 5 and 6, preparing them for their Common Entrance exams, secondary school life and life in general.

It began on the 31st of Jan 2015. Discovering that a majority of the students in the 6th grade in the public primary school are performing poorly, we organized a lesson wherein a group of volunteers, took out 6 hours in a week to teach 175 children, how to read and write, basic mathematical concepts and tutorials for the common entrance examination they needed to pass to enter the junior secondary school.

Our mission is to explore and harness the inbuilt potentials of students by creating opportunities and platforms for effective applications and utilization of latent and manifest attributes.  At the same time build up an ethical and patriotic mind set through the '360-Education' concept where classroom lessons are combined with boosting the innovative, inventive and creative abilities of students;  teaching them how to live, act and become powerful members of their society despite their backgrounds.


Why We Need Your Help

PYP has come a long way in building the hopes of these children that they could be better than they are and that their background does not determine who they are and what they can achieve. We have achieved so much through donations from an incredible network of friends and family. But now we are facing our biggest challenge which goes beyond our financial capabilities and we urgently need your help.

Out of the one hundred and seventy five children whom we started the program with, we have twenty- six whom have shown consistency. Although we would love to provide for this total number, we have selected seven children who have shown, a love for learning, discipline, hard-work, productivity and an aspiration of becoming problem solvers in their society. 

These children are from poor families and having completed their primary education, have little hope of attending secondary school.  Some of them might take to street hawking and other menial jobs to put themselves through school while the desperate ones among them could resort to stealing and other delinquencies as a means to an end.

If this is allowed to happen, all that we have accomplished so far will go to waste and be just a memory to them. But we want to succeed and grant these children a better future.

What your donations will be used for

Your donation will go a long way in sending 7 children through their secondary school education. We have calculated that we need a minimum amount of 18,816 dollars which will cater for their tuition fee, uniforms, notebooks, textbooks, writing materials, school bags and examination registration fees for their first year. But we hope to raise more than the total amount needed to cater for the six years of secondary education which is 112,266 dollars

No matter how much we raise, we are going to send at least a child to secondary school. If we raise more than we are requesting, we plan to send more children to school. No amount is too small. Your support will definitely go a long way.

The Cost

Total Cost for 7 children is $112,266


How do We Plan to Keep the Money

To ensure transparency and accountability, the money will be placed in a trust fund. The details of the trust fund once it is set up will be communicated to all that donated to the cause.

How to Donate

On the top right side of this page, there is a contribute button which you can use to donate any amount using either your debit card or credit card. Also you can choose any of the categories listed out in the perks to contribute. If you still have questions concerning how to donate, contact us at hello@powerfulyoungproject.org

Our Perks

All of our perks help us to stay accountable to you as transparency and accountability is our core values.

From our past project we have learnt the value of accountability from positive responses we got when we sent a video together with a report detailing the event and financials involved in organizing a Children’s Day program for our students to all the sponsors that participated and it is a culture we are sticking to. Here is the video 

Please do view our perks on the right and choose any to donate.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren’t able to help financially, we would truly appreciate your help in sharing this campaign with people you know. Together we can make a difference in these children’s lives!

We are on Facebook and Twitter. Find us there. Follow us. Like us. Invite your friends to do it too.

For any questions you might have, you can view the answers we have provided below or you can contact us by sending a mail to hello@powerfulyoungproject.org. We will be pleased to answer all your queries.

THANK YOU!

No, really, thank you! We can't do this without you and are so glad you have chosen to join us.

YOU'VE GOT QUESTIONS. WE'VE GOT ANSWERS.

Are all the Children Highly Intelligent?

Five of the children have shown high academic strength while the remaining two have high vocational strength. At PYP we discover the strengths of each students and help build them up based on their strengths

Which Schools will the selected students be going to?

Those that have shown high academic orientation will be sent to high tier schools and those with high vocational orientation will be sent to middle tier schools and vocational schools

What happens if a child drops out?

All of the children under the scholarship program have shown strengths in different ways and have learnt ways of being successful in life through their participation in the PYP program. But there will be constant mentoring of the children throughout their secondary school education to prevent such occurrence. Furthermore, we just have to believe in these children’s dreams. You can view what these kids say about why they should get a scholarship here

What happens to a child after secondary school?

With your continuous support we can help the children achieve their dreams by furthering their studies through college or vocational training. One thing we are sure of is that, they will not be abandoned. Their success is our success.

Can I contribute over a period of time be a Virtual Guardian?

Yes you can, you could donate what you have now and contact us to inquire more about the process.

What if I don't want to receive any perks?

You are welcome to select any perk below the level you are donating at if you do not want all the perks included in your level of giving. You may also opt not to receive any perks and just donate. Additionally, if you'd like to donate above and beyond a perk amount (for example $65 or $300) just select the perk closest to that amount. On the following page you can then add an additional donation of any amount you'd like.

Want to know more about the people on our team and the folks behind the creation of our trailer video and the other items you see?

We are honoured to have worked with an amazing group of friends to get us this far. We are deeply indebted to them for their hard work and passion. You should check it out.

For short bios and photos of the members of our team, click here.

What is the best way to contact you for any request?

All requests can be sent by email to hello@powerfulyoungproject.org

Can I contribute over a
period of time be a Virtual Guardian?
Yes you can, you could donate what you have now and contact us to inquire
more about the process.
What if I don't want to
receive any perks? 
You are welcome to select any perk below the level you are donating at if
you do not want all the perks included in your level of giving. You may also
opt not to receive any perks and just donate. Additionally, if you'd like to
donate above and beyond a perk amount (for example $65 or $300) just select the
perk closest to that amount. On the following page you can then add an
additional donation of any amount you'd like.
Want to know more about the
people on our team and the folks behind the creation of our trailer video and
the other items you see? 
We are honoured to have worked with an amazing group of friends to get us
this far. We are deeply indebted to them for their hard work and passion. You should check it out. 
For short bios and photos of the members of our team, click here. 
What is the best way to
contact you for any request?
All requests can be sent by email to hello@powerfulyoungproject.org

story:
For low-income students across the country, the barrier isn’t wanting to go to college - it’s paying for it.

Raising $5,000 will help 10,000 low-income high school seniors apply for millions of dollars of financial aid this year!

Give today and be a part of sending these students to college!

           

What is College Summit?

College Summit is the national nonprofit committed to placing 1.8 million low-income high school students from 1000 schools nationwide on the path to college and career using its unique student-driven peer influence model.

For the past 20 years, College Summit has worked with in schools and with educators to identify and train influential students who become “Peer Leaders.” These students run campaigns in their schools to share their college-knowledge and make college-going the expectation not the exception for their peers. One of these campaigns is to encourage seniors to apply for the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) – the process used to determine a student’s eligibility for financial aid. 

Our Peer Leaders’ FAFSAForward campaigns help their classmates calculate the true cost of college so they can make informed decisions about what college to attend and how to pay for it. Importantly, the campaigns encourage students to submit their FAFSA applications in a timely manner. Aid is first-come, first served. 

The success of these campaigns depends on the training and resources College Summit provides Peer Leaders across the nation. With the FAFSA application window opening January 1, 2016, it is imperative we get campaign tools and materials into the hands of our Peer Leaders as quickly as possible. 

Support these Deserving Kids Today!

And we have PERKS! Depending on the amount you give, we will send you College Summit swag, including FAFSA pens, tote bags, tee-shirts, smartphone credit card sleeves - or all of the above! Just take a look at our “Perks” section.

The deadline to file for FAFSA is fast approaching…

The Need:

FAFSA is required for need-based financial assistance, and yet 2.2 million low-income students never file, leaving $9.5 billion in aid on the table.

College Summit believes the key to changing this trend is leveraging the power of the students themselves to be agents of change for their peers.

Every cent you give will go towards on-the-ground training, marketing campaigns, and curriculum to support over 2,000 College Summit Peer Leaders as they run FAFSAForward campaigns to help their peers file for FAFSA by January 1. 

The sooner they get this information, the better. Timely FAFSA filers are more than twice as likely to end up enrolling and staying in college. In fact, students who file in the first few months of the application cycle receive more than twice as much funding as those who file later.

There’s no time to lose. Please give today to help send students from low-income high schools to and through college!

The most influential person to a 17 year-old is another 17 year-old.

The Impact:

By harnessing the leadership abilities of our nation’s youth, we’ve been able to increase college enrollment rates by 20% in partner high schools.

Just last year, 64% of students at our partner schools filed for FAFSA before the deadline, and we hope to increase that number this year.

One of our partner high schools saw a 52% increase in FAFSA submissions over the prior year as a result of their Peer Leader’s FAFSA campaign. Once enrolled, students have 72% higher odds of persisting than their peers who do not file.

With your help, we can reach 1.8 million students from 1,000 schools by 2020.

Other Ways You Can Help!

If you can’t give financially, please consider supporting College Summit in other ways!

·  Spread the word! Forward the link to this campaign to your friends and networks. Feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word.

·  Discover volunteer opportunities with College Summit! We are always in need of enthusiastic folks who want to help students in their community realize their potential. Visit http://www.collegesummit.org/you-can-help/volunteer/ to learn more.

Give low income students the opportunity to realize their full potential.

story:
SciFest Dubai is the first science festival of its kind in Dubai with the aim of promoting STEAM Education and of celebrating science through the arts. We had our inaugural festival last year. Our main sponsors were Meydan Theatre and GEMS Education. It was a 4-day festival at which we had 13,000 visitors, 25 different events, and 800 participants. The event was also covered by BBC World. SciFest Dubai and its associated initiatives have nearly 300,000 followers on Facebook. SciFest Dubai is a non-profit and all the events are free to attend by the public. We are partners with the Dubai Knowledge and Human Development Authority (KHDA) and the Director General Dr Abdullah Al Karam is our chief guest.

The 2015 edition of SciFest Dubai takes place from 4 - 9 October at Dubai Municipality's Children City. This year we have partnered up with UNESCO and the Science Film Festival which is an international festival organised by the Goethe Institut with over half a million visitors worldwide.

We're using crowdfunding to generate awareness about the importance of science and STEAM education among the community in general and within K-12 schools in particular. This project is about making science fun and bringing it into mainstream culture – away from classrooms and laboratories! The Science Festival itself is non-profit. All the events are free and are run by committed, passionate individuals in the community who have a desire to make a difference.

The funds raised by this campaign will primarily be used for the production cost of the festival.

More info on our website: www.scifestdubai.com
And on our Facebook page: www.facebook.com/scifestdubai

story:
The eduction based fund campagin is being raised in order to install a solar based power supply

Why the fund required Now?

Over the last two decades, the rural areas of India have witnessed many changes. There are better road connections, there is a significant improvement in health care, literacy levels have gone up and mobile phones have become ubiquitous. But one thing that hasn’t changed much is the sorry state of electricity supply. 12-14 hours load shedding is a common phenomenon across most states of the country. When there is no electricity for such a long time span, one of the most affected lot are the school going children.

story:
Short Summary

25 April 2015 was black day of Nepal. Massive earthquake destroyed all peaceful life of Nepal. More than 12000 people died,  more than 25000 people got injured and many more became homeless. Most of the world heritage site and building of Nepal was destroyed within 52 second. The birthplace of  BUDDHA and world tallest summit Mt. Everest's country Nepal turns into the desert. 

Above seen school name is JANAKALYAN PRIMARY SCHOOL totally destroyed by this massive earthquake. This school lies in western Nepal's syangja district pakawadi village development committee ward no 5 Chapabhanjyang. 

Total 97 students are studying in this school but school is totally destroyed so students are studying outside of school. We can see the miserable condition of this school after the quake.

  • We are Khushi-Ureshi Society. Khushi is a Nepalese word and Ureshi is a Japanese word. Both words' meaning is HAPPY. So Khushi-Ureshi Society wants to create happy life to others as soon as possible.  It's a NGO which is registered in Nepal Government. 
  • This school is totally destroyed. When we visited this school, our heart is totally broken after see small children who is studying outside of school. After see   students' situation, we want to spread a beautiful smile for them from your help. 
  • If we could make this school, it will be great achievement for us.

Please, We are very small but your big heart and support will make us bigger. We never let you down. we will report you after rebuild this school.

Without your support not possible to do anything.


Thank you very much for your support.

story:
The Long Way Around

The Solar System Sphere is the only product of its kind that features the accurate study of the solar system while affording a tangible model that can be seen, touched and studied intricately in ways that merely looking at a map can never achieve.                       Patent Attorney's report

Inventing a new star globe was not on my Bucket List. My interest was in understanding the hieroglyphics of the ancient Nile region. The research question was: Why were these particular characters best suited to represent the actions, knowledge and beliefs of these ancient peoples? 

Very quickly, it became clear that principal  characters were constellations.  Locating and tracing the hieroglyphic constellations became an obsession.

The trigonometry of the surface of a sphere was out of my wheel house, but it was child's play for the developers of hieroglyphics. To follow their reasoning I needed a hybrid of a star globe/celestial sphere with a scale model of our solar system. It needed to be precise, transparent and simple. It also needed ancient and up-to-date star maps that I could sketch on.

One of the star globes purchased online was the one pictured here. The closer I looked, the more problems stared back. I attacked it with a hammer and screwdriver to pry it apart to see the stars the way I needed to see them. The prototype was constructed with a pair of hemispheres, embroidery thread, transparent tape and one dangling button. Numerous tiny buttons were glued on the surface. 

The Solar System Sphere is the principal component of the the Planetary Kit, designed to examine planets, moons, asterisms and galaxies as has never before been possible from the comfort of a chair on a mountaintop. Alone, it is a beautiful and enigmatic addition to your desktop.

To Patent. To Market.

The patent attorney and marketing analysis report gives the Solar System Sphere high marks. Components of the Planetary Kit will be covered by a utility patent and the balance by design patents. 

The marketing team's goal is to introduce the Planetary Kit (with its entire product line of maps, etc.) at the International Licensing Expo in June, 2016 in Las Vegas. 

The production spheres are: a 12" diameter; and a 36" diameter. The 84" diameter is possible & useful but best in a museum or corporate lobby.

The road ahead.

I need to raise money to apply for the patent ASAP so that the invention will be covered by Patent Pending or we will miss the June Expo. That means missing another year of Education Product Trade Fairs. Application for a single market patent is the next step ... $13K; U.S. and Euro $17K; and, Global is $30k. 

All funds collected will first cover the costs of patent application ... then production prototypes. It will take more time to fabricate the components if the money is not raised in the next 60 days, but it will be manufactured.

This Planetary Kit will make the globe pictured above an obsolete artifact, one of those things the next generation of students will laugh at. The Planetary Kit is designed for studying, experimenting and visualizing a star or its planets. It is accurate, adaptable and beautiful allowing the user to focus on one section of the night sky and to understand the distance as never before. 

Here is the offer for preorders:

$250 will preorder a Planetary Kit including a  12" Solar System Sphere; a printed copy of an historical star map; a printed copy of an up-to-date star map; a topographic Earth map; and, a cradle stand. Please indicate the language preferred for the instruction booklet: English, French, German, Spanish or Arabic. Other maps and kit components will be available after the initial offering.

Additionally, please include the address of a public school of your choice that has a STEM program. When your Planetary Kit is shipped to you, a duplicate will be sent to that classroom as a gift from you.

About my research and writing.

My book is called The Stone of the Pregnant Woman and is to be in three volumes: Vol. I is Four Guardians of the North; Vol. II is Surveying the Dark; Vol III is Herds and Herders. www.stoneofthepregnantwoman.net

It is not possible for me to precisely locate their constellations, and to confidently write Volume II, Surveying the Dark without the Planetary Kit and its  Solar System Sphere, maps & other components. The astronomers of the time had far less sophisticated tools than today's astronomer has under the hood, but their solutions were classic in their simplicity and meticulously accurate.

Other Ways You Can Help

Any funds collected will go towards fabricating the Planetary Kit. For each increment of $250 from multiple people, a Planetary Kit with Solar System Sphere will be donated to a STEM classroom in a public school. 

You can help by telling your friends, co-workers, family and your entire Twitter feed, FaceBook contacts and your gaming pals about the project. Indiegogo has great share tools to get you started.

story:
Worum geht's?

Die Jazz Chord Base zeigt ein System auf, mit dem Gitarristen sehr logisch und effektiv die Begleitung von Jazz-Songs erlernen können. Gitarristen verbringen 90% ihrer Trainingszeit mit Improvisation und dem Solieren, aber die meiste der Zeit sind sie Begleiter von Solisten.
Das Projekt umfasst einen Onlinekurs mit Videos, erklärenden Websites und einem Lehrbuch.

Das Schwergewicht des normalen Gitarrenunterrichts liegt sehr oft auf dem Solospiel. Ich suchte einen Weg, das Begleiten und den Umgang mit der enormeln Vielfalt an Akkorden didaktisch so anzuwenden, dass es einen schnellen Lernerfolg und ein umfassendes Repertoire an Akkordern ermöglicht.
Dieses im Prinzip sehr einfache System wurde von mir in jahrelangem Unterricht erfolgreich umgesetzt und in meinen Auftritten angewendet.

Mein Name ist Stefan Mens (www.stefanmens.ch) und ich bin Lehrer für E-Gitarre. Ich habe hunderte von Konzerten und Shows in Musicals, Big-Bands, Orchestern und natürlich auch in Bands im Bereich Jazz, Fusion, Rock und übergreifenden Stilen gespielt. Nebst meiner Tätigkeit als Instrumentalist und Lehrer bin ich Arrangeur und Komponist.

Das Lehrbuch ist nun in Deutsch fertig. Es soll mit Videos und erklärenden Websites als kompletter Online Kurs auf einem Lernportal für E-Learning veröffentlicht werden. Um einen grösseren Markt zu erreichen, möchte ich den gesamten Kurs auch in Englisch anbieten.
  

Was soll finanziert werden?

Dein Beitrag hilft, die Produktion dieses Lehrganges zu realisieren. Die Kosten decken:
  • Produktion der Lernvideos (Anschaffung/ev. Miete und Amortisation des benötigten Equipments, Engagement und Beratung von Fachleuten aus dem Bereich Videoproduktion).
  • Übersetzung des Lehrganges auf Englisch.
  • Development und Realisation der Website (Grafik, Programmierung, Projektentwicklung).
  • Bei Bedarf: Druckkosten des Buches sowie Bereitstellung als PDF zum Download.
  

Die Motivation für dieses Projekt

In meiner Unterrichtstätigkeit wurde ich mehrmals von Lehrerkollegen und auch Studenten ermutigt, dieses System in eine allen Studenten zugängliche Form zu bringen.
Das Erlernen der Akkorde für Gitarristen ist anspruchsvoll. Absolut (d.h. in einem numerischen Sinne) gesehen gibt es tausende von verschiedenen Akkorden auf der Gitarre. Relativ zur Art des Akkordes sind es aber nur recht wenige. Dies zu verstehen und zu erlernen erfordert ein kleines Wissen an Harmonielehre und Logik im Umgang mit den Möglichkeiten, die das Instrument durch seine Eigenart bietet.
Dieser Lehrgang baut auf diesem Gedanken auf und erreicht dadurch schnell die Lernziele.
Die Verwendung von Lehrbüchern aller Art in meiner Tätigkeit als Dozent zeigte mir oft auf, dass die dabei verwendeten Zusatzhilfsmittel (meist eine CD mit Play-Along-Tracks) das Problem haben, dass man das Tempo nicht variieren kann. Es ist essentiell, dass man im Lernprozess eines Musikinstrumentes mit anderen Musikern spielen kann. Oft sind die Aufnahmen auf einer dem Lehrbuch beigelegten CD aber im Tempo zu schnell. Deshalb wird die CD meist nicht wirklich benutzt. Mit entsprechender Software/Versionen der Play-Along Tracks auf der Website soll dieses Problem gelöst werden.

Dieses Akkord-System ist aus folgenden Gründen für den Studenten sehr hilfreich:
  •  Akkorde werden nicht einfach aus einer Grifftabelle gelernt. Man versteht sehr bald die Funktion der einzelnen Akkord-Töne. Die vermittelte Spielweise der Akkorde ist relativ zum harmonischen Kontext und wird nicht absolut nach den vorgegeben Akkordbezeichnungen gelehrt.
  • Der Lehrgang ist für Anfänger der Begleitung im Jazz wie auch für den fortgeschrittenen Spieler hilfreich. Auch Bassisten, die gelegentlich Akkorde spielen möchten, können von dem System profitieren.
  • Das System fördert die Orientierung auf dem Griffbrett sehr effizient.
  • Diese Konzept lehrt nicht stur die verschiedenen Akkorde, sondern vermittelt dem Spieler auch ein Grundwissen in Harmonielehre
  • Das Verständnis der Töne in einem Akkord unterstützt den Studenten auch beim Improvisieren.
  

Status Quo

 Zur Zeit ist das Projekt in schriftlicher Form auf Deutsch fertiggestellt.

Die Jazz Chord Base zeigt ein System auf, mit dem Gitarristen sehr logisch und effektiv die Begleitung von Jazz-Songs erlernen können. Gitarristen verbringen 90% ihrer Trainingszeit mit Improvisation und dem Solieren, aber die meiste der Zeit sind sie Begleiter von Solisten.Das Projekt umfasst einen Onlinekurs mit Videos, erklärenden Websites und einem Lehrbuch.Das Schwergewicht des normalen Gitarrenunterrichts liegt sehr oft auf dem Solospiel. Ich suchte einen Weg, das Begleiten und den Umgang mit der enormeln Vielfalt an Akkorden didaktisch so anzuwenden, dass es einen schnellen Lernerfolg und ein umfassendes Repertoire an Akkordern ermöglicht.Dieses im Prinzip sehr einfache System wurde von mir in jahrelangem Unterricht erfolgreich umgesetzt und in meinen Auftritten angewendet.Mein Name ist Stefan Mens (www.stefanmens.ch) und ich bin Lehrer für E-Gitarre. Ich habe hunderte von Konzerten und Shows in Musicals, Big-Bands, Orchestern und natürlich auch in Bands im Bereich Jazz, Fusion, Rock und übergreifenden Stilen gespielt. Nebst meiner Tätigkeit als Instrumentalist und Lehrer bin ich Arrangeur und Komponist.Das Lehrbuch ist nun in Deutsch fertig. Es soll mit Videos und erklärenden Websites als kompletter Online Kurs auf einem Lernportal für E-Learning veröffentlicht werden. Um einen grösseren Markt zu erreichen, möchte ich den gesamten Kurs auch in Englisch anbieten.  
Was soll finanziert werden?Dein Beitrag hilft, die Produktion dieses Lehrganges zu realisieren. Die Kosten decken:

Produktion der Lernvideos (Anschaffung/ev. Miete und Amortisation des benötigten Equipments, Engagement und Beratung von Fachleuten aus dem Bereich Videoproduktion).

Übersetzung des Lehrganges auf Englisch.
Development und Realisation der Website (Grafik, Programmierung, Projektentwicklung).
Bei Bedarf: Druckkosten des Buches sowie Bereitstellung als PDF zum Download.
  Die Motivation für dieses ProjektIn meiner Unterrichtstätigkeit wurde ich mehrmals von Lehrerkollegen und auch Studenten ermutigt, dieses System in eine allen Studenten zugängliche Form zu bringen.Das Erlernen der Akkorde für Gitarristen ist anspruchsvoll. Absolut (d.h. in einem numerischen Sinne) gesehen gibt es tausende von verschiedenen Akkorden auf der Gitarre. Relativ zur Art des Akkordes sind es aber nur recht wenige. Dies zu verstehen und zu erlernen erfordert ein kleines Wissen an Harmonielehre und Logik im Umgang mit den Möglichkeiten, die das Instrument durch seine Eigenart bietet.Dieser Lehrgang baut auf diesem Gedanken auf und erreicht dadurch schnell die Lernziele.Die Verwendung von Lehrbüchern aller Art in meiner Tätigkeit als Dozent zeigte mir oft auf, dass die dabei verwendeten Zusatzhilfsmittel (meist eine CD mit Play-Along-Tracks) das Problem haben, dass man das Tempo nicht variieren kann. Es ist essentiell, dass man im Lernprozess eines Musikinstrumentes mit anderen Musikern spielen kann. Oft sind die Aufnahmen auf einer dem Lehrbuch beigelegten CD aber im Tempo zu schnell. Deshalb wird die CD meist nicht wirklich benutzt. Mit entsprechender Software/Versionen der Play-Along Tracks auf der Website soll dieses Problem gelöst werden.Dieses Akkord-System ist aus folgenden Gründen für den Studenten sehr hilfreich:
 Akkorde werden nicht einfach aus einer Grifftabelle gelernt. Man versteht sehr bald die Funktion der einzelnen Akkord-Töne. Die vermittelte Spielweise der Akkorde ist relativ zum harmonischen Kontext und wird nicht absolut nach den vorgegeben Akkordbezeichnungen gelehrt.
Der Lehrgang ist für Anfänger der Begleitung im Jazz wie auch für den fortgeschrittenen Spieler hilfreich. Auch Bassisten, die gelegentlich Akkorde spielen möchten, können von dem System profitieren.
Das System fördert die Orientierung auf dem Griffbrett sehr effizient.
Diese Konzept lehrt nicht stur die verschiedenen Akkorde, sondern vermittelt dem Spieler auch ein Grundwissen in Harmonielehre
Das Verständnis der Töne in einem Akkord unterstützt den Studenten auch beim Improvisieren.
  Status Quo Zur Zeit ist das Projekt in schriftlicher Form auf Deutsch fertiggestellt.

story:
Meet ROBOTERRA

ROBOTERRA Origin Kit is a robotics kit for young makers age 10-18 to build their own robots and learn how to code. It contains a collection of robotics building blocks as well as the innovative CastleRock Online Learning Platform. It empowers young makers around the world to build and program their own robot with an up-to-date online robotics curriculum.


Recently Featured In

"...They have introduced robotics within education, through the use of colorful robotics learning kits designed for beginners." by World Economic Forum

"With these creations, ROBOTERRA aims to bring college-level learning to middle schoolers." by Business Insider

"The company is increasingly drawing interest from schools in less-privileged districts, something Zhang and her team are particularly excited about." by CNBC

"ROBOTERRA is aiming to be right in the mix with its new robotics kit. Designed with “all ages” in mind, this K’NEX meets coding system is bound to be a hit with both educators and students." by 9to5Toys



Products 

Origin Kit is comprised of FIVE boxes:

THINK Box

  • The RoboCore brings your robots to life. It is the BRAIN of your robot.

SENSE Box

  • Sensors are the SENSORY ORGANS. 

ACT Box

  • The two 180° Digital Servos make the robot move. 

BUILD Box

  • The strong and beautiful aluminum parts are the BONES of the robot.

CONNECT Box

  • All the tools you need to make robots.

CastleRock is an integrated development environment, and also an online robotics curriculum. Bugs and mistakes easily bored students, and we wanted to help them eliminate the trouble.


The programming language we chose is C++, an object-oriented language. Before CastleRock, students needed five hours to learn the coding logic and an additional two hours to write simple code. But now, the API between the hardware and software provides students an approachable, fun environment to practice coding, without diluting the academic rigor of C++. 


The object-oriented programming, the real-time communication with RoboCore, and the new principle of robotic programming are all connected, which is the direction of our new curriculum development. We spent months conducting field research among American and Chinese students and came up with a series of new ideas on robotics education. Furthermore, we intend ultimately to improve the quality and functionality of CastleRock by iterative design and data analysis.


Each CastleRock account is its own path into the world of robotics; let each learner explore it individually. Multiple CastleRock accounts allow for you, your children, or your students to attempt all the learning challenges at their own pace.

Learn more about CastleRock: http://www.roboterra.com/castlerock


Robots that You Can Build

Your robot’s movement will be generated by the input and output it processes. Inside the Origin™ Kit, you’ll find two light sensors, two black-white sensors, two buttons, and two sound sensors all used to input information into RoboCore. The two 180º Servo Motors, and 4 LED light bulbs yield the output RoboCore processes. This combination of input and output creates your robot’s movements.


How It Works

step by step: Openbox



from a kit to a robot

Think of a robot you’d like to build. What features will your robot have? Choose the right components. Then connect the hardware and software, and build your robot. Let your creativity fly!


Browse more Robo How To videos at ROBOTERRA YouTube Channel.


Features

We believe anyone can become a robotics maker with the right tools. And our goal is to inspire young makers' confidence and creativity to realize their robotics dream.

1.  The Brain of Your Robot: The RoboCore MicroController Board

Developed by the ROBOTERRA engineering team, RoboCore brings your robots to life. RoboCore collects and processes information, as well as makes decisions based on different data inputs. 


2. Hardware, Software and Cloud Synergy

Hardware and software should be used in concert, not in isolation. ROBOTERRA builds on this marriage between hardware and software by offering an experience that involves both simultaneously. When students code in CastleRock (software), they see how their code manifests in their robot (hardware) immediately. This 360º look at robotics shows learners how programming & mechanics are the yin & yang of engineering.


3. Learning Robotics and C++ via Gamified Challenges

CastleRock provides makers with a set of gamified challenges that guide students through the curriculum. Learn more about CastleRock Online Learning Platform.


Students Love ROBOTERRA

At ROBOTERRA, we value creativity, collaboration, and the ability of problem-solving.





Why We Need Your Support

We have been working on the Origin Kit and CastleRock Platform for the past two years, and we've come a long way. Now we need your help. We plan to initiate manufacturing and global shipping to make robotics education available to thousands of families around the world.

Let's take STEM education to uncharted levels — together.


Fulfillment timeline



ROBOTERRA Team

We are ROBOTERRA, an educational robotics company aiming to inspire creativity and innovation via robotics education to everyone worldwide.
We believe that robotics is the driving force behind STEM innovation. By putting high-quality robotics hardware and software in the hands of young makers, STEM will soar to uncharted heights.


FAQ

1. Can adults use the Origin Kit and CastleRock to learn robotics?

Yes, absolutely! The kit is useful for anyone over 10 years old, who’s interested in robotics.

2. Can multiple users share one CastleRock account?

We strongly recommend each learner to have his/her own account.

3. Is parent supervision required when kids are using the kit?

Because the kit contains aluminum sheet metal and circuit board pins, we encourage users under age 13 to build in the presence of an adult. Parents can also enjoy building the robots with kids.

4. What kind of robot can I build with the kit?

Anything! The kit is not a roadmap to a predetermined destination. It’s a tool that students use to build whatever they can imagine.

5. Where can we find more learning materials if needed?

Go check out the Robo How To videos on www.roboterra.com ; Also, the Solution and CastleRock Framework will be updated weekly.

story:
Our Mission

RiD+ works to improve livelihoods by strengthening the human condition at the individual level. Together we develop and implement humanitarian relief and sustainable development solutions.

RiD+ is founded on the basis of advocacy, social justice, and dignity for all. Over the past 15 months we have personally improved the livelihoods of 4.5% of the population of Haiti – 3.2% rural and 1.3% urban. While extreme poverty remains a concern, RiD+ has the ability to focus on livelihood factors that work to secure communities from violence and positively affect daily life for communities in which we integrate.

Now we need your donations so that we can continue to do our job, and better life for vulnerable communities as quickly as we can!

Here’s how you can get involved

1. Make a donation within your means on this IndieGoGo Campaign and help us reach our new fundraising goal of $4000!

2. Like and share this campaign! We need your help to spread the word about our work. Share the video above, connect with us on social media, and tell your friends about our efforts. You can connect with our founder here:

http://twitter.com/jasonriffe
http://facebook.com/jason.riffe
http://instagram.com/jasonriffe
http://medium.com/@jasonriffe

What makes our method revolutionary

Simple: we personally live in the communities where we work for 6-12 months before preparing a project.

We find humanitarian solutions to community problems with the sole aim of improving livelihoods for each individual member of a community served by RiD+. By recognizing the individual’s existence and valuing the community member’s assessment of their own reality, we do development differently.

We reside among the suffering in the countries we work, assess needs from community members, prepare a project for implementation, and secure the necessary funding as well as partnerships to complete a measurable integration. The staff and partners of RiD+ are mandated with three priorities:

(1) work ourselves out of a job.

(2) each implementation must have a minimum half-life.

(3) projects are staffed and maintained by the community RiD+ projects support.

These mandates ensure that our work is sustainable, improves local livelihoods, and creates jobs for community members. RiD+ does not take a top down approach. A participatory method ensures credibility and encourages trustworthy exchange.

Our global impact

Mexico RiD+ spent 3 months in Oaxaca, Mexico, the third poorest state of the country. While Mexico as a whole does not suffer from disproportionate illiteracy rates, RiD+ found that those living in the rural areas of Oaxaca did not have access to adequate primary and secondary education. The community of Chiapas requested a team to work with them to further the educational development of their girls and boys. We worked to integrate an educational program that continues.

Mali Over the course of five months RiD+ produced a 31-page report that identifies stakeholders and actors from the international, regional, national, subnational, and local areas that are directly involved in the active conflict in Mali. Additionally, a 5 month case study was completed by RiD+ on Mali to measure  and assess the effectiveness of economic, social and cultural factors for the realization of article 11 of ICESCR: adequate standard of living and freedom from hunger.

Haiti RiD+ spent fifteen months conducting hundreds of field site interviews, observations, and lived in communities both rural and urban in order to best assess Haitian human insecurity. Water and sanitation assistance remains a high priority for RiD+ in Haiti as we continue to develop and implement projects across country. We have implemented over a dozen projects in Haiti; reach out if you would like specific details.

Thank you for your continued support!

- RiD+ Team

story:
AzTech Star Constellation

Technology can be challenging.  At AzTech Star we've set out to create a simple solution for family communication, entertainment and learning that "just works" - AzTech Star Constellation.  Simply connect two or more of your AzTech Stars to your WiFi router and the devices will automatically connect to each other, allowing your whole family to communicate room to room.

Welcome screen offering to connect to your Wi-Fi


No need to create accounts or remember passwords, just talk to your family and get the every day information you care about.


Device setup flow


With a simple screen touch and without having to do any tedious setup your family will be able to...

  • Talk to any Star in your home or...
  • Broadcast voice messages to all other Stars in your home with a single button
  • Read news articles, recipes, kids stories from multiple sources
  • Get current local weather and five day forecast
  • Listen to kids music, fairy tales and fun facts (for children)
  • Listen to different genres of music (for their parents)
  • Display learning material to your kids (math, science, etc.)

The screensaver feature allows you to view pictures of landscapes, animals and other categories.  Add your own photos to a Star and your Star can become a family picture frame!

We feel that this kind of device would make peoples' lives easier and bring families closer.


Home screen showing news, other connected Stars, Broadcast option, weather and other options


What We Need Your Contributions For

With your contributions we will be able to:

  • Design and acquire hardware necessary to build this product
  • Build more content for both children and adults
  • Add more features to your Star (Baby monitor mode is one)
  • Make video calls from room to room
Your contributions will help develop technology that is simple and easy to use for anyone.  It will also give you early, discounted access to the product.  You could be one of the first users to own an AzTech Star Constellation.  If you so choose, once you receive this product, you will get a chance to provide feedback to us on how you like it and how you would like to see it improved.

Risks & Challenges

Finding quality hardware can be a challenge.  We'll use some of the funds we raise to research and find the best hardware to make your Stars reliable and lasting.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can help financially, but if you find this idea interesting we ask you to please share this campaign with your friends and relatives.   Also, to stay up to date on the latest developments, please like our page on facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/aztechstar/ and follow us on Twitter:  https://www.twitter.com/AztechStar

Who we are and what we do

AzTech Star is a small technology and innovation company. Our goal and philosophy is to build applications and devices that are easy to use for everyone, not just technologically savvy people. We want to make our devices as easy and user friendly as possible.

We are located in sunny Phoenix, Arizona, United States.

story:
In 2008, CHES began working with local partners (i.e Projects for Haiti & Partners for Change) and Haitian-American business professionals to educate, to mentor, and to fund: women-owned businesses and small business owners. 

88% of the content we teach is immediately put into practice by small business owners.

100% of small business owners who have completed our programs in the past two years, have increased profitability.

This summer, CHES will return to Haiti to continue its efforts to decrease economic disparities that exists today by hosting a  training for 100 people!   In order to run an optimal program, it costs $50 per attendee to participate in our 3-day training. This sum includes 2 meals a day, learning material expenses and a certificate of completion. Our goal is to receive enough contributions so that we may make this event free for all participants and provide them with the best possible learning experience. 

 We would love for you to join us as we aim to provide the necessary tools and resources to aspiring entrepreneurs and small business owners in rural Haiti through economic development and education.

Get a bit of flavor of what it's like in a training by viewing this short clip:


View pictures from our last training:

story:
Summary

Hello, my name is Sam Otero I have had the privilege of being married to my beautiful wife Madeline for almost 27 years. Unfortunately, she suffers from a severe case of epilepsy since the age of 5 and experiences all types of seizures that are not totally controlled by medicine. Throughout the years she has undergone treatments by medicine, diet, medical implants and brain surgery with no outstanding effects.

In my graduate studies I explored the idea of trying to find a way that will reduce the effects of her seizures to help her avoid or minimize bodily damage. To further explain, directly after the convulsive stage of her seizures, she is in a state of confusion where she often gets hurt while her brain returns to a state of consciousness. During this time of confusion there is a certain amount of auto functionality that a person will exhibit due to daily routines that the brain has learned. I was intrigued by how accurate some of her actions were even though they were automatic. It seemed as if she was possibly reacting to her last state of mind because her facial expressions were consistent with how she was feeling or what she was experiencing before the seizure. I wondered what would happen if a peaceful thought was introduced before the seizure took hold and if it would help reduce the confusion. I asked her to sing a favorite song that calms her to see if it would produce that peaceful canvass that her mind may see during the automatic functioning. I found that certain seizures were reduced by her singing while in the seizure. We have been able to reproduce this effect 65% of the time but further research will help us determine how it can more affective for her and the population of people who suffer from epilepsy. The understanding is, that a part of the right side of her brain is activated through singing which interferes with the seizure crossing from the left side to the right side of the brain. This was confirmed by an epileptologist from the University Hospital in Denver. In effect, she is naturally doing what stimulators are trying to do.

What We Need

Our campaign is to raise funds for testing and recording equipment, medical tests, surveys, and expenses that are not covered by medical insurance due to the nature of research. We believe, with your help, we can provide a possible intervention that may not require intrusive medical procedures and may help increase the quality of life for those who suffer with uncontrolled seizures. We also believe this research may theoretically help us towards the development of an early warning system for those who are not able to detect a seizure before it starts.

We are looking to raise 30,000 to purchase the equipment we need, medical tests, and surveys to confirm our research. It will also help us with incurred medical expenses and having to modify areas of the house to facilitate recording. In a sense we are transforming our house into a laboratory to reduce research costs. If we can’t reach our entire goal, we will use the finances to start with the preliminary studies and hope to entice other contributors to our campaign.

The Impact

The heart of this campaign is to help those who suffer from uncontrolled seizures, or epilepsy in general, and have had to limit their lifestyles dramatically to the point where their quality of life has been minimized. It may also help those who are caretakers that share some of the loss of quality of life. We have seen too many who have been in danger of hurting themselves and/or others as they attempt to live their lives. It’s sad to see the look in their eyes as they feel trapped in their own homes or by the confines of their disability and together we can make a difference. My wife and I hope that our efforts can be used to help people around the world. Because we have experienced success in the minimizing of her seizures, we feel confident that others may have the same opportunities that we are experiencing.

My wife and I have taken the stand to go through whatever inconveniences this research may cause for the sake of others. We are not students looking to learn about this disability alone but participants looking to help others in need. Thank you to our friends and family who are willing to help where they can and face the challenges with us.

Please take the time to share this with everyone you meet and ask them to check out our campaign.

Thank you,

Sam & Madeline Otero

story:
Overview

5.5 billion people live in countries that persecute citizens for their religious beliefs.
135 million girls and women have been subjected to female genital mutilation.
60 million refugees have been forcibly displaced due to ethnic, political or religious persecution.
35.8 million human beings are enslaved worldwide.
2.4 million slaves are trafficked for sex and labor.
800,000 victims of human trafficking are trafficked across international borders.
1 act of compassion can ease their suffering.

That was my belief 3-1/2 years ago when I founded a tiny nonprofit organization dedicated to combatting human trafficking in the US.  Since that time, we've conducted more than 60 rescue operations, awarded more than 30 scholarships, and have provided recovery services to hundreds of survivors.

As I continued to immerse myself in the survivor experience, however, two crucial factors came to light: (1) the very nature of trafficking precludes any attempt to impose geographic limitations on efforts to track rings, rescue victims or aid survivors, and (2) the link between human trafficking and other human rights violations is so inextricable that it is impossible to combat the former without also addressing the latter. So, as of 2016, Safe Port Initiative expanded its services to embrace victims of ALL human rights violations and acts of persecution, and we launched operations in Mexico, Morocco, Kenya, Turkey, Lebanon, India and China. Through our international partnerships, we also acquired access to more than 3,000 meeting spaces around the world, all of which are equipped with video conferencing technology.

And so the idea for our distance learning program was born, Through the use of culturally appropriate avatars that simulate children, teens, young adults, older adults, and even animals, we can now deliver curriculum ranging from primary education to adult vocational training in more than 30 languages on six continents, at a cost of just $10 per week per student!

The Need

 

Depending on grade level and curriculum content, courses range from 4 weeks to 12 weeks in length, and students attend class for one hour each week. Based on a classroom size of 10 students, the total cost of delivering a course is $10 per student per week.  This includes the cost of hourly meeting space rental with use of video conferencing technology, licensing rights for use of the avatars, student materials and supplies, and an hourly wage for local class proctors who guide students through the course content, ensure all students have access to necessary resources, and  help to ensure that the whole process runs smoothly.

The purpose of our $28,800 campaign goal is  to fund the education of 40 survivors of human trafficking and 20 displaced survivors of persecution and civil war for one full year in three locations:

Nairobi, Kenya. The US State Department has placed Kenya on its Tier 2 Watch List for human trafficking. Nairobi, specifically, is a major source, transit and destination city for trafficked persons, due in part to frequent flights to and from Asia and the Middle East, as well as a recent increase in drug trafficking. Classes in Nairobi will include primary academic education, secondary acdemic education, life skills training, ESL, and adult vocational training.

Casablanca, Morocco. Morocco has also been placed on the US State Department's Tier 2 Watch List for human trafficking. In addition to serving as a sex trafficking center and a gateway for trafficking women and girls to Europe, Casablanca is a major hub for child labor, with victims as young as 6 years of age. Classes in Casablanca will include primary academic education, secondary academic education, life skills training, ESL, and adult vocational training.

Beirut, Lebanon. In addition to being yet another Tier 2 trafficking country, Lebanon is also "home" to nearly 1.5 million Syrians fleeing rape, torture, and chemical warfare in their homeland. More than 70% of these refugees live in extreme poverty with no hope for a better life in sight. Classes in Beirut will include primary academc education, secondary academic education, life skills training, ESL, and adult vocational training.

The Impact on Survivors

 

For most victims of persecution, human trafficking and other human rights violations, the hopes and dreams they cherished as young children have fallen prey to depression and self doubt. Through education, however, they learn how to recapture those dreams and turn them into reality. Even more importantly, they are empowered to help others in their communities overcome the economic and social injustice that makes them susceptible to the deceptive, coercive, abusive tactics of traffickers and others who prey upon vulnerable and marginalized populations.

 

The Impact on Donors

 

In addition to all of the fun stuff listed in the "Perks" section, as a donor, you'll have the satisfaction of knowing that you are literally impacting the life of another human being in a meaningful and lasting way. By sponsoring a survivor for a week or longer, you will be helping to create sustainable social change that will result in a global environment that is safer, more economically sound, and more fruitful for all citizens of the world, now and for generations to come. In short, this is your opportunity to rewrite history and redefine social determinism by predicating the survival of our fellow human beings not on genetic or military prowess, but on a conscious choice to demonstrate compassion.

story:
The Mullen Engineering Club needs your help!!!

Our club aims to reach out to students and show them the amazing world of engineering through fun, challenging projects and competitions held throughout the school year.


Club History 

The club was founded in September of 2013. Initially, the club consisted of a few members that would meet up to do projects outside of school on their own time and with their own money. The club was able to organize two projects during that year; a Rube Goldberg machine and CO2 car races. Even though we weren't able to do much in the beginning due to our club size and lack of funding, those projects were incredibly fun and entertaining for those of us who were able to participate. We didn't want that experience to be limited to just the few members we had. We needed to expand. Throughout 2014-15 school year, we spent months campaigning for the club. Eventually we were able to obtain our own building space at Mullen, The MakerSpace. We received a plethora of tools, machinery, computers and software by repurposing equipment from around the campus and from receiving generous donations. We also received three 3D printers along with modeling software and since then have been teaching students how to use them. With our own space, tools, materials, and experience, we were ready to expand the club. At the beginning of the 2015-16 school year, we went from being a five person club to a community of over 40 people and growing. 


What We Plan to Do

For the 2016 school year and beyond, we hope to have more opportunities for the new student members to gain and express their love for designing and building things. Through our diligence, and with YOUR help, we hope to bring and accomplish many projects and competitions that teach our members about the fun and usefulness of being an engineer. We have already set up a list of projects and competitions to participate in now and in the coming future.  Here are a few examples:

       

  -Team America Rocketry Challenge (TARC) http://rocketcontest.org/ 

TARC is a wonderful competition of around 1,000 teams from across the nation that compete annually to build a rocket that meets certain challenges and design constraints. The challenge this year is to launch a rocket that weighs less than two pounds to an altitude of 850 feet, complete the entire flight in 44-46 seconds, all while carrying a payload of two eggs that can't be damaged. The top 100 qualifying teams are invited to Washington DC in spring to compete for more than $100,000 in scholarships and prizes. With the knowledge and creativity of our members, we are confident and ready to build the best rocket we can conceive and make it to D.C.

       

  -Street Legal Car

We have had experience in building go karts in previous years but now with the amount of people we have and the equipment at our disposal, we believe that we can make a street legal car. Made from a steel frame with sizable motorcycle engine complete with headlights, tail-lights and turn signals, we will have a car you can drive on the road.

      

  -Pneumatic Cannons

These won't just be a PVC pipe with a valve in it kind of cannon. We plan to build intricate firing mechanisms that allows us to shoot multiple spud projectiles without any significant manual operation. This project can also be individual so that each member can design and make their own device in order to understand how to create properly working mechanical systems. Once everyone finishes their cannon, we will have a distance, accuracy and fire rate competition between members.

        

-Robotics

Robotics by nature is very complex and difficult to learn. Being able to make a working robot is one of the most rewarding experiences to have as an engineer. This is why we want our club to start learning and gaining experience in robotics systems. We will be using kits, such as VEX Robotics, Arduino and other materials to make roll-specific robots to compete against each other in various bot challenges. This will give club members a foundation in robotics so that someday we can move on to the more complicated robotic projects and even competitions such as FIRST Robotics, one of the largest high school competitions in the US offering over $20 million in scholarships.

      

 - 3D Design software 

The school already possess three 3D printers and computer assisted design (CAD) software that we use in our MakerSpace. Printing models from them is not only amazing to watch but it also is very useful, especially in today's ever advancing technological world. To be a successful and well versed engineer in the modern world, you must have a background in CAD software. Most people will have to go to college to learn how to use this difficult to obtain and understand software, but as a club we aim to get our members well versed in the software to give them a head start in the world of engineering. 


All of this is just a sampling of what we aim to achieve over the next coming years. We are far from short on ideas and imagination for projects but we just need the funding to make these dreams a reality.


WE NEED YOU!!!

Our club is looking for any and all help we can get, and every donation will be greatly appreciated. Your donations will help us to fund our projects and materials such as rocket kits, licenses for 3D design programs, plastic filament for the 3D printers, tool sets, and other general supplies that we would tremendously love to have. But, this campaign doesn't stop at the goal listed on this page. Even if we meet our goal you can still help fund us, allowing us not only to do the projects mentioned but also allowing us to make them more extravagant and to bring them to more new student members. Spread the word about our club anywhere you can and thank you so much for your donations!

story:
A mobile Tech Hub to provide vital legal information, education and free WiFi to refugees living in the irregular refugee camps in Europe, and provide support for refugees as citizen journalists.

Follow us at

https://www.facebook.com/RefugeeInfoBus/

https://twitter.com/RefugeeInfoBus

What is Refugee Info Bus?

Our aim is to help refugees achieve successful asylum in a safe and welcoming place through information empowerment and digital literacy. To do this we will create a Mobile Tech Hub complete with reliable electricity, high speed internet, laptops and tablets. 

We (Sarah Story and Rowan Farrell) have been volunteering in the Jungle Books library in the Calais “Jungle” refugee camp in France since September 2015. The Refugee Info Bus is a continuation and development of this work; disseminating multilingual legal information, facilitating the work of asylum lawyers organising family reunification cases and to run projects and courses that help empower and give a voice to refugees. We have recently purchased the vehicle for this project which will use a solar-based power system, and have teamed up with a non-profit organisation for mobile WiFi.

Why?

Many reports show that at every point of the European refugee crisis there is a lack of information available to refugees, including legal rights, success rates of asylum in different countries, and changes in refugee policy including the opening or closing of borders.

This information exists and is freely available, but there are not many people offering it. At the same time, many legal groups are willing to give their time, but do not have the facilities or the contacts to get started.

The Refugee Info Bus hopes to help approx. 150 individuals a day access the technology and resources they are lacking.

Refugee Citizen Journalism 

Additionally, we believe that the group who has the smallest voice in the debate and policy discussion regarding the European refugee crisis, are the refugees. We propose to counter this using methods of citizen journalism. Giving a voice to the voiceless.

This will be done through 

- Story writing sessions in native languages with finished work translated into European languages. 

- Photography workshops

- Video and video editing workshops

- Podcasts workshops

We need your help to get the IT equipment we need and to help keep the bus going for as long as necessary. 

Please donate, share and get in touch with any questions.
