story:
UN RÉSUMÉ DU PROJET
Après avoir créé en 2007 le Centre Tao Yoga à Lyon (quartier Croix-Rousse), l’aventure continue avec un projet de plus grande envergure : LA CRÉATION D’UN CENTRE SPIRITUEL ET DE REGENERATION dans l’une des régions les plus extraordinaires et magiques de cette planète : la Vallée sacrée des Incas, au cœur des Andes Péruviennes, entre Cuzco ("nombril" en Quechua) et le Macchu Picchu.

Voici la maison ! Climat idéal à 2800 mètres d'altitude, tout près des tropiques mais sans les moustiques :)  Le compromis de vente est signé, reste à la financer d'ici au 8 juillet 2016.

 
POURQUOI CETTE RÉGION EST SI PARTICULIÈRE

 Qu'est-ce qui attire des centaines de milliers de personnes du monde entier dans cette région ?

Tout simplement parce que cette vallée est unique !  Venez et vous comprendrez pourquoi.

La ville de Pisac (capitale Péruvienne de l'artisanat) est l'entrée de la vallée sacrée. Elle représente pour les anciens Incas un condor avec les ailes repliées et ce n'est qu'au bout de la vallée, au Macchu Picchu que ce condor déploie ces ailes pour s'envoler.

Cette oiseau mythique est le symbole parfait du chemin initiatique de l'Homme; trouvant en lui les ressources qui l’amènent de l'obscurité à la lumière et de l'enfermement à la liberté. 

L'image du condor, c'est aussi prendre de l'altitude pour voir de plus haut cette vie qui nous à été offerte.

Parfois, nous nous perdons en chemin, nous perdons le sens de la vie et elle n'a plus de goût. Prendre de la hauteur permet de retrouver son chemin, retrouver le fil de sa vie et enfin de s'y engager.


POURQUOI CETTE MAISON ?

Depuis des années, je suis à la recherche d’un lieu en pleine nature où je pourrais organiser des séjours de régénération et de ressourcement.

Quand je suis arrivé à la porte de cette maison, j’ai su que cela pouvait être là.

Une rivière qui longe le terrain, une allée d’eucalyptus majestueuse, la vue sur le coucher et le lever du soleil, le calme absolu tout en étant à proximité d’une petite ville (Calca) avec un marché de fruits et de légumes tous les jours, un aéroport à une heure, le Macchu Picchu à 65 km , le lac Titicaca et la jungle amazonienne à 8 heures de bus, et, sur place des sites incas et pré incas de toutes beautés et d’une forte puissance énergétique.

La maison orientée plein sud est constituée de 5 chambres, d'un salon avec une cheminée, d'une salle à manger, d'une cuisine et d'une grande salle indépendante dans laquelle j'envisage d'y faire un studio.Elle pourra accueillir confortablement une dizaine de personnes.

Le terrain d'une surface de 1350 m² accueillera la construction d'une salle de pratique qui sera ouverte à la location pour des stages, des formations, des événements autour de la régénération, du développement personnel  et du bien-être. 


QUI SUIS-JE ?


Pour me présenter brièvement, j’ai très tôt été attiré par les traditions orientales. J’ai commencé à apprendre le chinois dès l’âge de 11 ans. Plus tard, j’ai eu la chance de faire une formation de professeur de Kundalini Yoga, de praticien en Chineitsang (massage Taoïste des organes internes) ainsi que 3 ans d’études du Karam Kriya (numérologie sacrée). Tout ce qui concerne la guérison holistique de l'être humain me passionne.

J’ai ouvert le centre Tao Yoga à Lyon sur le plateau de la Croix-Rousse en 2007 et j’organise depuis plusieurs années des séjours de régénération en nature avec ma collaboratrice Sat Prem.

Actuellement, je suis entrain de finir d'écrire deux livres que vous pouvez dès maintenant commander sur cette page. L'un sur le parcours qui m'a conduit dans les Andes et l'autre sur le lien peu connu entre l'âme et la digestion.

Pour plus information sur le centre et mes activités, vous pouvez faire un tour sur les sites suivants :

www.taoyoga-chineitsang.net

www.centretaoyoga.fr


POURQUOI VOTRE SOUTIEN EST PRÉCIEUX MAINTENANT ?                                    A moins de 5 mois de la signature définitive, c'est maintenant que je dois faire la différence.

Le coût total du projet est de 214 000 euros comprenant l'achat de la maison, les frais divers d'achat et les travaux nécessaires pour faire de cette maison un nid douillet. 4000 euros ont déjà été versé pour le compromis.

A ce jour, je suis propriétaire des murs du centre Tao Yoga mais je n'ai pas d'économie de coté. Je ne souhaite pas vendre le centre de Lyon dans l'esprit de créer une passerelle entre le Pérou et la France.

Deux banques ont refusées de me faire un prêt car mes revenus ne sont pas suffisant à leurs yeux  même s'ils pourraient prendre une hypothèque sur mon local.

C'est pourquoi, je m'en remet à la communauté humaine, c'est à dire vous :) pour que ce projet aboutisse.


COMMENT SOUTENIR MON PROJET ?
En en parlant autour de vous.

En partageant ce projet dans vos réseaux.

En achetant les livres en pré-vente.

En participant aux stages.

En vous offrant un soin de Chi Nei Tsang.

Je suis également ouvert à toutes autres propositions allant dans le sens de ce projet.


VOICI PLUS D'INFORMATION SUR LES CONTREPARTIES

                    

                       


Un extrait du livre à paraitre au plus tard en juin 2016

" Choisir la division, c'est comme jeter ses clefs dans l'eau trouble d'un lac, on se met soi-même à la porte de sa maison.

En retrouvant l'Unité, l'eau s’éclaircit et l'on retourne chez soi.

La seule question qui importe donc est : Comment retrouvé l'Unité ?

Cette question en implique une autre : qu'est-ce que l'Unité ?

L'Unité est-elle appréhendable par le mental qui est justement par essence la fonction en soi qui coupe, qui juge et qui catégorise ?

Comment unir et réunir ?

Comment être à la fois de gauche ET de droite ?

Blanc ET noir ?

Haut et bas ?

Feu et eau ?

Impossible car c'est un paradoxe, mais le paradoxe est justement le garage de notre mental, là ou l'on gare notre voiture car elle n'a rien à faire dans le salon.

Notre salon n'est pas une autoroute. Si tout va bien, c'est le lieu ou l'on se pose, ou l'on se dépose et ou l'on se repose. C'est notre havre de paix.

Comment retrouver l'Unité ?

En retrouvant la paix en soi.

En unissant et en réunissant en soi ce qui à priori est contradictoire.

On ne peux résoudre un paradoxe.

On ne peux que faire la paix en soi et alors, il n'y a plus de paradoxe. Il se dissout comme le sucre dans le café."


A ma connaissance , c'est le premier ouvrage en Français qui traite d'une ancienne tradition de guérison des Andes, pourtant utilisé depuis des milliers d'années par les chamanes et les guérisseurs. Il est constitué d'un mélange d'explications factuelles et de plusieurs textes écrits dans la nature ou dans des lieux de hautes énergies, sur des sites Incas et pré-Incas.

       


                        


Je partage dans ce livre plus de 15 années de pratique, de recherche et d'expérience autour de la digestion. J'aborde entre autre les thèmes suivant :

Digestion et habitat : Comprenez votre digestion en observant votre habitat.

L'alimentation pour augmenter votre énergie (et pas le contraire !)

Respiration Yogique pour stimuler les organes internes et la détoxication.

Écrire pour renforcer votre capacité à digérer.

La place du ventre dans le corps. Le ventre n'est pas une finalité mais un lieu de passage.

Comprendre la vie humaine et les étapes nécessaires à traverser.

Qu'est-ce que l’âme à l’intérieur de nous ?  Comment reconnaitre ses besoins ? Quels liens entretient-elle avec la digestion et pourquoi on ne peut la laisser sans voix et sans voie.

Ce livre se veut pratique et accessible. De nombreux exercices vous sont proposés pour avoir les moyens de prendre votre vie en main. Digérer oui, mais pour évoluer dans le sens de nos aspirations profondes.


Extrait d'une méditation

Méditation sur le point précis du centre du fond du nombril

" Amenez votre attention et ce puissant sourire au niveau de votre nombril. Sentez que l’énergie de la Terre remonte en vous par vos jambes et vous donne tout le soutien nécessaire pour continuer votre méditation. Sentez le soutien du règne minéral avec les pierres précieuses et les belles montagnes que vous aimez. Sentez le soutien du règne végétal avec les grandes forêts, les fleurs et les plantes qui guérissent. Sentez le soutien du règne animal avec vos animaux préférés, ceux qui vous donnent de l’énergie et de la force. Et enfin, sentez l’énergie de la terre elle-même;  puissante, lumineuse et souriante.Sentez l’amour de la Terre-Mère remonter en vous. Sentez cette vibration et cette énergie de la vie.

Soyez curieux (se) maintenant du centre du fond du nombril, cet espace particulier et unique de votre corps. Détendez-vous et amenez une attention soutenue mais douce dans ce point précis du centre du fond du nombril.

Y-a-t-il des ressentis dans ce point ? Une chaleur ? Une vibration ? Une lumière ? Un passage ? Rien du tout ? Soyez curieux(se).

Votre mental va sûrement se déconcentrer, être dispersé mais gardez le cap aussi longtemps que cela reste confortable pour vous. "



LES SOINS ET LES STAGES D'INITIATION AU CHINEITSANG
(soin Taoïste des organes internes pour le bien-être du ventre et le confort digestif )
 En réservant un soin ou le "Pack Digestion" sur le site d'Indiegogo, une partie de la somme est réservée pour mon projet.

Le Chineitsang est ma spécialité depuis plus de 15 ans ! J'ai appris principalement auprès de Gilles Marin, auteur du livre "Guérir de l’intérieur avec le Chineitsang" aux éditions Trédaniels mais aussi avec Stephanie Wilger (USA) et Ron Diana (USA)



UN SÉJOUR EXCEPTIONNEL EN GITE TOUT CONFORT
"O saveur de l'instant" à Saint Usuge (71)
Avec Frédéric Swierc, le porteur du projet et Sat Prem, professeur de Kundalini Yoga et de Danse, venez participer à un séjour de régénération. En réservant sur ce site, une partie de la somme est réservée pour le projet.

                



STAGE : NETTOYAGE DES MÉMOIRES ANCESTRALES POUR UN NOUVEAU DÉPART. Avec Sergey Baranov et Frédéric Swiercz
10 jours et 9 nuits à Calca, au coeur de la vallée sacrée des Incas.
Initiation à l'ancienne tradition chamanique des Andes.
Plusieurs sessions sont prévue sur les prochains 24 mois.
Changer de vie n'est pas facile mais néanmoins possible. Cela commence par un mot tout simple : Oui.
Oui à la vie.
Oui à l'envie.
Oui à l'envie de la vie.


                          



MERCI DE VOTRE SOUTIEN !
PRÉSERVEZ LA NATURE EST NÉCESSAIRE
PRÉSERVEZ SA NATURE EST INDISPENSABLE.

story:
ARABIC VERSION IS AVAILABLE BELOW

ABOUT ADEF

Arab Digital Expression Foundation (ADEF) is a non-profit foundation that builds spaces, fosters environments for expression and learning, enhances skills and develops knowledge tools to support and empower teenagers and youth, groups or individuals, working on the ground to strengthen their practices and engagement with society.

The key activity and the reason behind our inception of ADEF in 2009 is the Arab Digital Expression Camps - ADEC that sits in the heart of foundation!

What is ADEC?

Arab Digital Expression Camps (ADEC) is a two week summer camp that has been taking place for 11 years in a row, designed for Arab teenagers aged between 12 to 15 coming from different social and economic backgrounds and tuition is not a must for participation, and those who can afford it may also contribute toward the scholarship of others, while those who cannot afford the full tuition, are partially or fully funded. This is why ADEF fundraises for the camps from organizations, companies, communities and individuals.

The residential fun-based summer camps gathers 66 participants and we try to strike a 50% female participation in every camp. It acts as an experiential venue and ideal environment for learning and self-expression. With a carefully crafted program born out of months of curricula development and a highly trained and engaged team, the results are astounding.

ADEC crafts a structure where participants freely explore and experiment with the rich programming in both digital and physical activities that emancipate a sense of mental and physical expression. From video-making, to sound and music production, to creative applications on the web, creative physical activities, art workshops and field trips, the two-week camp quickly evolve into a revolution of expression.

Since 2007 more than 630 male and female teenagers from 11 Arab countries have lived and benefited from the experience, offering them a unique opportunity to discover their abilities and express themselves freely through arts and technology​ while building their personality by learning ethical values such as :Humanity, equality, respect others and accept difference, adaptation and  coexistence, leadership, critical thinking and teamwork.

Because of the diversity and intensity of the program and participants, the camps are often a life-changing experience, for both youngsters and trainers. Youngsters and trainers share experiences and bond through both the physical and digital spaces of they create.

Final outputs from the camps are displayed on the web. Other avenues of exhibition are also arranged, through local and regional media and partner organizations.

Watch a selection of  camps workshops videos:

  • Robot and a turbine and 3D printer
  • Filming, editing, dancing and diving

 

When and Where?

ADEC 12th annual camp will take place from July 16 - July 30, 2018 in Lebanon.

How to support us?

With this campaign we are aiming to collect $15,000 which would cover the participation of 10 underprivileged teenagers and their travel expense.The cost to fund one camper is $1,500 which covers: full board accommodation, education fees, computer lab facilities, video & sound equipment, scheduled trips, sports equipment, cultural activities and transportation.

Every year ADEC main goal is to provide scholarships for 40 underprivileged Arab teenagers ( 60% of the total number of participants) whose communities remain deprived and lack access to knowledge, information, artistic and cultural services through the collaboration of partner NGOs in the region whose mandate focuses on youth development, ICT, arts, and expression.

Part of the camps becoming a meaningful experience is community participation in making it unfold and successfully happen, in the belief of the critical value of youth engagement.

We cannot do this without the ongoing support of people like you who believe in building a foundation within our youth for a brighter future.

Even if we don't reach our goal with this campaign, every penny raised will go to ensuring our camps are a success and a true product of community engagement.

 

The Impact

The growth of our community, its entanglement with a variety of causes and its expansion into different territories of art making, expression and technology creation are key indicators of the camps' success. The camps sets the stage for this community by providing a unique experience of learning, self-discovery, critical thinking and expression, which are missing aspects in most mainstream education across the region.

Here are few examples of the short term impact we have seen throughout the previous camps rounds:

  • ADEC 2017: A Lebanese camper, who was very involved in all sound workshops, learned how to DJ and DJed twice during the camp, including the graduation party. He is still in contact with and being mentored by our sound trainer to evolve his skills in music.
  • ADEC 2016: We discovered two female techies (from Port-Said and Damanhur Governorates which are usually extremely marginalized compared to urban cities in Egypt) whose graduation project was a "Raspberry pie" that unlocks the Wi-Fi passwords!
  • ADEC 2013 - 2015: Four girls have been awarded UWC scholarship, which is one of 16 campuses located on five continents that serves students age 16-19 who represent more than 70 different countries, to do their masters in the different fields of arts ( music, theatre, visual arts...etc) through their unique academic approach and program that combines academic challenge with an experiential, hands-on approach to learning.

Success Stories:

  1. One of the major and most important indicator of success is that after more than 10 years of ADEF youth empowerment experience, ADEC camps (since 2016) are now led and managed by its first and second generation campers; meaning ADEC ex-campers who participated in the camps between 2007 and 2011, and who grew and developed and are now capable of handling the running of the camp. Since then, ADEC camps are fully running by its ex-campers to date.
  2. Amina Allam, a success story of a young female teenager who joined ADEC in 2008 as a camper and over the time her skills have developed qualifying her to work different roles in the following camps rounds as group leader then a camp administrator, then group leader supervisor and trainer. Additionally, Amina worked as an assistant producer from 2014 - 2016 in a film production company in Cairo and she is currently completing her degree in digital film production at SAE institute in London.
  3. Shady Said, is another success story of a teenager camper in ADEC 2008 who is now a trainer in the sound and music workshop since ADEC 2016 to date . (Watch Video)
  4. Yazan Arori is the youngest trainer in ADEC! Yazan is 18 years old from Palestine. He joined ADEC for two consecutive years in 2014 and 2015 where he showed impressive development in the workshops of technology and programming through the two year that allowed him to participate in ADEC 2016 as a co-trainer in the "Makers" workshop. He is now is Berlin pursuing a degree in Electrical Engineering.

Watch what campers say about the camps:

  • Omar Abdel Rahim and his experience in learning film making
  • Dina Sabry and her experience in Theatre and performance

Enjoy a selection of participants production:

 

Also, this is a sample of what has been said about the camps in the media and in academia:

  • "Free Expression - The Arab Digital Expression Foundation in conversation with Laura Cugusi"
  • “Access to Knowledge in Egypt” – Bloomsbury book release
  • “Tweet Freedom” – Wired Magazine UK

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot fund our goal, we understand… but you can still contribute by sharing our goal among your family, friends and community on FB, Twitter and Instagram!

 

عن أضِف:

مؤسسة التعبير الرقمي العربي - أضِف، مؤسسة أهلية غير هادفة للربح تبني مساحات وتتبنى بيئات للتعبير والتعلّم، وتعزز مهارات وتطور أدوات معرفة لدعم وتمكين الفتية والشباب، مجموعات أو أفراد، لتدعيم ممارساتهم وانخراطهم في المجتمع.

مخيمات أضِف للفتية هي البذرة الأولى التي انطلقت منها مؤسسة التعبير الرقمي العربي - أضِف في 2009 والتي لا تزال النشاط الرئيسي للمؤسسة إلى الآن.

ما هى مخيمات أضِف للفتية؟

مخيمات صيفية سنوية فريدة تتجدد منذ 11 سنة، مُصَممة للفتية والفتيات العرب الذين تتراوح أعمارهم بين 12 - 15 سنة من جميع الخلفيات الاقتصادية والاجتماعية حيث أن الإشتراك في المخيمات ليس مشروطًا بالإمكانيات المادية. فقد يمكن للمشاركين المقتدرين دفع رسوم الاشتراك بالكامل والمساهمة أيضًا في تمويل غيرهم من غير المقتدرين ، في حين أن أولئك الذين لا يستطيعون دفع الرسوم بالكامل، يتم تمويلهم جزئيًا أو كليًا. ولهذا تسعى أضِف باستمرار لجمع التبرعات للمخيمات من المنظمات والشركات والمجتمعات والأفراد.

هي مخيمات تعليمية وترفيهية تجمع 66 مشارك ونحاول دائمًا الحفاظ على مشاركة الفتيات بنسبة 50% كل عام. يعد المخيم مساحة للتجريب وبيئة مثالية للتعلم والتعبير عن الذات، وبفضل البرنامج الدقيق والمناهج التي تم تطويرها بعناية وفريق عمل مُدَرب على أعلى مستوى من الخبرة والالتزام، فإن المخرجات النهائية والنتائج تكون مذهلة.

خلال مدة المخيم تتعرّض الفتيات والفتية في بيئة آمنة إلى طيف واسع من المحفزّات الفنية ويستكشفون أدوات للتعبير والتواصل ويطورون مهاراتهم في إطار منهج متوازن يضم أنشطة رقمية وتقنية (صناعة الفيديو، إنتاج الصوت، التصميم البصري، تطبيقات الوِب الإبداعية، تصميم الألعاب، البرمجة) وأخرى بدنية تركز على تحفيز التعبير الذاتي العاطفي، الفكري والجسدي مثل (الفنون والحرف، الرقص والاستعراض، (السرد القصصي والرياضة).

يعمل المشاركون على مشروعاتهم الخاصة التي يتم عرضها في اليوم الأخير من المخيم وتُنشر مختارات منها على شبكة الإنترنت كما تقوم أضِف بتنظيم قنوات أخرى لعرض وترويج هذه المُخرجات من خلال وسائل الإعلام المحلية والإقليمية و المنظمات أيضًا.

شارك واستفاد من هذه التجربة أكثر من 630 فتى وفتاة من 11 دولة عربية منذ إطلاق المخيمات في 2007  حتى الآن وقد أتاح لهم فرصة فريدة لاكتشاف قدراتهم والتعبير عن أنفسهم بحرية من خلال الفنون والتكنولوجيا بالإضافة إلى بناء شخصيتهم من خلال تعلم القيم الأخلاقية مثل: الإنسانية والمساواة واحترام الآخرين وقبول الاختلاف والتكيف والتعايش والقيادة والتفكير النقدي والعمل الجماعي.

بسبب تنوع وكثافة البرنامج وغنى المشاركين، تعد المخيمات تجربة فارقة في الحياة لكل من المشاركين والمدربين حيث يتشارك المشاركون والمدربون الخبرات و يترابطون معًا من خلال المساحات المادية والرقمية التي يخلقونها.

يتم عرض المخرجات النهائية من المخيمات على شبكة الإنترنت. كما يتم ترتيب طرق أخرى للمعرض من خلال وسائل الإعلام المحلية والإقليمية والمنظمات.

شاهد نماذج لورشات عمل من المخيمات السابقة:

●       روبوت و توربين و طابعة ثلاثية الأبعاد

●       تصوير و مونتاج و رقص و غطس و انطلاق

 
 

المكان و الزمان

ستقام الدورة الثانية عشر من مخيمات أضِف للفتية في الفترة من 16  إلى 30 يوليو/ تموز 2018 في لبنان.

كيف يمكنكم دعمنا و مساعدتنا؟

نتطلع في هذه الحملة التمويلية لجمع مبلغ وقدره  15000 دولار أمريكي لتوفير 10 منح كاملة ل 10 فتية و فتيات. تقدر تكلفة تمويل فتى أو فتاة في المخيم 1500 دولار أمريكي (شاملة الإقامة كاملة لمدة 14 يوم ورسوم التدريب وأجهزة الصوت والموسيقى ومعامل الحوسبة وكافة الأنشطة الرياضية والثقافية الأخرى بالإضافة إلى تكلفة الإنتقالات).

نسعى كل عام من أجل تمويل عدد 40 مشارك (60% من إجمالي عدد المشاركين) الذين لا يستطيعون تحمل تكلفة  الإشتراك في المخيم من خلال منح كاملة وجزئية، يتم تخصيصها للفتية الذين لا تزال مجتمعاتهم محرومة ويفتقرون إلى منفذ للحصول على المعرفة والمعلومات والأنشطة الفنية والتقنية . يتم ذلك بالتعاون مع شركاؤنا في المنطقة العربية، من المنظمات غير الحكومية التي يتركز نشاطها في مجالات تنمية وتطوير الشباب وتكنولوجيا المعلومات والاتصالات والفنون والتعبير.

إن مشاركة المجتمع معنا في تنفيذ المخيمات ونجاحها وإيمانهم مثلنا بقيمة مشاركة الشباب في المجتمع من أهم المؤشرات التي جعلت من هذا المشروع تجربة ذات مغزى.

ولهذا، لا يمكننا القيام بذلك دون الدعم المستمر المقدم من قبل أشخاص مثلكم يؤمنون ببناء قدرات شبابنا من أجل مستقبل أكثر إشراقًا.

في حال عدم تحقيق هدفنا من هذه الحملة ، فإن كل ما يتم جمعه يعد ضمانًا لنجاح مخيماتنا وأثر حقيقي لمشاركة المجتمع.

الأثر

إن نمو مجتمعنا وتشابكه مع مجموعة متنوعة من الأسباب وتوسعه في جوانب مختلفة من إنتاج فن وتعبير وابتكار تكنولوجيا من المؤشرات الرئيسية لنجاح المخيمات. إذ تهيئ المخيمات المسرح لهذا المجتمع من خلال توفير تجربة فريدة من نوعها للتعلم، واكتشاف الذات، والتفكير النقدي والتعبير الحر، وهي جوانب مفقودة في المنظومة التعليمية في منطقتنا العربية.

فيما يلي بعض الأمثلة على الأثر قصير المدى الذي شهدناه على مدار المخيمات السابقة:

  1. مخيم 2017: قام أحد الفتية المشاركين من لبنان ، بالمشاركة بشكل كبير في جميع الورش التدريبية الخاصة بالصوت و تعلم فن تنسيق الموسيقى "دي جي" وقام بتنسيق الأغاني مرتين خلال المخيم ، بما في ذلك حفلة التخرج ولا يزال على اتصال بمدرب الصوت لتطوير مهاراته في الموسيقى.
  2. مخيم 2016: تم اكتشاف فتاتين من التقنيين (من محافظتي بورسعيد ودمنهور والتي تعد من المحافظات المهمشة مقارنة بالمحافظات الأخرى في مصر) وكان مشروع تخرجهما عبارة عن "راسبري باي" التي تقوم بفك شفرات وكلمات مرور شبكات الانترنت.
  3. مخيمات 2013 - 2015: حصلت أربع فتيات على منحة دراسية من جامعة  UWC ، وهي واحدة من أهم  16 جامعة في العالم، لدراسة الماجستير في مجالات الفنون المختلفة (الموسيقى) والمسرح والفنون البصرية ... الخ).

قصص نجاح

  1. أثمرت عشر سنوات من الخبرة والتمكين للفتية والفتيات من بلدان عربية مختلفة عن أن يتولى عدد من المشاركين القدامى من الجيل الأول والثاني (مشاركون من 2007 وحتى 2011) مسؤولية تنظيم وقيادة المخيمات بدأ من 2016. ونحن نحسب هذه الخطوة من إنجازاتنا الأهم  وإحدى أهم أهداف المخيمات التي تتحقق أمام أعيننا.
  2. أمينة علام ، قصة نجاح  شابة مصرية انضمت للمخيمات في عام 2008 كمشاركة، وطورت مهاراتها بشكل سريع لتصبح قادرة على تولي أدوار مختلفة في المخيمات اللاحقة (رائدة أسر ثم مسئول إداري في المخيم، ثم مشرف رواد الأسر ومدربة) بالإضافة إلى ذلك ، عملت أمينة كمساعد منتج في الفترة من 2014 - 2016 في شركة إنتاج أفلام في القاهرة ، وهي الآن تقوم باستكمال دراستها  في مجال إنتاج الأفلام الرقمية في معهد SAE في لندن.
  3. شادي سعيد ، قصة نجاح أخرى لشاب مصري شارك في مخيمات الفتية منذ 2008 والذي أصبح الآن مدربًا في ورشة الصوت والموسيقى منذ دورة 2016. (شاهد تجربة شادي)
  4. يزن عروري، هو أصغر مدرب مخيمات أضِف للفتية؛ شاب فلسطيني يبلغ من العمر 18 سنة. انضم إلى مخيمات أضِف للفتية لمدة سنتين متتاليتين في عامي 2014 و 2015 أظهر خلالهما تطورًا مدهشًا في ورش التكنولوجيا والبرمجة مما سمح له بالمشاركة في مخيم 2016 كمدرب مساعد في ورشة عمل "صناع". يدرس يزن مجال الهندسة الالكترونية في برلين حاليا..

شاهد ما يقوله الفتية و الفتيات عن المخيمات:

عمر عبد الرحيم و تجربته في تعلم صناعة الأفلام

دينا صبري و تجربة المسرح

استمتع بمجموعة من إنتاجات الفتية و الفتيات:

 

نماذج مما قيل عن المخيمات في وسائل الإعلام وفي الأوساط الأكاديمية:

  1. " التعبير الحر: مؤسسة التعبير الرقمي العربي في حوار مع لورا كوجوزي"
  2. إتاحة المعرفة في مصر - كتاب " Bloomsbury "

  3.  

    "غرِد حرية" - مجلة "Wired"، لندن

طرق أخرى للدعم

إذا لم تتمكن من تمويل هدفنا ماديًا، ساهموا معنا بالنشر والترويج للحملة مع العائلة والأصدقاء وعلى صفحات التواصل الاجتماعي: فيس بوك، تويتر، انستجرام.
story_txt:
ARABIC VERSION IS AVAILABLE BELOWABOUT ADEFArab Digital Expression Foundation (ADEF) is a non-profit foundation that builds spaces, fosters environments for expression and learning, enhances skills and develops knowledge tools to support and empower teenagers and youth, groups or individuals, working on the ground to strengthen their practices and engagement with society.The key activity and the reason behind our inception of ADEF in 2009 is the Arab Digital Expression Camps - ADEC that sits in the heart of foundation!What is ADEC?Arab Digital Expression Camps (ADEC) is a two week summer camp that has been taking place for 11 years in a row, designed for Arab teenagers aged between 12 to 15 coming from different social and economic backgrounds and tuition is not a must for participation, and those who can afford it may also contribute toward the scholarship of others, while those who cannot afford the full tuition, are partially or fully funded. This is why ADEF fundraises for the camps from organizations, companies, communities and individuals.The residential fun-based summer camps gathers 66 participants and we try to strike a 50% female participation in every camp. It acts as an experiential venue and ideal environment for learning and self-expression. With a carefully crafted program born out of months of curricula development and a highly trained and engaged team, the results are astounding.ADEC crafts a structure where participants freely explore and experiment with the rich programming in both digital and physical activities that emancipate a sense of mental and physical expression. From video-making, to sound and music production, to creative applications on the web, creative physical activities, art workshops and field trips, the two-week camp quickly evolve into a revolution of expression.Since 2007 more than 630 male and female teenagers from 11 Arab countries have lived and benefited from the experience, offering them a unique opportunity to discover their abilities and express themselves freely through arts and technology​ while building their personality by learning ethical values such as :Humanity, equality, respect others and accept difference, adaptation and  coexistence, leadership, critical thinking and teamwork.Because of the diversity and intensity of the program and participants, the camps are often a life-changing experience, for both youngsters and trainers. Youngsters and trainers share experiences and bond through both the physical and digital spaces of they create.Final outputs from the camps are displayed on the web. Other avenues of exhibition are also arranged, through local and regional media and partner organizations.Watch a selection of  camps workshops videos:Robot and a turbine and 3D printerFilming, editing, dancing and diving When and Where?ADEC 12th annual camp will take place from July 16 - July 30, 2018 in Lebanon.How to support us?With this campaign we are aiming to collect $15,000 which would cover the participation of 10 underprivileged teenagers and their travel expense.The cost to fund one camper is $1,500 which covers: full board accommodation, education fees, computer lab facilities, video & sound equipment, scheduled trips, sports equipment, cultural activities and transportation.Every year ADEC main goal is to provide scholarships for 40 underprivileged Arab teenagers ( 60% of the total number of participants) whose communities remain deprived and lack access to knowledge, information, artistic and cultural services through the collaboration of partner NGOs in the region whose mandate focuses on youth development, ICT, arts, and expression.Part of the camps becoming a meaningful experience is community participation in making it unfold and successfully happen, in the belief of the critical value of youth engagement.We cannot do this without the ongoing support of people like you who believe in building a foundation within our youth for a brighter future.Even if we don't reach our goal with this campaign, every penny raised will go to ensuring our camps are a success and a true product of community engagement. The ImpactThe growth of our community, its entanglement with a variety of causes and its expansion into different territories of art making, expression and technology creation are key indicators of the camps' success. The camps sets the stage for this community by providing a unique experience of learning, self-discovery, critical thinking and expression, which are missing aspects in most mainstream education across the region.Here are few examples of the short term impact we have seen throughout the previous camps rounds:

ADEC 2017: A Lebanese camper, who was very involved in all sound workshops, learned how to DJ and DJed twice during the camp, including the graduation party. He is still in contact with and being mentored by our sound trainer to evolve his skills in music.

ADEC 2016: We discovered two female techies (from Port-Said and Damanhur Governorates which are usually extremely marginalized compared to urban cities in Egypt) whose graduation project was a "Raspberry pie" that unlocks the Wi-Fi passwords!

ADEC 2013 - 2015: Four girls have been awarded UWC scholarship, which is one of 16 campuses located on five continents that serves students age 16-19 who represent more than 70 different countries, to do their masters in the different fields of arts ( music, theatre, visual arts...etc) through their unique academic approach and program that combines academic challenge with an experiential, hands-on approach to learning.
Success Stories:
One of the major and most important indicator of success is that after more than 10 years of ADEF youth empowerment experience, ADEC camps (since 2016) are now led and managed by its first and second generation campers; meaning ADEC ex-campers who participated in the camps between 2007 and 2011, and who grew and developed and are now capable of handling the running of the camp. Since then, ADEC camps are fully running by its ex-campers to date.

Amina Allam, a success story of a young female teenager who joined ADEC in 2008 as a camper and over the time her skills have developed qualifying her to work different roles in the following camps rounds as group leader then a camp administrator, then group leader supervisor and trainer. Additionally, Amina worked as an assistant producer from 2014 - 2016 in a film production company in Cairo and she is currently completing her degree in digital film production at SAE institute in London.

Shady Said, is another success story of a teenager camper in ADEC 2008 who is now a trainer in the sound and music workshop since ADEC 2016 to date . (Watch Video)


Yazan Arori is the youngest trainer in ADEC! Yazan is 18 years old from Palestine. He joined ADEC for two consecutive years in 2014 and 2015 where he showed impressive development in the workshops of technology and programming through the two year that allowed him to participate in ADEC 2016 as a co-trainer in the "Makers" workshop. He is now is Berlin pursuing a degree in Electrical Engineering.

Also, this is a sample of what has been said about the camps in the media and in academia:
"Free Expression - The Arab Digital Expression Foundation in conversation with Laura Cugusi"
“Access to Knowledge in Egypt” – Bloomsbury book release
“Tweet Freedom” – Wired Magazine UK

الصوت، التصميم البصري، تطبيقات الوِب الإبداعية، تصميم الألعاب، البرمجة) وأخرى بدنية تركز على تحفيز التعبير الذاتي العاطفي، الفكري والجسدي مثل (الفنون والحرف، الرقص والاستعراض، (السرد القصصي والرياضة).يعمل المشاركون على مشروعاتهم الخاصة التي يتم عرضها في اليوم الأخير من المخيم وتُنشر مختارات منها على شبكة الإنترنت كما تقوم أضِف بتنظيم قنوات أخرى لعرض وترويج هذه المُخرجات من خلال وسائل الإعلام المحلية والإقليمية و المنظمات أيضًا.شارك واستفاد من هذه التجربة أكثر من 630 فتى وفتاة من 11 دولة عربية منذ إطلاق المخيمات في 2007  حتى الآن وقد أتاح لهم فرصة فريدة لاكتشاف قدراتهم والتعبير عن أنفسهم بحرية من خلال الفنون والتكنولوجيا بالإضافة إلى بناء شخصيتهم من خلال تعلم القيم الأخلاقية مثل: الإنسانية والمساواة واحترام الآخرين وقبول الاختلاف والتكيف والتعايش والقيادة والتفكير النقدي والعمل الجماعي.بسبب تنوع وكثافة البرنامج وغنى المشاركين، تعد المخيمات تجربة فارقة في الحياة لكل من المشاركين والمدربين حيث يتشارك المشاركون والمدربون الخبرات و يترابطون معًا من خلال المساحات المادية والرقمية التي يخلقونها.يتم عرض المخرجات النهائية من المخيمات على شبكة الإنترنت. كما يتم ترتيب طرق أخرى للمعرض من خلال وسائل الإعلام المحلية والإقليمية والمنظمات.شاهد نماذج لورشات عمل من المخيمات السابقة:●       روبوت و توربين و طابعة ثلاثية الأبعاد●       تصوير و مونتاج و رقص و غطس و انطلاق  المكان و الزمانستقام الدورة الثانية عشر من مخيمات أضِف للفتية في الفترة من 16  إلى 30 يوليو/ تموز 2018 في لبنان.كيف يمكنكم دعمنا و مساعدتنا؟نتطلع في هذه الحملة التمويلية لجمع مبلغ وقدره  15000 دولار أمريكي لتوفير 10 منح كاملة ل 10 فتية و فتيات. تقدر تكلفة تمويل فتى أو فتاة في المخيم 1500 دولار أمريكي (شاملة الإقامة كاملة لمدة 14 يوم ورسوم التدريب وأجهزة الصوت والموسيقى ومعامل الحوسبة وكافة الأنشطة الرياضية والثقافية الأخرى بالإضافة إلى تكلفة الإنتقالات).نسعى كل عام من أجل تمويل عدد 40 مشارك (60% من إجمالي عدد المشاركين) الذين لا يستطيعون تحمل تكلفة  الإشتراك في المخيم من خلال منح كاملة وجزئية، يتم تخصيصها للفتية الذين لا تزال مجتمعاتهم محرومة ويفتقرون إلى منفذ للحصول على المعرفة والمعلومات والأنشطة الفنية والتقنية . يتم ذلك بالتعاون مع شركاؤنا في المنطقة العربية، من المنظمات غير الحكومية التي يتركز نشاطها في مجالات تنمية وتطوير الشباب وتكنولوجيا المعلومات والاتصالات والفنون والتعبير.إن مشاركة المجتمع معنا في تنفيذ المخيمات ونجاحها وإيمانهم مثلنا بقيمة مشاركة الشباب في المجتمع من أهم المؤشرات التي جعلت من هذا المشروع تجربة ذات مغزى.ولهذا، لا يمكننا القيام بذلك دون الدعم المستمر المقدم من قبل أشخاص مثلكم يؤمنون ببناء قدرات شبابنا من أجل مستقبل أكثر إشراقًا.في حال عدم تحقيق هدفنا من هذه الحملة ، فإن كل ما يتم جمعه يعد ضمانًا لنجاح مخيماتنا وأثر حقيقي لمشاركة المجتمع.الأثرإن نمو مجتمعنا وتشابكه مع مجموعة متنوعة من الأسباب وتوسعه في جوانب مختلفة من إنتاج فن وتعبير وابتكار تكنولوجيا من المؤشرات الرئيسية لنجاح المخيمات. إذ تهيئ المخيمات المسرح لهذا المجتمع من خلال توفير تجربة فريدة من نوعها للتعلم، واكتشاف الذات، والتفكير النقدي والتعبير الحر، وهي جوانب مفقودة في المنظومة التعليمية في منطقتنا العربية.فيما يلي بعض الأمثلة على الأثر قصير المدى الذي شهدناه على مدار المخيمات السابقة:

مخيم 2017: قام أحد الفتية المشاركين من لبنان ، بالمشاركة بشكل كبير في جميع الورش التدريبية الخاصة بالصوت و تعلم فن تنسيق الموسيقى "دي جي" وقام بتنسيق الأغاني مرتين خلال المخيم ، بما في ذلك حفلة التخرج ولا يزال على اتصال بمدرب الصوت لتطوير مهاراته في الموسيقى.

مخيم 2016: تم اكتشاف فتاتين من التقنيين (من محافظتي بورسعيد ودمنهور والتي تعد من المحافظات المهمشة مقارنة بالمحافظات الأخرى في مصر) وكان مشروع تخرجهما عبارة عن "راسبري باي" التي تقوم بفك شفرات وكلمات مرور شبكات الانترنت.

مخيمات 2013 - 2015: حصلت أربع فتيات على منحة دراسية من جامعة  UWC ، وهي واحدة من أهم  16 جامعة في العالم، لدراسة الماجستير في مجالات الفنون المختلفة (الموسيقى) والمسرح والفنون البصرية ... الخ).
قصص نجاح
أثمرت عشر سنوات من الخبرة والتمكين للفتية والفتيات من بلدان عربية مختلفة عن أن يتولى عدد من المشاركين القدامى من الجيل الأول والثاني (مشاركون من 2007 وحتى 2011) مسؤولية تنظيم وقيادة المخيمات بدأ من 2016. ونحن نحسب هذه الخطوة من إنجازاتنا الأهم  وإحدى أهم أهداف المخيمات التي تتحقق أمام أعيننا.

أمينة علام ، قصة نجاح  شابة مصرية انضمت للمخيمات في عام 2008 كمشاركة، وطورت مهاراتها بشكل سريع لتصبح قادرة على تولي أدوار مختلفة في المخيمات اللاحقة (رائدة أسر ثم مسئول إداري في المخيم، ثم مشرف رواد الأسر ومدربة) بالإضافة إلى ذلك ، عملت أمينة كمساعد منتج في الفترة من 2014 - 2016 في شركة إنتاج أفلام في القاهرة ، وهي الآن تقوم باستكمال دراستها  في مجال إنتاج الأفلام الرقمية في معهد SAE في لندن.

شادي سعيد ، قصة نجاح أخرى لشاب مصري شارك في مخيمات الفتية منذ 2008 والذي أصبح الآن مدربًا في ورشة الصوت والموسيقى منذ دورة 2016. (شاهد تجربة شادي)

يزن عروري، هو أصغر مدرب مخيمات أضِف للفتية؛ شاب فلسطيني يبلغ من العمر 18 سنة. انضم إلى مخيمات أضِف للفتية لمدة سنتين متتاليتين في عامي 2014 و 2015 أظهر خلالهما تطورًا مدهشًا في ورش التكنولوجيا والبرمجة مما سمح له بالمشاركة في مخيم 2016 كمدرب مساعد في ورشة عمل "صناع". يدرس يزن مجال الهندسة الالكترونية في برلين حاليا..
شاهد ما يقوله الفتية و الفتيات عن المخيمات:عمر عبد الرحيم و تجربته في تعلم صناعة الأفلامدينا صبري و تجربة المسرحاستمتع بمجموعة من إنتاجات الفتية و الفتيات:
 


نماذج مما قيل عن المخيمات في وسائل الإعلام وفي الأوساط الأكاديمية:


" التعبير الحر: مؤسسة التعبير الرقمي العربي في حوار مع لورا كوجوزي"
إتاحة المعرفة في مصر - كتاب " Bloomsbury "

 
"غرِد حرية" - مجلة "Wired"، لندن

طرق أخرى للدعمإذا لم تتمكن من تمويل هدفنا ماديًا، ساهموا معنا بالنشر والترويج للحملة مع العائلة والأصدقاء وعلى صفحات التواصل الاجتماعي: فيس بوك، تويتر، انستجرام.

story:
HOW IT WORKS

 

WHY EASYSURGERY?

Suturing is one of the most essential skills that students and junior doctors have to master in order to advance in their profession. However, there are challenges with existing training tools. First, there are approximately 1M graduates per year worldwide. Yet, only a small number of students can access easy to use training tools or the ability to afford expensive courses. Second, since the human body is composed of different tissues, doctors need a tool to assess the most appropriate suturing technique. Unfortunately, most existing training devices do not offer this capability. The cost of medical education is already very high and there is a lack of affordable surgical training tools!

 

All the drawbacks of existing training devices motivated us to design the first ever training platform which is versatile, and accessible to everyone. We designed our device to be portable so everybody can advance their suturing skills with ease – regardless of whether at university, at home or with fellow medical students. See all the details below and support our campaign that we can bring our patented technology to reality!

 

Our first device - available already!

Our patented first product consists of easy-to-use mounts for the quick installation of your tissue analogues. We further equipped our device with an adjustable sample holder to pretension the tissue analogues to simulate different clinical scenarios. With its integrated force gauge, you can now measure the strength of your suture and evaluate your technique.

 

Our innovative second product, available soon!

With your support we can introduce a new lean design, which we will deliver by end of Q2 2019. Our V2 is designed to fit in every bag and is equipped with an integrated camera system, which automatically connects to your phone via Bluetooth. A comfortable pillow for smooth operations and a small slide for storage lets you train more comfortably.

 

EASYSURGERY APP - accessible to everyone!

Our smartphone app will automatically connect to your training device. You can create your personal profile on our EASYSURGERY APP to record your training and review as well as evaluate your results to check on your progress. In addition, you can benchmark your suture skills with other medical students and doctors around the globe.

 

TISSUE ANALOGUES

EASYSURGERY allows users to train on tissue analogues, which all represent different parts of the body. These come pre-installed on easy-to-use mounts for the quick installation on the device. With its integrated force gauge, user can measure the strength of suturing and evaluate their technique. The material uses for the tissue analogues is medical-grade Polycaprolactone, an FDA approved, biocompatible high-tech polymer used and tested in our labs.

Our innovative additive manufacturing technology, called Melt Electrowriting (MEW) allows us to manufacture the tissue analogues. MEW is based on the fundamentals and guidelines of traditional electrospinning with solutions and combines it with 3D printing principles. The “writing” of polymer melts, is a rising additive manufacturing technology for biomedical applications proven on a scientific as well as commercial level. The technique facilitates the direct deposition of biocompatible polymer fibers to fabricate preprogramed well-ordered scaffolds in the micron- to nano-scale range. The generation of an electrical field around a viscous polymeric bubble leads to the ejection of a fibre and accelerates it towards a grounded collecting plate (or rotating mandrel). It deposits as a continuous fiber according to its relative movement following the principles of 3D Printing. Hence allowing the targeted fabrication of analogues for arteris, ligaments, tendons, skin or muscle.

 

TEAM

The idea of EASYSURGERY was born in the Institute of Biomedical Innovation at the Queensland University of Technology in Queensland, Australia. The group, headed by distinguished Professor Dietmar Hutmacher is internationally renown for translating core science into real world applications. The ARC Industrial Transformation Training Centre in Additive Biomanufacturing, Hutmachers latest research project brings together an outstanding team of high profile scientists, engineers and industry partners from Australia and around the world to help transform the industry of 3D printing for medical applications. 

 

 

 

 

ENQUIRERS

Tel: +61 7 3138 6287

Mail: easy.surgery@aol.com

Postal address

Institute of Health and Biomedical innovation

Queensland University of Technology

60 Musk Avenue, Kelvin Grove QLD 4059 Australia

 

WHY we need your support

With your support, we can get EASYSURGEY off the ground. Once we raised our requested funds, we will initiate the production of our first generation and start the development of the second one.

For the first product, we already have the design files and therefore, will invest your backing only into material for our in-house 3D Printing as well as lasercutting device.

For the next generation, we will collaborate with software engineers and product designers to start manufacturing at the beginning of Q2. Thence, we will deliver our lean design to your doorstep by the end of Q2 2019.

Both technology platforms we will use our in-house MEW 3D –Printed Tissue Analogues, which come with the devices in already mounted easy-to-use mounts for a quick installation. Hence, we do not use animal tissues.

 

 

Risks & Challenges

Any risks or challenges we may encounter will be met with tenacity and a fierce determination to find the best solution by our team.

We produce our own high quality devices and 3D printed objects, and as a result, we have already worked out the steps required to provide you with unsurpassed quality.

All packaging and shipping will be provided to ensure successful delivery through internationally established companies.

All Contributors’ perks will be shipped in the order that they are received (See Packaging & Shipping)

We have taken this project as far as we can on our own, and we need your support to complete it. Please show your support and…Share! Share! Share! Our dream has always been to get our innovations directly to you.

Through Indiegogo, we can make this dream a reality! Thank you!

story:
When I was a child, I spoke as a child, I felt as a child, I reasoned as a child; when I became a man, I had done with what belonged to the child.

At the age of 17 Shakaboona  (centered between grandmother and mother, now 45 yrs old) was sentenced to DIE in prison. Policies that automatically lock children away with no hope of release are uncivilized and inhumane. Our laws should  support meaningful juvenile justice that defends the human rights of our children, and ensures that no child in is judged or viewed as a throwaway person.


There is only one week remaining to contribute to the Shakaboona Matters campaign. 

PLEASE CONTRIBUTE NOW!

 

Fifteen thousand dollars ($15,000) will go towards a re-sentencing defense team, who will advocate zealously for a sentence other than DEATH by incarceration for Kerry Shakaboona Marshall.


Supporters of Kerry 'Shakaboona' Marshall:

Shakaboona's daughter, sister, grandson, and brother

A warm thank you to everyone who donated to the Shakaboona Matters fundraiser. THANK YOU!



Russell Maroon Shoats/z - U.S. Held Political Prisoner

Twenty years ago I met him at the end of the line, in a Super Maximum Security section of Pennsylvania’s state prison in Greene County. There he was serving a natural life sentence-imposed on him while he was still a juvenile – because the system of injustice had taken a wayward kid and condemned him to spend the rest of his life within the confines of prisons.

Yet the Shakaboona I met, as a man ,had the makings of a University professor, doctor, or scientist and by then was never one to waste a single moment in bettering himself, or others he could assist.

As an elder who must leave this life in the not-to-distant-future, I’m comforted to know that he continues to grow and better himself, and thus my own grandchildren will benefit from the kind of man he has developed himself to be: One of the best humans walking the planet Earth!



Lois Ahrens, Real Cost of Prisons Project
I was honored in 2011 when  Kerry Shakaboona Marshall agreed to serve on the Real Cost of Prisons Project Advisory Board. We had corresponded for almost two years before he joined. Every letter I received from him was packed with information and analysis about what was happening to prisoners, to youth and to struggles in Pennsylvania, the U.S. and worldwide. Of course, simultaneously, he was co-editing and writing for THE MOVEMENT and every issue was and is not just bigger but better. Through his intellect, his tenacity and his deep empathy for his brothers and sisters inside and outside, Shakaboona's life demonstrates the cruelty of sentencing juveniles (and adults) to Life Without the Possibility of Parole. It is my privilege to be part of the campaign to get Shakaboona the resources he needs so that he may be re-sentenced and released, to be with his family and continue his important organizing work on the outside. 


**********

According to the Supreme Court's ruling in Miller v. Alabama: Mandatory life without parole for a juvenile precludes consideration of his chronological age and its hallmark features -- among them, immaturity, impetuosity, and failure to appreciate risks and consequences. It prevents taking into account the family and home environment that surrounds him -- and from which he cannot extricate himself -- no matter how brutal or dysfunctional. It neglects circumstances of the homicide offense, including the extent of his participation in the conduct and the way familial and peer pressures may have affected him. Indeed, it ignores that he might have been charged and convicted of a lesser offense if not for in-competencies associated with youth -- for example, his inability to deal with police officers or prosecutors (including on a plea agreement) or his incapacity to assist his own attorneys.

Kerry 'Shakaboona' Marshall was a child when sentenced to DIE in prison. He is now a responsible man of forty-five years old. His case must be presented to the judge by a defense team with experience (not a public defender) who will establish his growth and verify his character.  

From within the restraints of prison: 

  • Shakaboona has held the positions of: Vice-President of the PA Lifers Association at SCI-Huntingdon, Committee Chairperson of the NAACP Graterford Branch, President of the Para-Professional Law Clinic at SCI-Graterford, and Secretary of the Regents Betterment Organization at SCI-Mahanoy.
  • He is the founder or co-founder of several groups that are located outside of prison walls, namely: Families United (FU) organization, Families of Prisoners & Communities Union (FCU) organization, and the Human Rights Coalition (HRC) organization.
  • He is the co-founder and Editor of The Movement magazine, a human rights advocacy publication with subscribers nationwide; it serves as a tool for public awareness and connect prisoners to the outside world.
  • Shakaboona does popular radio commentary on social/political issues for Prison Radio and submits written commentary articles for the Socialist Viewpoint magazine, San Francisco Bay View newspaper, and Workers World newspaper.

Any amount you can give will be helpful ($25, $100, $1,000) and will go towards Kerry's re-sentencing hearing.

Another way of helping would be to share this campaign with others through Facebook, e-mail, Twitter, or old fashion word of mouth.


Thank You!




You may obtain a copy of Abolitionist Law Center's financial report by visiting our website here. Abolitionist Law Center registers with agencies in many states. Some of them will supply you with the financial and registration information they have on file. Residents of the following states may request information from the offices indicated (toll-free numbers are for use only within the respective states): Pennsylvania - Department of States, Bureau of Charitable Organizations, Harrisburg, PA 17120, 1-800-732-0999; Maryland - Office of the Secretary of State, Statehouse, Annapolis, MD 21401, 1-800-825-4510; New York - Office of Charities Registration, 162 Washington St., Albany, NY; Virginia - Division of Consumer Affairs, P.O. Box 1163, Richmond, VA 23209, 1-800-552-9963. Registration with a state agency does not imply the state's endorsement.

with no hope of release are uncivilized and inhumane. Our laws should  support meaningful juvenile justice that defends the human rights of our children, and ensures that no child in is judged or viewed as a throwaway person.There is only one week remaining to contribute to the Shakaboona Matters campaign. PLEASE CONTRIBUTE NOW! Fifteen thousand dollars ($15,000) will go towards a re-sentencing defense team, who will advocate zealously for a sentence other than DEATH by incarceration for Kerry Shakaboona Marshall.Supporters of Kerry 'Shakaboona' Marshall:Shakaboona's daughter, sister, grandson, and brother

A warm thank you to everyone who donated to the Shakaboona Matters fundraiser. THANK YOU!



Russell Maroon Shoats/z - U.S. Held Political PrisonerTwenty years ago I met him at the end of the
line, in a Super Maximum Security section of Pennsylvania’s state prison in
Greene County. There he was serving a natural life sentence-imposed on him
while he was still a juvenile – because the system of injustice had taken a
wayward kid and condemned him to spend the rest of his life within the confines
of prisons.
Yet the Shakaboona I met, as a man ,had the
makings of a University professor, doctor, or scientist and by then was never
one to waste a single moment in bettering himself, or others he could assist.
As an elder who must leave this life in the
not-to-distant-future, I’m comforted to know that he continues to grow and better
himself, and thus my own grandchildren will benefit from the kind of man he has
developed himself to be: One of the best humans walking the planet Earth!




Lois Ahrens, Real Cost of Prisons ProjectI
was honored in 2011 when  Kerry Shakaboona Marshall agreed to serve on the
Real Cost of Prisons Project Advisory Board. We had corresponded for almost two
years before he joined. Every letter I received from him was packed with
information and analysis about what was happening to prisoners, to youth and to
struggles in Pennsylvania, the U.S. and worldwide. Of course, simultaneously,
he was co-editing and writing for THE MOVEMENT and every issue was and is not just bigger but better. Through his intellect, his tenacity and his deep empathy for his brothers and sisters inside and outside, Shakaboona's life demonstrates the cruelty of sentencing juveniles (and adults) to Life Without the Possibility of Parole. It is my privilege to be part of the campaign to get Shakaboona the resources he needs so that he may be re-sentenced and released, to be with his family and continue his important organizing work on the outside. 




**********
According to the Supreme Court's ruling in Miller v. Alabama: Mandatory life without parole for a juvenile precludes consideration of his chronological age and its hallmark features -- among them, immaturity, impetuosity, and failure to appreciate risks and consequences. It prevents taking into account the family and home environment that surrounds him -- and from which he cannot extricate himself -- no matter how brutal or dysfunctional. It neglects circumstances of the homicide offense, including the extent of his participation in the conduct and the way familial and peer pressures may have affected him. Indeed, it ignores that he might have been charged and convicted of a lesser offense if not for in-competencies associated with youth -- for example, his inability to deal with police officers or prosecutors (including on a plea agreement) or his incapacity to assist his own attorneys.
Kerry 'Shakaboona' Marshall was a child when sentenced to DIE in prison. He is now a responsible man of forty-five years old. His case must be presented to the judge by a defense team with experience (not a public defender) who will establish his growth and verify his character.  
From within the restraints of prison: 

Shakaboona has held the positions of: Vice-President of the PA Lifers Association at SCI-Huntingdon, Committee Chairperson of the NAACP Graterford Branch, President of the Para-Professional Law Clinic at SCI-Graterford, and Secretary of the Regents Betterment Organization at SCI-Mahanoy.
He is the founder or co-founder of several groups that are located outside of prison walls, namely: Families United (FU) organization, Families of Prisoners & Communities Union (FCU) organization, and the Human Rights Coalition (HRC) organization.
He is the co-founder and Editor of The Movement magazine, a human rights advocacy publication with subscribers nationwide; it serves as a tool for public awareness and connect prisoners to the outside world.
Shakaboona does popular radio commentary on social/political issues for Prison Radio and submits written commentary articles for the Socialist Viewpoint magazine, San Francisco Bay View newspaper, and Workers World newspaper.

Any amount you can give will be helpful ($25, $100, $1,000) and will go towards Kerry's re-sentencing hearing.
Another way of helping would be to share this campaign with others through Facebook, e-mail, Twitter, or old fashion word of mouth.Thank You!You may obtain a copy of Abolitionist Law Center's financial report by visiting our website here. Abolitionist Law Center registers with agencies in many states. Some of them will supply you with the financial and registration information they have on file. Residents of the following states may request information from the offices indicated (toll-free numbers are for use only within the respective states): Pennsylvania - Department of States, Bureau of Charitable Organizations, Harrisburg, PA 17120, 1-800-732-0999; Maryland - Office of the Secretary of State, Statehouse, Annapolis, MD 21401, 1-800-825-4510; New York - Office of Charities Registration, 162 Washington St., Albany, NY; Virginia - Division of Consumer Affairs, P.O. Box 1163, Richmond, VA 23209, 1-800-552-9963. Registration with a state agency does not imply the state's endorsement.

story:
The Refugee Fluency Project:

My Name is Paul Gossen, I am the CEO and cofounder of Velocity.

Our mission is to give fluency to one million EU refugees, so they can become fully integrated, have successful careers and give back more to their new culture. This promise is founded on the Velocity system for fast conversational fluency.

We have the technology to do this. Velocity has "cracked the code" on language fluency. Velocity is a complete system that has been tested and proven with thousands of people over the past 24 years. We are already scaling this out to large numbers of people in China. We just finished a 2015 survey of 250 graduates at SAP Labs in Shanghai, which demonstrated a jump from 18 to 89% of graduates who reported feeling comfortable in their new language.

What We Need & What You Get

Right now our immediate need is to demonstrate the high-impact results of the Fluency Program to EU officials, the Red Cross and the UNHCR through a pilot demonstration program.  We already have volunteer communities in Vienna and Rome that are planning pilots in late November.

What if you could give a new life to a Refugee family?

We are requesting that you sponsor one Refugee for $100 USD.

This will allow one person to go through the 3-day / 3 month program. This will allow them to build basic conversational fluency in their new language and step onto a path of success in their new culture. As a thank you, we will give you a copy of the new Velocity Fluency book.

The Impact

It is critical that we demonstrate the high-impact nature of our technology. There is ample funding for the refugees, but there is a severe shortage of credible solutions. Once we have demonstrated this program, many more EU resources can be made available.

  • This is a highly developed program that has already been demonstrated to be effective for many other people around the world
  • We need to show that it works with these Refugees who are in crisis now
  • Once we have done this we can access funding and intend to scale up 100 times
  • Your $100 pilot sponsorship of one person has the potential to help 100 Refugees

Risks & Challenges

There are risks:

  • Our deadline is short: our first pilot begins in Rome Nov 17-19
  • Although we have worked with hundreds of immigrants, we have not run this program before with refugees in crisis. There are unknowns.
  • The project may not get accepted by the funding agencies
  • We may not achieve a critical mass of interest in this project
  • If we do not achieve our goal of $5000 USD, we will attempt to run our pilots anyway. If we cannot run our pilot program, all money will go to the UNHCR Refugee Fund.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.

If you are inspired please join our Facebook page:

We are also looking for:

  • Volunteers and Coordinators on the ground in key EU hot spots
  • Potential programs trainers and coaches, especially in the EU
  • Native Speakers of EU Languages especially German and French
  • Native Speakers of Middle Eastern Languages, especially Arabic
  • Translators who know German or French and Arabic

How the Velocity Refugee Fluency Program Works:

Velocity uses a powerful mixture of intensive, ongoing learning, live, online and virtual training. The intensive program is 3 action-packed days focused learning for groups of 40-60 people. This allows the participant to pass through an intensity threshold and begin to break the language barrier:

  • The program is focused on basic communication, not pass the test learning.
  • Rather than starting from the bottom-up with grammar and vocabulary, we start from the top down with simple sentence templates and structured conversations.
  • Using simple template conversations, participants can experience the first steps to basic conversational fluency in a few days. This creates an immediate experience of basic fluency that is the foundation for all future learning
  • Velocity embeds the new language structure into visual sentence templates.
  • Visual learning allows participants to achieve basic fluency without getting stuck in memorization, language structure or grammar rules.
  • Light conversational fluency allows participants to engage in real spoken communication.

The ongoing program is the key to the Velocity systems high rate of fast language adoption. Users form small groups of 10-25 people that practice and play in chapter meetings. These sessions are lead by graduates and participants who take on the roles of the Champion.

  • The follow-up program takes place as a series of Quests or small learning adventures.
  • Participants build confidence as they begin to approach native speakers and engage in real conversations.
  • Participants form Toastmasters style Chapters in which the graduates train the new students and progress through levels of development. 
  • Velocity communities are self-replicating. The Velocity approach naturally spreads as participants engage and share.
  • Senior students become Champions and go on to form more learning communities. Champions celebrate success stories in each chapter meeting.
  • Social media and online tools link each quest or successful learning experience back into the community.

story:
The story of finding the Origins

The Cultural Association Groove ON was founded in 2012 by a young community interested in nature, history and ethnography. Its mission is to research, preserve and promote the authentic Romanian traditions.

Traditional shelter from Tecsesti

We started in August 2014 the construction of a living museum in an old isolated village called Tecșești, in the Transylvanian Western Carpathians Apuseni Mountains. The village is near the Natural Reserve Piatra Cetii, at an altitude of 1,000 m. Thanks to its position the place is special for having a meadow with daffodils with an unique botanical, geological and paleonthological complexity and landscapes of an untold beauty.

Tecsesti, Alba County, Romania

The village is almost depopulated. About 14 elders still live here today given that in the 50’s almost 350 people lived in a self sufficient community specific to the mountain villages inhabited by shepherds.

Our mission is to transform the village into a living museum in order to preserve its authenticity, traditional architecture, customs and local crafts. To achieve this goal we'll dedicate the next years to research, to learn and to experiment how our ancestors lived in this environment, from the Neolithic to the present.

View over Tecsesti

The project we would like to bring to your attention consists into building a Neolithic settlement on the former pasture of the village. We want to build an ensemble of 5 hypothetical house reproductions from the Neolithic ages. The ensemble includes rectangular and circular houses made of wood, cob and straws, together with a pond for fishes and water plants.

According to archaeological researches, examples of this kind of constructions were used in this region during the Neolithic period. So far we managed to raise a clay oven and the wood structure for the kitchen house during the construction summer camps from 2014 and 2015. 

Volunteers at Tecsesti - Construction Summer Camp 2014

We need your help and involvement because in June 2016 the construction camp will start again to finish the Neolithic sector.  Together we can recreate our (hi)story from its origins to the present. Be one of our contributors and your name will be in the Living Museum Book.

Construction Plan for the Neolithic sector

To be able to start the construction activities in June 2016 and finish the Neolithic sector we need 6,000 EUR.

The construction camp is scheduled between 30 May – 29 June 2016 and is planned as following:

1. First of all we need to bring water to the camp from a spring placed at a 100 m distance. The source's altitude is higher with 16 m from the camp's level so the water will fall down naturally through a water supply system directly to the kitchen area, the pond and the trough for cattle. The pond will be placed in the swampy area near the camp and will become a natural ecosystem for fishes and water plants.

2. Three weeks are dedicated to build an ensemble of 5 cob houses. The ensemble is composed of two circular cob houses, two houses with a rectangular form and a granary. The houses have a hazel wood weave structure filled with a blend of clay, sand and straws and covered with a roof of straws.

At the end of the construction camp we'll organize a traditional festival called Nedeia (30 June – 3 July 2016) to celebrate the fulfillment of a beautiful dream. The event is a modern adaptation of the traditional local festive gatherings with music, fair, craft workshops and local food. We gladly invite everyone interested in folklore and world music to join us at Nedeia.

Nedeia, 3-5 July 2015, Tecsesti, Alba County

The money raised in this crowdfunding campaign is used for:

  • Tools and construction equipment: hand saws, rip saws, axes, pickaxes, machetes, spades, hoes, wheelbarrows, rope, 100 m pipe and protection equipment for the workers.

  • Food: daily meals for workers (30 volunteers)

  • Fuel (approx. 500 l of gasoline)

6,000 EUR is a small amount to raise but for us is essential to be able to fulfill our construction plan. If we raise more than we expect we’ll use the money to create a garden based on permaculture principles with vegetables, aromatic plants and mushrooms. If  we can't raise the whole amount we calculated that it will take us 3 years to build the Neolithic sector using our personal contribution and renting tools and equipment.

Perks

For those who pledge starting with 15 EUR up to 99 EUR the perks offered are:

  • Special thanks for being part of this project on our site and in the Living Museum Book.

  • The digital version of the La Origini Audio Folklore Collection Season I Apuseni Mountains. Last winter we started an ethnographic research project. Between December 2014 - February 2015 we recorded carols, flute songs, folk songs “doine”, war songs, prayers, funeral lyrics, romance songs and other old Romanian songs. The songs were recorded at the people’s home involved in the research, from several isolated villages from the Apuseni Mountains. Most of them have never been recorded before.  

Recordings during the first season of ethnographic research in the Apuseni Mountains, December 2014 - February 2015

  • The digital version of La Origini Audio Folklore Collection Season II will be delivered in March 2017 after processing the recordings scheduled for December 2016 - February 2017.

  • Access at Nedeia festival in Tecsesti, 30 June – 3 July 2016.

For those who pledge 100 EUR up to 499 EUR they are invited to spend some beautiful vacation days for two persons at Tecsesti, in July or August 2016. They will find accommodation and a guided tour to visit the spectacular surroundings: the Natural Reservation Piatra Cetii, the Cult Areas from the Dacian Fortress and Settlement of Piatra Craivii, Ramet Monastery and Ramet Gorges.

The accommodation will be in a traditional house from the village or in a cob house from the Neolithic sector, as you prefer. We can only offer breakfast so we suggest you to come with your food. You can also buy from the villagers: vegetables, milk, cheese, fish or fresh meat.

View from Tecsesti. Piatra Craivii in the background

For those who pledge 500 EUR up to 1,000 EUR they are invited to transform their vacation into a real adventure. They will find accommodation (see details above) for two persons at Tecsesti (in July or August 2016) and a guided tour to visit the most important and spectacular places from the Apuseni Mountains: Huda lui Papara Cave, Sloboda Forest, Detunatele, Rosia Montana, Pisoaia Fall, The Snail Hill, Scarisoara Cave and Apuseni Natural Park.

Spectacular places from the Apuseni Mountains

Botanical diversity in the Apuseni Mountains

The Impact

On a long term basis this place will be used to organize thematic camps for learning traditional crafts and arts. The camps will be addressed to children, students, researchers and people passionate by organic architecture, ecological agriculture and permaculture, alternative energy and traditional crafts.

Local artisans will teach us how to obtain tools using wood, stone or iron, how to create pottery using clay or how to weave or sew traditional clothing. We will practice all these crafts among other activities dedicated to folklore and musical instruments. So many songs, legends, myths and beliefs old for centuries are waiting for us!

Seamstress teaching us how to spin a bundle of hemp during the ethnographic research

Every winter we'll keep on organizing the ethnographic research. It's important to raise the awareness that we'll soon lose the elders who still keep memories from the second world war. They are an authentic source of folklore inherited from the past centuries: old songs, legends and stories. They are living history and it depends on us how fast we reach them. We can prevent this cultural legacy to disappear by recording and publishing their stories, learn them and teach them to the youngsters.

The old priest from Tecsesti and his family plowing with oxen 

We want to highlight the positive impact that our project has over the local community and environment. By approaching such type of ecotourism and ecological activities we can preserve intact this protected area, avoiding demolition and exploitation of the forest and natural resources.

Winter at Tecsesti

In order to preserve the village by transforming it into a living museum, our plan for the next years is to renovate the school, a 200 years old traditional house and other 3 shelters. This way people who come to visit or live here for a period will always find shelter, healthy food and wild nature. It will be a place were we can learn history by living it.

200 years old house from Tecsesti

We want to build a place where we can develop our activities, where we can create and recreate ourselves, our home, our mythological locus amoenus. We believe that the village with its food, water and forests, with its agricultural or pastoral occupation, still remains the classic community which is the most creative source of essentially pure and authentic culture.

Other Ways You Can Help

Either you are a contributor or you just like the project please share it with your friends on your blog, site, Facebook or another social media channel you use. We like to spread the word in the traditional oral way so please don't forget to talk about our project with your family, friends or acquaintances.

Thank you! We owe any success this project has to you!

Follow us on the journey to the origins!

This way people who come to visit or live here for a period will always find shelter, healthy food and wild nature. It will be a place were we can learn history by living it.200 years old house from TecsestiWe want to build a place where we can develop our activities, where we can create and recreate ourselves, our home, our mythological locus amoenus. We believe that the village with its food, water and forests, with its agricultural or pastoral occupation, still remains the classic community which is the most creative source of essentially pure and authentic culture.Other Ways You Can HelpEither you are a contributor or you just like the project please share it with your friends on your blog, site, Facebook or another social media channel you use. We like to spread the word in the traditional oral way so please don't forget to talk about our project with your family, friends or acquaintances.Thank you! We owe any success this project has to you!Follow us on the journey to the origins!

story:
Short Summary

Welcome to the "Tales of the Rainbow Forest" Fundraising Page. Our goal is to raise enough funds here to help create the magical world of McKenzie Willis' Rainbow Forest for children everywhere within a high quality animation so that the rich and in depth world that Mr. Willis has created can finally be seen by all.

Mr. Willis' “Tales of the Rainbow Forest” is uniquely mixed with his “Songs of the Forest” to provide both the reader and the audience a mesmerizing experience that mixes traditional storytelling with musical interludes. The story introduces readers to the important issues of bullying, and why we should re-focus our concentration on friendship, sharing, respecting and working together in a fun and interesting way. While bullying is a heavy subject, Mr. Willis creates a subtle approach so as not to overwhelm the book's audience of children, but still teaches valuable lessons.

McKenzie Willis was born in Brownsville, TN. He attended Tennessee A. & I. State University and subsequently graduated from the State University of New York at New Paltz with a degree in Sociology. Upon graduating he was employed by the University's Research Foundation. Much of his work experience was youth/counseling oriented.

While with the New York State Education Department he delivered numerous presentations introducing educators to the department's development of a testing tool for diagnosing Traumatic Brain Injury in youth.

McKenzie is a published songwriter/lyricist and has collaborated with Saturday Night Live's Music Director, L. Leon Pendarvis on numerous songs. One of  the songs was recorded by blues legend Taj Mahal, who is a strong supporter of the book's concept. 

The music CD of children's songs that is available as a companion to this print book is the result of a collaboration between Janice Gadsden-Pendarvis, L. Leon Pendarvis and McKenzie. The songs were inspired by, and based on some of the book's characters.

The inspiration for Tales of the Rainbow Forest was the author's two sons chasing butterflies and dragonflies in their magical backyard on Main Street in New Paltz, NY. 

 Significant information about Bullying can be observed in the following statistics.    

Statistics by www.stopbullying.gov

http://www.stopbullying.gov/news/media/facts/#listing

70.6% of young people say they have seen bullying in their schools. 70.4% of school staff have seen bullying. 62% witnessed bullying two or more times a month, and 41% witness bullying once or more per. When bystanders intervene, bullying stops within 10 seconds 57% of the time.

Most bullying takes place in school, outside on school grounds, and on the school bus. Bullying also happens wherever kids gather in the community. And of course, cyberbullying occurs on cell phones and online.

According to one large study, the following percentages of middle school students had experienced bullying in these various places at school: classroom (29.3%); hallway or lockers (29.0%); cafeteria (23.4%); gym or PE class (19.5%); bathroom (12.2%); playground or recess (6.2%).

Only about 20 - 30% of students who are bullied notify adults about it.

Tales of the Rainbow Forest teaches children the value and importance of respecting and sharing with others, and there ARE consequences to be paid for bullying.  The book also provides valuable educational information to the entire family, about nature and the wonderful things that "forest creatures" (like honeybees) contribute to the wonderful world in which we live.

This campaign is an effort to help fund the printing of books, help  develope the new  Musical Play adaptation of the book, and create the "animated short" that will give birth to the animated series.



McKenzie has done, and continues to do numerous "readings/performances" at elementary schools, libraries, and day-care centers in up-state New York, and Long Island, NY. The "reviews, and feed-back" from parents, teachers, and kids have been exceptionally good/positive. Some samples of the above have been filmed. Teachers and parents have expressed how much the book and it's concept needs to be in schools and libraries through-out the country.  I strongly feel that there is a real need to address the bullying problem, which needs to start at the beginning of childhood. 

Every dollar that you donate will help in addressing the bullying problems that our kids in every age-group are being subjected to. Part of the donations will help to pay for the translation of the book to other languages. The Spanish translation is currently in process. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If for some reason you cannot donate to our campaign but still want to help, then please help spread this campaign through email and social networking.
