story:
Story

My name is Mila Walker. I grew up in a remote area in the Philippines, where childhood labor was rampant and some children were forced not to go to school and obliged to work anywhere for extra family income.  I was one of the lucky one who made it to school to attain higher education. I always thought about my childhood friends who did not make it out because of poverty. They were stuck; their children stuck and the generation after them in the same situation. I am married to Henry Walker, from Louisiana, USA, who was an orphan. He grew up in an orphanage called "Blandon Home". His testimony was always "because of others who have a heart of gold from God, he is the person he is now". After 22 years of serving his country Henry retired from the United States Army. We visited my hometown in the Philippines in 2000 and he saw the hardship of the people and the growing numbers of "street children". This condition touches our hearts which lead to the founding of Ezra Ministry, a non-profit, non-government organization in 2004. EZRA formulates effective programs and services to address the present condition of the people specially the displaced and indigent families and to encourage them to grow in God's grace. We turned our "vacation house" into a temporary shelter for the fourteen displaced children and we open a Christian school for them and other less fortunate children in the community seeking free education.  We solely funded all the expenses (from our savings and retirement income), but as the children grow older, their grade level gets higher, and their needs get bigger! The government allowed us to use the unfinished school building as long as we continue to build and give 10 years to complete. We cannot afford to do it alone and we are seeking other kind hearted people to help us. 

What We Need & What You Get:

Our goal is $150,000.00. 

Breakdown:

$25,000 - to build the mini-gym required for the school

$25,000 - to construct 4 classrooms on the second floor of unfinished mission school building

$10, 000 - Science lab/ classroom and equipment

$5,000 - to furnish the library shelves and furniture

$15,000 audio/computer lab with  projector, 15 computers, 2 printers, and furniture

$50,000 - complete renovation and enlargement of the shelter

$20,000 - classrooms and shelter furniture and fixtures 

 

The Impact

Your contribution will help give the now enrolled children in the school quality education for the betterment of their lives and their community as well.  Since we open the shelter and mission school, two beneficiaries graduated from high school and now attending technical school. Three in high school (freshman, sophomore, junior); and the rest in elemnetary level.  Presently the mission school has 102 students.

Risks & Challenges

 The department of education give us 10 years to complete the unfinished structure to make the place conducive to learning and safe for the students. We cannot get insurance and pose the risk of losing license to operate. Please help us.....we have four years left out of ten. You can also help send a child to school by sponsoring their school fees. There are many applicants but we can only accept so many.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some may just can't contribute, but can pray and tell others about this needed help. God bless you.

campaign_city: Tuganay Carmen Davao del Norte, Philippines

story:
Update (Nov 23)

A quick update, after reaching almost 30% of their goal, the girls put together a sample of what items they are thinking of including in the Treasure box
And here is what can be contained.

Short Summary

Hi! Welcome to our campaign! We are six girlfriends who love to craft and  are passionate about using our Power as Girls to help other kids.
Last year, we made Rainbow Loom bracelets and sold them to friends and family to raise money for the Hospital for Sick Children in Toronto. This year, we wanted to do something that we could relate with and get our hands into.
A good friend of ours is a regular visitor at the Hospital for Sick Kids and he does not like visiting!  BUT ... when he shows us the toy he picked out from the special treasure box at the end of his appointment he smiles from ear to ear! 
It was instantly decided that a surprise toy from the treasure box is what all kids visiting the hospital should leave with, not just their doctors reports and next checkup dates!

What We Need & What You Get

 We need to fill up Sick Kids half empty treasure boxes!
We would like to fill these boxes with toys for all ages ranging from babies to teenagers. Everyone, no matter their age, loves a treat!
Since the kids visiting, and staying at the hospital, are usually very sick the hospital can only accept new, wrapped donations to ensure that the kids don't catch any germs.
We have found an amazing Canadian whole sale company who is willing to treat us like their non-profit customers and give us amazingly low prices on all of the treats we could possibly dream of.
Our dreams are filled with visions of art kits, balls, teddy bears, books, bracelets, skipping ropes, stickers, cups, hats and many more! The cheap stuff from the dollar store has nothing on our dreams, even though many of the treasures start at just 50 cents!
With your donation we will be able to visit their showroom and pick out all sorts of smile inducing treasures to make many sick boys and girls very happy.   In fact, there are many clinics that don't even have treasure boxes but with your help they will soon have to find space for what we can deliver.
The only obstacle standing in our way is finding enough moms to help us drive the boxes down to the hospital! 
If you could help us, please make a donation of any amount and we promise to spend your money wisely by packing in amazing toys and treats that will bring smiles and last a lot longer than the pain of their appointment or treatment.
 Kids may not want to go to their treatment or appointments but, they will be extremely happy when it's time to leave, especially when they have something fun to hold onto and it didn't cost their parents a dime! 
Thank you for blessing sick kids of every age with a smile!

story:
Hullo mates, my name is Salim Blanden. I'm 30 years and i live in Mbarara in Western Uganda. I'm also the founder of Mbarara Sports Academy; a community focused initiative that has been using football since 2010 to increase the number of children entering school in the communities around Mbarara District. In 2009 when i went back home for a holiday from school, i found so many young children playing football the whole day while others were at school, interacting with the kids and the people around, they told me some kids lost their parents from HIV/AIDS while the rest came from very poor backgrounds that even if they had both parents, these parents could not afford to pay any school fees for them because they did not have jobs to do.

The only thing that came into my mind was to start a football team and train them so that they can start attending school. I would do this by identifying schools around Mbarara that give sports scholarships to talented participants. My dream came to reality and i started Mbarara Sports Academy a year later on February 2010. Almost seven years on, over 300 participants have been able to get scholarships in different schools around the country. And today, 90% of participants both boys and girls attend school through our sports programs.

In 2013, i was awarded as the 'First community Impact Coach of Uganda and second in Africa by Coaches Across Continents'(CAC). Coaches Across Continents is a global Organization that uses sports as vehicle for social change(www.coachesacrosscontinents.org)

With the increasing number of kids missing out on attending school in my community because of various reasons like poverty and HIV/AIDS, i have decided to start a school building project to help reduce the number of kids and young people missing school. At the moment, we have already secured enough land to build a school and a play ground and some work has already began and we are already making bricks to use for building. The school will help hundreds of kids in Mbarara district and other young people from outside Mbarara to achieve an education while playing to have fun.

With the contributions from you, we would be able to make this dream a reality. We are a transparent organization based on truth. We therefore request for your contributions towards this cause.

we need USD200,000 for buildings to accommodate participants and a play ground. We need to involve more females to get an education through this school by giving them a chance to play and lead.

I'm a point person in my community and a FUFA football delegate in Mbarara district therefore its an advantage for me to reach out to many young people to support them academically using football and sports.
My project would be valuable to the community of Mbarara and to the whole country because we intend to educate very many young people and equip them with the skills to change our community and make it a better place for other young people to live.  The contributors would also get a chance to be part of this development by visiting and having a free home to reside while they come for visiting the country, they would also meet and interact with many kids and young people and learn more from other cultures.

There are so many challenges however, the first being finance. It's very difficult to build and do other organization activities without finance. However, much as this is a big challenge, i will continue with the little finances i earn from training footballers in other schools.
If you can't contribute, please spread the word and talk to other people about this cause. This will help the world learn about this great cause and maybe ask other people to contribute in future with whatever they can get.

If you can contribute, we are more than grateful!

Thank you!

Salim Blanden Founder/Director

story:
My name is Melissa Stark and I am a Political Science student at Columbus State University. 

I have been given an opportunity to travel to Istanbul, Turkey, with my university's Political Science program! This is a 7 day trip to a city that is a pivotal crossroads of world culture, perched on the border between Europe and Asia in the Middle East. In the current world political climate, Istanbul is a city that is part of the Islamic world, but is also a European city in its practices, culture and tolerance. Through this study abroad program, we will be able to examine the issues associated with the Middle East and Cosmopolitan cities such as Istanbul, and also gain a better understanding of this culture, which will benefit us as we become public administrators and leaders throughout our career. We will be able to experience international relations on a personal basis and better handle political tensions that result from differing identities and practices.

This is an amazing opportunity for me to expand my knowledge of international politics and global issues and appreciate the support that has been given to me! 

Please check out some of the handmade perks I am selling to raise funds for my trip. If there is something specific you would like for me to make, just let me know and I would be more than happy to accommodate your wishes!

Thank you for your interest!

story:
Short Summary

I'm Joanne, a writer, mum of two amazing kids and Creator of God for Kids app. I believe it is important for parents to share their faith with their children and tell of the great things God has done, just like the Bible says. So I created God for Kids app to do exactly that and help other parents do the same in a fun, user-friendly way that builds both family and faith.

"I have no greater joy than to hear my children walk in truth" (3 John 1:4)

I know I'm not alone - there are so many grown-ups like you who are passionate about seeing their kids grow in faith in Jesus. You can now be a part of this adventure. 

God for kids app teaches kids who God is and what God is like. We have already made the desert adventure which focuses on the personal characteristics of God and the space adventure which focuses on the huge, big, omni, Father characteristics of God. Now it's time for the garden adventure to show who Jesus is, what Jesus is like and how Jesus reveals the Father to us. If we exceed our goal and raise £12,000 together we can complete the Trinity Adventures and create the underwater adventure based on the Holy Spirit and how He helps us to live like Jesus. 

I need you to help God for Kids app be a complete and full reflection of who God really is and what God is really like. Every adventure is based on what God has already revealed to us through the Bible. 

What We Need & What You Get

Our Overall Costs:

  • The Jesus Adventure will have 7 featured stops on a map of a garden. Each feature usually costs £1000 plus £200 for conversion to android. But this time, those who write the code have offered a huge discount. So, including all other marketing and graphics fees, it will cost just £700 per 'Featured-Stop' to create the Jesus Adventure. Amazing! 
  • If we do not reach our goal of £6,000, we will build as many as featured stops as we can afford. Then, as funds increase through in-app purchases, we will build the next 'Feature-Stop' till we are finished.
  • If we exceed our goal, For every £700 over, we will create one stop on the 'God with Us' Underwater Adventure. A total of £12,000 altogether will complete the app entirely!
  • Anything over £12,000 will be used to tell more people about God for Kids app.  

Other costs included in the £6,000 goal:

  • 8-10% of your gift goes towards Indegogo's platform fees and card payment transactions. 
  • 5-10% will be spent on 'perks' which will ultimately help spread the word about the God for Kids to people who don't already know so please enjoy them!

Perks

(For a perk with an option, email your preference to joanne@Godforkidsapp.com or post it on our Facebook page www.Facebook.com/Godforkidsapp)

The amounts below are in UK £ and have been approximately converted to US$

For a £1 (~$1.25) quick gift we will send you a quick thank you tweet! 

 £8 (~$10) - a quick tweet and a code to unlock the space adventure (App Store and Google Play only - this applies to all donations. I'll ask you to specify which store.)

£15 (~$18)- all the above plus a 12-page pdf colouring book to download and print

£25 (~$30)- all the above plus a God for Kids canvas bag posted to your door

£50 (~$60) - all the above plus a stylish canvas to hang on your wall (your choice of 3 designs)

£100 (~$120) - all the above but instead of 1 canvas you get a gorgeous set of three that complement each other and will look great on a kid's bedroom wall

£160 (~$195) - all the above plus a God for Kids Phone Cover. (Select Designs only: iPhone 7+, 7, 6+, 6, 6S, 5, 5S, 5C, 4, 4S and Samsung Galaxy S7, S6, S5, S4, S3 and S2.)

£200 (~$243) - a unique 49-piece jigsaw (your choice of 3 designs) plus the set of 3 canvases, bag, thank you code, colouring book and tweet. 

£250 (~$300) - a unique 100 piece Ravensburger jigsaw with your choice of 4 God for Kids designs, plus the set of 3 canvases, bag, code, colouring book and tweet.

£500 (~$600) - Your Photo Featured in the App! Send me a photo - any decent photo - it could be of you, your pet, your house, your nose... (I will reject inappropriate or obscene photos without a refund but will offer you the opportunity to send an alternative). You also get either a 49 or 100 piece jigsaw (your choice of design), one phone cover, the set of 3 canvases, bag, code, colouring book and tweet.

*Limited Gift* for £1000 (~$1215)- You get a Unique, bespoke, Cuddly Toy in one of the seven God for Kids characters (Boy, Girl, Ox, Lion, Eagle, Dove, Lamb) 1st come first served. Only one of each animal available. 

£1,500 (~$1824)- you can choose the sticker design and matching sound effect design of one of the feature stops (within the theme of the garden adventure). You will also get a phone cover, a 49 or 100 piece jigsaw (your choice of design), plus the set of 3 canvases, bag, code, colouring book and tweet.

£2,000 - *UK ONLY* For your church or kids group, we will come and run a kids or a family workshop at a mutually convenient date and include a party bag for up to 100 children. 

£2,500 (~$3000)- The Mother Ship! Your Voice Featured on the App! We will work with you to record your voice (or someone you nominate) to say a specific phrase that will occur within the app. You will also get a phone cover, a 49 or 100 piece jigsaw (your choice of design), plus the set of 3 canvases, bag, code, colouring book and tweet.

Risks & Challenges

In my view, the risks and challenges are minimal. We have already successfully built the first two adventures from scratch so we know what we are doing and are invested and motivated to finish the work. We have already made mistakes and learned from them. Much of the code has already been written (which is why we can do this so cost-effectively) and it is simply a case of tailoring the code and graphics and content to the new adventure's specifications. 

Of course, it will take time to write the rest of the code for the new content, then that content has to be tested to hunt down any bugs but it will eventually get there.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't give money you can give your opinion instead! 

  • Download God for Kids app and rate and review it in the app store
  • Rate it on Trust Pilot: www.trustpilot.com/review/godforkidsapp.com 
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to tell others who might want to be a part of the Jesus Adventure! 
  • And please pray for us. We believe in the power of prayer.

story:
What is the most important thing in the world

"It is people, It is people, It is people"

FUND INDIGENOUS WITH A PURPOSE

An empowering initiative created by a New Zealand Indigenous woman Tina Waru, has received nominations for the Australian Reconciliation Award 2014, Best Practice for the Victorian Australia Garrin Garrin Strategy and awarded Australian of the Day, Pride of Australia medal 2016.

     

Photo Left: Ollie Proudlock (UK Celebrity), Tina Waru (Founder), Kali Joyce (Maori Model ), Elicia Munro (First Nations Dancer/Model)

Photo Right: Tina Waru (Founder) and Megan Gayle (Super Model )

Tina has pioneered the world’s first Global Indigenous Management for Indigenous models, talent and Indigenous fashion events turning heads and astonishing audiences with the establishment of the Global Indigenous Runway – a runway with a purpose. Tina now has models featuring on main Fashion Catwalks and  walking for high profile celebrity designers.

The initiative educates and creates a pathway to Fashion, not only for youth but also for those wanting to gain experience in design, modelling, makeup, runway and production events  and has, for the past four years featured in two of Australia’s top fashion festival’s.

    

A Global Collaboration in Canada

Global Indigenous Management will deliver their Indigenous Runway Project leadership program to help educate, and to build the confidence and self-esteem of local First Nations and Native American youth in Saskatoon. 

A collaborative approach undertaken with Canada's Her 4 Directions, is set to reveal the magical works of Indigenous communities when they come together 'to empower their people' on 24 September 2016 at the Wanuskewin Heritage Lodge.

Local Indigenous youth will be taken on a journey of self-discovery, cultural awareness and appreciation of identity. Many will for the first time, be introduced to the world of fashion and have the opportunity to gain valuable work experience backstage on Global Indigenous Management’s well recognized Global Indigenous Runway. They will be joined on the runway by Indigenous youth from around the world.

The Global Indigenous Runway is a unique event that looks to celebrate the diverse cultures of various lands. It presents a modern interpretation of cultural identity featuring delicate hand-woven garments, printed fabrics, incredible haute-couture pieces, striking Indigenous models, talent, and many other creatives. It’s a runway unlike any other.

    

 

Global Indigenous Managements leadership program and Runway event is expected to gather one of the largest collections of First Nations fashionista’s including top Global Indigenous designers Helen Oro, Shona Tawhiao, David Roil, Jeanine Clarkin, Colleen Tighe Johnson, and many more.

Local Indigenous business Her 4 Directions has established a Planning Committee that will provide assistance in the implementation, planning and Identification  of opportunities such as cultural exchange, and community development to ensure the Global Indigenous Management Indigenous Runway Project leadership program and Global Indigenous Runway event in Saskatoon Canada is delivered and accessible to local First Nations youth and communities.

Global Indigenous Management need your support

The past few years has been a financial struggle and without support or funding, Global Indigenous Management will not be able to continue with such resounding success. Tina recalls taking one of the Indigenous young people home after a workshop and asking them if Mum or Dad would be home. They looked at her and said, “Why is that?” Tina said with a big smile, “Just in case we run out of gas.”

On the other hand, Global Indigenous Management's primary focus is empowering Indigenous young people to feel comfortable in their own skin and to showcase the multitude of Indigenous talent.   “Sharing this program and platform with other Indigenous is so rewarding and means the world to us” Tina says, “because it has changed the lives of so many”. 

“To see a young Indigenous person walk in with their hoodie over their head, hunched over looking down at the floor, then later walking out with a step in their stride and heads held high is surreal”. 

The platform draws a great sense of pride and achievement as they experience back of house tasks including audio, lighting, staging, makeup and hair; not just modelling or designing,

Help FUND Global Indigenous Management to educate and create a pathway to Fashion in Saskatoon, Canada and globally, where we will be sharing our Fashion Immersion Leadership program and Global Indigenous Runway Platform with the First Nations and Native American youth and tribal councils.

From Grassroots

Global Indigenous Management’s Founder and Chairperson Tina Waru developed an initiative – the Indigenous Runway Project leadership program in 2012, which is one of the most celebrated Indigenous initiatives in Australia and New Zealand. The Indigenous Runway Project emerged supporting Aboriginal Indigenous fashion, talent and designers to break into the fashion industry.  The project has been nominated for Australia’s National Reconciliation Award in 2014 and 2016 and Best Practice Award for the Aboriginal Education Strategy in Victoria.

There was a growing need to empower Indigenous young people with confidence, motivation and pride. They were able to embrace their hidden beauty, talent and explore career pathways in various areas of fashion, modelling, fashion design, performing arts, production, hair, makeup and styling.

From a small group of volunteers to a large team of Indigenous and fashion experts, the Indigenous Runway Project continues to provide a mentoring model that responds to community needs. It develops leadership, and provides structured support to help Indigenous young people to define their own careers in the fashion industry.

To date, Indigenous Runway Project has reached other global Indigenous communities such as New Zealand, Arizona, Canada. Since 2012 the Indigenous Runway Project has received over 4500 expressions of interest, inspiring thousands of established and emerging Indigenous fashion talent and designers. 

The Emergence of an Entrepreneurial Platform

Today, Global Indigenous Management is a world leader in Indigenous fashion, arts events, models, talent Agency and are soon to expand into the retail market, with its high fashion boutique creating the world's first global Indigenous platform branching out to many countries around the world.

Global Indigenous Management produces three annual global Indigenous Runway events. They are part of Melbourne Spring Fashion Week and Virgin Australia Melbourne Fashion Festival’s core runway platforms and Taranaki New Zealand’s annual fashion event.

In 2014 Global Indigenous Management went on to create and produce the Global Catwalk – Positive Runway for the AIDS Conference in Melbourne Australia.

Global Indigenous Management encapsulates high fashion commercial Indigenous models and celebrity endorsements  such as; Martin Sensmeier (First Nations Actor/Model) Luke Carroll (Aboriginal Actor), Mark Coles Smith (Aboriginal Actor), Lois Peeler (Original Sapphire), Shareena Clanton (Aboriginal Actress), Maisey Rika (Maori Artist), Toni Huata ( Maori Artist) as well as photographers National and International Magazines and Fashion Bloggers to name a few; Japanese Vogue, The Fashion Journal, Cocktail Revolution, The Dress Collective, The Fashion Advocate, The Weekly Review, Christina Miller (UK),Alika Islamadina (Indonesia),Sonia Eryka (Indonesia), make-up artists, hair stylists, interior designers, fashion designers, fashion stylists, talent across film, television and theatre productions.

Global Indigenous Management also offers marketing packages ‘i.e. Indigenous Fashion Catwalks’ for corporate and community events and prides itself in being a leader in the industry by promoting and showcasing Indigenous fashion that not only benefits the industry but Indigenous peoples.

 WHY FUND US?

To enable Indigenous and Indigenous youth gain confidence, build their self esteem, so that they are better equipped to pursue career options in the fashion industry. This will also provide emerging and established fashion designers, to showcase on a highly acclaimed international fashion platform, the Indigenous Runway Project. The funds will continue to assist Global Indigenous Management to provide and implement programs, platforms, career pathways and services for Indigenous in Canada and globally. The more backing Global Indigenous Management receives, will increase the ability to reach further into Indigenous needs. 

Indigenous Runway Project 

RUNWAY  & DESIGNS

   

   

MAKEUP

   

PRODUCTION

     

PERFORMING ARTISTS

    

PHOTOSHOOTS

   

 

Help Fund Global Indigenous Management

Please Share or Back our campaign

The Global Indigenous Runway is a unique event that looks to celebrate the diverse cultures of various lands. It presents a modern interpretation of cultural identity featuring delicate hand-woven garments, printed fabrics, incredible haute-couture pieces, striking Indigenous models, talent, and many other creatives. It’s a runway unlike any other.
    
 
Global Indigenous Managements leadership program and Runway event is expected to gather one of the largest collections of First Nations fashionista’s including top Global Indigenous designers Helen Oro, Shona Tawhiao, David Roil, Jeanine Clarkin, Colleen Tighe Johnson, and many more.
Local Indigenous business Her 4 Directions has established a Planning Committee that will provide assistance in the implementation, planning and Identification  of opportunities such as cultural exchange, and community development to ensure the Global Indigenous Management Indigenous Runway Project leadership program and Global Indigenous Runway event in Saskatoon Canada is delivered and accessible to local First Nations youth and communities.

Global Indigenous Management need your support
The past few years has been a financial struggle and without support or funding, Global Indigenous Management will not be able to continue with such resounding success. Tina recalls taking one of the Indigenous young people home after a workshop and asking them if Mum or Dad would be home. They looked at her and said, “Why is that?” Tina said with a big smile, “Just in case we run out of gas.”On the other hand, Global Indigenous Management's primary focus is empowering Indigenous young people to feel comfortable in their own skin and to showcase the multitude of Indigenous talent.   “Sharing this program and platform with other Indigenous is so rewarding and means the world to us” Tina says, “because it has changed the lives of so many”. “To see a young Indigenous person walk in with their hoodie over their head, hunched over looking down at the floor, then later walking out with a step in their stride and heads held high is surreal”. The platform draws a great sense of pride and achievement as they experience back of house tasks including audio, lighting, staging, makeup and hair; not just modelling or designing,Help FUND Global Indigenous Management to educate and create a pathway to Fashion in Saskatoon, Canada and globally, where we will be sharing our Fashion Immersion Leadership program and Global Indigenous Runway Platform with the First Nations and Native American youth and tribal councils.From GrassrootsGlobal Indigenous Management’s Founder and Chairperson Tina Waru developed an initiative – the Indigenous Runway Project leadership program in 2012, which is one of the most celebrated Indigenous initiatives in Australia and New Zealand. The Indigenous Runway Project emerged supporting Aboriginal Indigenous fashion, talent and designers to break into the fashion industry.  The project has been nominated for Australia’s National Reconciliation Award in 2014 and 2016 and Best Practice Award for the Aboriginal Education Strategy in Victoria.There was a growing need to empower Indigenous young people with confidence, motivation and pride. They were able to embrace their hidden beauty, talent and explore career pathways in various areas of fashion, modelling, fashion design, performing arts, production, hair, makeup and styling.From a small group of volunteers to a large team of Indigenous and fashion experts, the Indigenous Runway Project continues to provide a mentoring model that responds to community needs. It develops leadership, and provides structured support to help Indigenous young people to define their own careers in the fashion industry.To date, Indigenous Runway Project has reached other global Indigenous communities such as New Zealand, Arizona, Canada. Since 2012 the Indigenous Runway Project has received over 4500 expressions of interest, inspiring thousands of established and emerging Indigenous fashion talent and designers. The Emergence of an Entrepreneurial PlatformToday, Global Indigenous Management is a world leader in Indigenous fashion, arts events, models, talent Agency and are soon to expand into the retail market, with its high fashion boutique creating the world's first global Indigenous platform branching out to many countries around the world.Global Indigenous Management produces three annual global Indigenous Runway events. They are part of Melbourne Spring Fashion Week and Virgin Australia Melbourne Fashion Festival’s core runway platforms and Taranaki New Zealand’s annual fashion event.In 2014 Global Indigenous Management went on to create and produce the Global Catwalk – Positive Runway for the AIDS Conference in Melbourne Australia.Global Indigenous Management encapsulates high fashion commercial Indigenous models and celebrity endorsements  such as; Martin Sensmeier (First Nations Actor/Model) Luke Carroll (Aboriginal Actor), Mark Coles Smith (Aboriginal Actor), Lois Peeler (Original Sapphire), Shareena Clanton (Aboriginal Actress), Maisey Rika (Maori Artist), Toni Huata ( Maori Artist) as well as photographers National and International Magazines and Fashion Bloggers to name a few; Japanese Vogue, The Fashion Journal, Cocktail Revolution, The Dress Collective, The Fashion Advocate, The Weekly Review, Christina Miller (UK),Alika Islamadina (Indonesia),Sonia Eryka (Indonesia), make-up artists, hair stylists, interior designers, fashion designers, fashion stylists, talent across film, television and theatre productions.Global Indigenous Management also offers marketing packages ‘i.e. Indigenous Fashion Catwalks’ for corporate and community events and prides itself in being a leader in the industry by promoting and showcasing Indigenous fashion that not only benefits the industry but Indigenous peoples. WHY FUND US?
To enable Indigenous and Indigenous youth gain confidence, build their self esteem, so that they are better equipped to pursue career options in the fashion industry. This will also provide emerging and established fashion designers, to showcase on a highly acclaimed international fashion platform, the Indigenous Runway Project. The funds will continue to assist Global Indigenous Management to provide and implement programs, platforms, career pathways and services for Indigenous in Canada and globally. The more backing Global Indigenous Management receives, will increase the ability to reach further into Indigenous needs. Indigenous Runway Project RUNWAY  & DESIGNS      MAKEUP   PRODUCTION     PERFORMING ARTISTS    PHOTOSHOOTS    Help Fund Global Indigenous ManagementPlease Share or Back our campaign

story:
Who We Are

Hi there! My name is Vicente (Vince) Lujan. I'm a bilingual liturgical musician and praise and worship leader. From my work  as a parish youth minister, workshop presenter, and professional musician at live music concerts and liturgies, my goal has been to  build and cross bridges that span the gap between the English and Spanish speaking communities within the church.

I'm part of the bilingual music ministry 'Jesus Team A' which was founded by my long time friend and songwriting partner Manuel Bravo. Jesus Team A (Jesus Te Ama) - is an energetic bilingual praise and worship band. We strive to seamlessly blend Spanish and English songs and bring together people from diverse backgrounds. By sharing our personal faith journeys and exploring differences in cultural experience, we seek to unite listeners as the body of Christ. Our message challenges participants to reach beyond personal borders and offer the unconditional acceptance that Christ offers to all of us.

Manuel and I have been serving as music ministers since we met in 2003 at Immaculate Conception Church in Denton, TX. Over the years we have appeared at countless churches and ministries to play for liturgies of all kinds, retreats, conferences, youth camps, Diocesan World Youth Day events, and have been asked to play for the Catholic Underground in both New York and Los Angeles. 

Over the years we've released EP's or short play 'albums' with 3 or 5 modestly produced songs but never a full length professionally produced album that fans and supporters have asked us for. 

We have hesitated trying to mount a campaign to help us achieve this goal because we wanted to be engage our supporters for a purpose far beyond the usual request to give money so we can record a nice sounding album. 

We want to challenge the English speaking and Spanish church to grow in relationship and support of each other.

Jesus Team A is about bringing people together with music.  In our friendships, families, and communities, we see diversity.  We have already crossed bridges and so-called barriers of religion, age, nationality, and race.  We want to share our message of open doors and open hearts with the whole world.  We want to bring people together, to build bridges together.  If you feel the same way, please, come and join us.  

What We Need From You

Here is a line itemized list of the costs we are asking you to help us with:

aprox $3,500 for Recording, Mixing, Mastering

aprox $1,000 for Musician Recording Fees

aprox $600 for Photoshoot

aprox $900 for Digital design

aprox $2,000 for CD manufacturing and duplication

           Bonus Goals

Music Video of Quiero Entrar​/Enter In on location at different church communities depicting unity among multicultural communities: $5,000

Marketing costs to help promote the album project and movement associated with. Sales to Marketing/Publicity and Coordinating a national marketing effort towards a Press Junket: $2,500

Regional/National Touring costs over a 3mo period to bring the message of Kingdom Building specifically among Spanish and English speaking communities: $5,000

What You Get: The Perks!

Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!

If We Can't Reach Our Entire Goal :-(

If we cannot reach our entire goal, we intend to use whatever monies we do raise to offset the cost and will continue to work towards completion of this project. We will appropriate the funds in the order listed above.

The Impact

Your contribution is more than a collection of songs on a CD, it means you say yes to community, yes to working together, yes to embracing other cultures, yes to the Body of Christ.

The rhetoric that has been dividing our people in this country has reached a fever pitch level and it seems we grow farther and farther apart with absolutely no way to cross the chasms we have created for ourselves. We here at Jesus Team A want to be catalysts for conversation, sharing, healing, and for love. 

Risks & Challenges

Although Jesus Team A has been in ministry for many years, we have never asked for this kind of help before. We have waited and prayed, prayed and waited for discernment on when to act. 

We are stepping out in faith that the time for us to act is now. We realize the difficultly in sharing and connecting our message  with enough people to reach our goal. 

We are convicted of the call that has been asked of us to go forth and share the good news. And we believe it's by no accident that you've read this far. We want to be a living image of community and love and share the stories we hear from your community with others.

We believe you can help us do that.

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't worry if you can't contribute financially to our project! 

You can help just by simply praying for God's will in this endeavor.

AND... You can help by sharing this campaign everywhere and to everyone you can! The more people see and hear our message the better!

Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign!

Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Barbershop Studio (BS) Playset is inspired by the desire to create an answer to the growing concern about our youth and young adult’s challenges to communicate effectively, engage and socialize with parents, friends, teachers and employers. This is a CALL TO ACTION!  Our action is PREVENTION. Our Action is to do away with the INEFFECTIVE COMMUNICATION by younger millennials as they grow and mature into young adults. We are introducing social skills at a younger age.

Our Barbershop Studio will support young boys in learning at an early age how to socially interact across generations and remove communication barriers that are experienced today. How you may ask? Through meaningful and imaginative play in this realistic barbershop environment, growth in social and emotional skills will be fostered.

A peer-reviewed journal, Psychology in the Schools, published an article in 2004, which examined dimensions of peer play. What it showed is that children exhibiting high levels of peer play interaction were found to demonstrate more competent emotional-regulation, initiation, self-determination, and receptive vocabulary skills.
Patricia M Greenfield, a distinguished professor of psychology at UCLA and senior author of the study said that "decreased sensitivity to emotional cues is one of the costs of the use of digital media… The displacement of in person social interaction by screen interactions seems to be reducing social skills."

Bringing Barbershop Studio to market will support educational centers and parents in nurturing socially and emotionally healthy children. To address this critical need, I am working to raise $10,000. Your donation will be utilized to develop an authentic brand in order to bring Barbershop Studio to market. The branding will secure a trademark, which will aid in the plight to secure a manufacturing, distribution or licensing partnership. It is my dream that Barbershop Studio will be in homes, daycare centers and barbershops around the world. After all, it is play that stimulates creativity.

Your contribution towards funding today will help further develop a product that can assist in relieving the anxiety a child may feel during their first visit to the barbershop. It will help stimulate children’s imaginations and development of social skills, which in turn builds character and confidence. Barbershop Studio will revitalize interaction through meaningful play.
 

 

What We Need & What You Get

I believe so deeply in this idea that I have personally funded the development and marketing costs to date. After participating in INPEX, an inventors and new product tradeshow in June 2016 and June 2017, I knew I had a strong product to bring to the market.

Now I need YOUR support to help raise funding for the next step in my process. I respectfully ask that you back my campaign!

Please see the donation levels to the right. 

 

Our Impact

Barbershop Studio Playset will remove barriers to effective communication by engaging young boys in socially interactive play. Young boys will bring to their teen years, young adult and adulthood skills such as self-regulation and sensitivity to social cues. By introducing socially interactive skills at a younger age, Barbershop Studio Playset will remove communication barriers that are often experienced today by millennials. Barbershop Studio Playset will help children build confidence in their communication and social skills. Barbershop Studio Playset will foster a child's dreams of entrepreneurship. 

Risks, Challenges and Strengths

RISKS

  • Loss of personal investment
  • Not reaching our fundraising goal
  • Tooling for plastic prototype may not be attainable due to cost
  • Securing the proper licensing and/or manufacturing partnership

CHALLENGES

  • Minimal brand exposure
  • Creating interest of Angel Investors

STRENGTHS

  • Leadership team in place
  • Product holds a patent
  • Attorney and mentors in place for support and guidance
  • Experience/Education from INPEX 2016 and 2017

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us spread the word!

  • Email your friends and listservs, invite them to support.
  • Mention this campaign in newsletters that reach parents, families, educators, child care centers and others who care about youth development or enhancing the social skills of our youth.
  • Let us know if you know any blogs/bloggers or investors who might be interested in our invention.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Hassan "Dr. Pooch" Diop. I'm not a traditional doctor yet but I am a Certified Holistic Health Coach and continue to further my studies in natural medicine. For years I've also been a poet/songwriter. Over time the two merged and created a one-of-a-kind health-oriented children's book series! 

The main character Johnny Mustache, is black and latino, which represents the demographics most afflicted with chronic illness and obesity. The books engage lower income community children to be health conscious. By creating "little health coaches" in homes around the country, children will hold their parents accountable to the memorable lines they read and become co-creators of a healthier environment for us all.

Just today I met with the principal of a south L.A elementary who told me kids are being rushed to hospitals because a popular red hot chip concoction. more popular among hispanic children, is destroying their stomach lining! One principal told me her main problem was to hire nurses who knows how to administer insulin to children! We need a change. By teaching kids to be better custodians of their bodies and the earth, it will be a better future for us all.

What We Need & What You Get

I am humbly asking for $15,000. This is going to developing the 6 books left to complete the series. The remainder is going to printing and marketing for the existing 6 on the market. I can get competitive prices if printing in bulk. Thus far I've been printing from CreateSpace and pay too much to keep my price affordable for the low-income communities that really need this material.  The more books I can have available for children, the more schools/families I can get them to. The Los Angeles Unified School District is the 2nd largest in the U.S. They have expressed a great need for this type of material. 

Of course we don't set out to fail but, if we fall short of our goal, the funds that have been generated are going to printing. As an independent publisher the main priority is to have BOOKS.

 

The Impact

Unfortunately, many S. Los Angeles kids live in low-income communities in what we call "food deserts", where access to healthy food options are almost non-existent.  Teaching children health concepts expands their minds, fortifies their bodies and gives them a far better chance at success in today's world. Not only is there a lack of holistic health material on the children's book market but there's also a lack of diversity in book characters. This project is a one stop holistic gem that addresses the most important health concepts in a fun edu-taining way. Dr. Seuss had a great run, but instead Green Eggs and Ham, Dr. Pooch is introducing kids to slightly healthier options.

From Michelle Obama to Aja Brown from our own local government, all have personally expressed the importance of this project. I need your help to succeed. To succeed would mean changing kids lives!!!!

Risks & Challenges

I am venturing into markets that have yet to be tapped into. I am merging the children's book market and the global health and wellness market into one product. I believe we are in the perfect climate to release books/curriculum of this nature to children. I have conducted workshops, speaking engagements and book readings in over 25 schools in Los Angeles County and maintain good relationships with their principals and educators. I've yet to meet an educator that hasn't expressed great interest and need for my books.

Other Ways You Can Help

This campaign deals with the two most important things in our adult lives: Health and children. Those are two things that we all care about. Send this campaign to someone who has a voice/reach far greater mine. Get this in front of a celebrity that can not only sponsor but be an ambassador to this project. Post this on your own social networks. Anything helps!!! Feel free to copy paste the link to this campaign by using the indiegogo share tools.

Thank you for your support!

Sincerely, 

Dr. Pooch

story:
Short Summary

Sharing one’s story has long been an empowering practice for survivors of domestic and sexual violence. Amid a culture where survivors are still stigmatized, shamed, and blamed, sharing one’s experience is an act of radical reclaiming of one’s narrative and life. Since 2013, the multimedia, online sharing platform Surviving In Numbers has provided a safe and anonymous place for survivors to share their experiences within a community that accepts and empowers.

To keep changing the culture, survivors need even more. With your help, we will build an entirely new website to provide an improved platform for survivors to continue to safely share their voices, be part of a community, and seek support. You’ll also help us build the new Project Thrive component of Surviving In Numbers, which will extend this impact even further, reaching survivors who have not yet been able to speak their truth, share their stories, and begin their process of healing.

Project Thrive will be a multimedia platform consisting of written blogs and video content capturing the diverse array of survivor narratives of healing, resilience, and thriving. The content will be captured by our staff, as well as through submissions from survivors themselves. The content will eventually become a full-length feature film that could be used for educational purposes, extending the impact of partnering organizations beyond Surviving in Numbers.

 

What We Need & What You Get

For this next phase of Surviving In Numbers, we need $50,000. Every dollar counts. With that money, we will:

  • Build an entirely new website, featuring an improved platform for survivor story-sharing and connecting, and which can accommodate and amplify the video content submitted for Project Thrive
  • Begin planning and production for Project Thrive, including the initial outreach to survivors who have not yet been able to speak their truth, share their stories, and begin their process of healing.

The Impact

Survivors who have shared their experiences on the platform have reported that they feel understood and validated, often for the first time, and are now taking critical steps forward in their own healing. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share the link to this campaign with friends, family, groups you are part of (online or off), and anyone you know. Sexual violence affects everyone, and every dollar will make a difference for survivors. Even if you are unable to personally donate, sharing with those in your community ensures we'll reach more people and raise more dollars.
    • For a Tweet: Survivors of sexual violence need your help. http://igg.me/at/surviving-in-numbers-action 
    • On Facebook or LinkedIn: Now more than ever, we need a culture change. Survivors of sexual violence need your help. Give to Surviving in Numbers.
story_txt:
Short Summary
Sharing one’s story has long been an empowering practice for survivors of domestic and sexual violence. Amid a culture where survivors are still stigmatized, shamed, and blamed, sharing one’s experience is an act of radical reclaiming of one’s narrative and life. Since 2013, the multimedia, online sharing platform Surviving In Numbers has provided a safe and anonymous place for survivors to share their experiences within a community that accepts and empowers.

To keep changing the culture, survivors need even more. With your help, we will build an entirely new website to provide an improved platform for survivors to continue to safely share their voices, be part of a community, and seek support. You’ll also help us build the new Project Thrive component of Surviving In Numbers, which will extend this impact even further, reaching survivors who have not yet been able to speak their truth, share their stories, and begin their process of healing.
Project Thrive will be a multimedia platform consisting of written blogs and video content capturing the diverse array of survivor narratives of healing, resilience, and thriving. The content will be captured by our staff, as well as through submissions from survivors themselves. The content will eventually become a full-length feature film that could be used for educational purposes, extending the impact of partnering organizations beyond Surviving in Numbers.
 

What We Need & What You Get
For this next phase of Surviving In Numbers, we need $50,000. Every dollar counts. With that money, we will:

Build an entirely new website, featuring an improved platform for survivor story-sharing and connecting, and which can accommodate and amplify the video content submitted for Project Thrive
Begin planning and production for Project Thrive, including the initial outreach to survivors who have not yet been able to speak their truth, share their stories, and begin their process of healing.


The Impact

Survivors who have shared their experiences on the platform have reported that they feel understood and validated, often for the first time, and are now taking critical steps forward in their own healing. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share the link to this campaign with friends, family, groups you are part of (online or off), and anyone you know. Sexual violence affects everyone, and every dollar will make a difference for survivors. Even if you are unable to personally donate, sharing with those in your community ensures we'll reach more people and raise more dollars.

For a Tweet: Survivors of sexual violence need your help. http://igg.me/at/surviving-in-numbers-action 

On Facebook or LinkedIn: Now more than ever, we need a culture change. Survivors of sexual violence need your help. Give to Surviving in Numbers.

story:
**************************************

First fundraising milestone is £10,000 to buy the scooter and sidecar 

Check the updates tab for more information as the campaign develops

**************************************

The first ever circumnavigation of the globe on a scooter with a sidecar in aid of compassion, understanding and the fight against modern day slavery. 

  1. Fighting slavery and other human rights abuses by inspiring compassionate decision making through the medium of story telling.
  2. Raising awareness and funds for WalkFree.org and the fight against modern day slavery.
  3. Working with and supporting small NGOs and charities across the globe. 

 

In 2017 Matt Bishop and Reece Gilkes will set out to be the first people to ever circumnavigate the globe on a scooter with a sidecar. Here's why:

Our news over the past year or two has been pretty scary.  Society is becoming more and more divided. It doesn’t matter where on the political spectrum you sit: you could be revelling in Don's victory or still mourning Bernie's loss, have voted for Brexit or to remain, the fact of the matter is, hate crime is on the rise, scaremongering is rife in our politics and press, and there is a genuine lack of understanding and compassion between one and other, both within countries and across our borders. We think that this lack of compassion extends to pretty much everything we do. It doesn’t only affect the way we vote but just as importantly it influences our everyday actions such as the things we buy, causes we support or people we socialise with. So, what we want to do with this expedition is connect people on a basic human level, through the medium of storytelling, in the hope of creating a more conscientious and compassionate society.

An obvious example of this lack of compassion is the migrant crisis in Europe but it extends to pretty much everything we do. For example, there are currently 45.8 million people living in modern day slavery and they’re in every country on earth. That’s more than double what there was during the time of the transatlantic slave trade and much of them are trapped because of the decisions we make. The lack of compassion in our decision making keeps people enslaved.

If we knew the people who were trapped in the cotton fields in Uzbekistan or the textiles factories in Bangladesh, then we wouldn't support the industries that keep them there. 

We’re working with a network of NGOs, charities and local experts on our route who will be telling us stories of what everyday life is like for people in the places they work. Through these stories we will be able to connect with the people who we affect with our decisions at home and with this greater understanding we will be more inspired to make small changes that will ultimately help end modern day slavery and other human rights abuses. 

So why the scooter and sidecar?

The world is just completely potty at the moment. Frankie Boyle put it excellently when he said:

"There has to be something wrong with a world where the best employment option for a farmer in sub-Saharan Africa isn’t being a farmer in sub-Saharan Africa, but crossing the Mediterranean on a punctured lilo, only to spend days dangling under a lorry so that he can end up selling lollipops in a nightclub toilet".

Maybe Frankie is being a tad hyperbolic but he's right, because of the ways in which we have interacted with other countries, people from all over the world are fleeing to safer and more economically prosperous countries in search of a better life. And clearly with the rise of anti-immigration policies across much of the western world, people don't want to let them in. Well we believe that this is down to political scaremongering that's compounded in the press.

As human beings, we naturally want to help each other out, not turn our backs on people in need, and we have the capacity to help but because we are scared we don’t. People on the other side of national borders are easily grouped and stigmatised by the press when in fact they are just trying to make a better life for themselves.

That's why, to highlight how absurd we think it is that we treat human beings differently dependent on which side of a national border they are on, we are going to cross a load of national borders on the most absurd piece of equipment imaginable - a scooter with a sidecar. 

For the record we accept that national borders are needed. But what we don’t get is why our feelings towards people should change because of the border. The people on the other side are no different to you or me and should be treated with the same level of compassion and respect as any other person. This is the case no matter what issue you look at all around the world – it seems that if it’s abroad it’s just not as important to us. Well we think, that now that we live in such an interconnected world, that the ‘out of sight, out of mind’ philosophy is just plain outdated.

So, if we can circumnavigate the entire planet on this completely inappropriate mode of transport then maybe we can show just how close to home the world’s problems are and how it really doesn’t matter if you’re a farmer in Africa or an ice cream man in the UK, ultimately, what we hold in common significantly outweighs our differences.

**************************************

Fundraising

At the same time as telling stories we will be raising funds to fight modern day slavery and other human rights abuses. The expedition is going to be ridiculously challenging. It will take nearly 18 months and will involve us trawling through mud, sand and snow in a scooter with a sidecar. Despite our original thoughts, sidecars are simply not made for those kind of conditions: it's going to act like an oven in the heat and a freezer in the cold so this really does qualify as stupid enough to be a fundraiser. We're aiming to raise £50,000 to get this show on the road. A minimum of half of which will go to organisations fighting modern day slavery and other human rights abuses: with the majority of that going to WalkFree.org and some donations going to local organisations in the countries we visit. 

Please donate to this expedition and help us fight for compassion and against slavery and other human rights abuses. 

For more information, you can check out our website at www.AsSeenFromTheSidecar.org or get in touch at info@AsSeenFromTheSidecar.org

story:
Short Summary

Rachel's been accepted to her dream school for Fall 2016. It's a one semester residency program that teaches all of the major disciplines in an art immersion environment. She'll be able to work with world class artists and learn with students from all over the world. She couldn't be more thrilled. 

Unfortunately, the school no longer has financial aid available at this time. As a result, we're having to get creative and develop our own aid package. Friends kindly asked me to create this crowdfunding campaign to help me to send Rachel to her dream school this Fall.

What We Need

The program cost including housing, food, supplies, all of the classroom teaching, after school supervision, and overnight caretakers costs $26,500. Additionally she'll be continuing her French education for another $750. 


In total that means we need $27,250 to cover her education with world class artists. 


The Impact

Rachel has already built a great foundation in the arts. 


She performed in the annual school play, Almost Maine, this year.


She's had short films in both the Sonoma International Film Festival and the Portland Youth Film Festival. She's also held a Videography Internship with the men of Ask a Winemaker at the International Pinot Noir Celebration, and served as the makeup artist for multiple student films. 


Rachel's work in film, makeup arts, and theatre was part of what earned her a place in her new art program.


Risks & Challenges

In the art program, Rachel will get to develop her own multi-disciplinary art education while also learning geography, world culture, the sciences and writing disciplines alongside top students from around the world. 


Any funds raised will be used towards the cost of the program. 


We'll be seeking other scholarships and funding options as well. It's harder though to find financial aid for high school than for college, which is why we need your help.


We are also able to make payments over the course of the semester if needed. 


I'll be working hard to earn extra income to contribute to the cost of the program, as well as seeking any high school scholarships or loans we can find. 


Any of your contributions will make a huge difference for both of us. 


Other Ways You Can Help

We understand not everyone can afford to contribute. Your encouragement and support is always appreciated. Most of all we're so grateful for your friendship. 


If you'd rather make a payment in Rachel's name directly to her art program, please feel free to message me directly for information on how to do so. Again, thank you!

story:
Crisis Classroom

My name is Kate McAllister and I'm a teacher from Brighton .  In the summer of 2015 I began working with refugees in the Calais Jungle.  My aim was to develop an educational model that could go to them as they could not go to school.   Over the past 18 months I have been working side by side with refugees and volunteers to build a team of like-minded educators.  We have worked hard to develop flexible solutions to providing education in the most difficult of circumstances.  We believe that education isn’t a privilege but a fundamental human right that must not be denied. We uphold this right, we fight for it and we enable it. Unconstrained by bricks and mortar, unconcerned by age limits, Crisis Classrooms are open to everyone. More than just algebra and verbs, this is relearning life in another language so that life can begin again. This is education that helps you take back control and regain a sense of self, so you can say to someone in their own language, so they’ll understand that you mean it “I will stand on my own two feet again.”

We learned a lot about emergency education and how to overcome the many barriers that people face on their journeys towards freedom.  Refugee numbers are rising and there are people settling not just in camps, but also in towns and cities across Europe. Without access to education their most basic of human rights go unmet.  The simple act of learning enough language to communicate, to ask for what you need, can make all the difference in the world.  We need solutions that can be mobilised quickly, efficiently and by trained and experienced educators.

Crisis Classroom is the result of 18 month's action research in the field. It combines volunteer training with developing innovative approaches to creating classrooms.  From a carefully designed back pack to a school built by the refugees themselves and even a solar-powered, converted double-decker bus.  We are trialling ideas one by one to see what really works in the field.  Every step of the journey is taken with refugees to guide us; their needs, wants and desires are at the heart of everything we do. 

We now want to trial a model for towns and cities that uses already existing spaces, inflatable classrooms and our trained volunteers.  There is something magical that happens when you work together with the refugees themselves.  This is education as partnership, we are building a better future together.  If the pilot is successful it can be rolled out globally.  Trained teachers can order their Crisis Classroom kits online, build a team of volunteers and deploy themselves to wherever there are people in Crisis.  It's nimble, flexible and above all, it's effective.  These structures won't be bulldozed by the authorities, they are weatherproof, modern and can be run entirely without electricity using battery powered fans and solar power.

Please, if you can, make a small contribution towards this project.  It could make all the difference in the world.

story:
Where is Kovno? 

Where is Kovno?  has been invited to exhibit at the Johannesburg Holocaust and Genocide Centre in April 2017.  Many South African Jews have Lithuanian ancestry and yet do not know much of the details of their Lithuanian heritage. Lithuanian Jews (Litvaks) who were Yiddish speaking came to South Africa in waves of emigration that began in the late 1800’s .They brought with them their culture, their humour, their way of seeing the world and their community infra-structure. It was in this world that we grew up. But they did not speak of the trauma of the Holocaust which they had escaped. Most Jewish families in South Africa had some family still living in Lithuania on the eve of WW2. Usually that family was never heard from again. Lithuanian Jews, Litvaks, had lived beside their neighbours for hundreds of years. During WW2, almost the entire community was murdered and buried in over 200 mass killing sites scattered throughout the country

 

The Installation 

Three Jewish South African artists, Yda Walt, Cheryl Rumbak and Phillip Miller first created the Kaddish installation in 2009 for exhibition in Kaunas, Lithuania. It was a memorial to the murdered Jewish citizens of Kaunas (known by its Jewish inhabitants as Kovno). The intention of the work was to ignite memory and break the amnesiac silence of post war Lithuania.   The exhibition that will be shown in South Africa will include the original Kaddish installation consisting of reproducing pages of a 1939 Lithuanian telephone book giving addresses, professions and telephone numbers of the citizens of Lithuania including all the Jews who subsequently perished. The installation also consisted of an embroidered map of the killing sites of Lithuania. The Kaddish prayer is printed on fabric and the haunting soundscape by Phillip Miller of the Yiddish lullaby Oyfn Propetshik. The artists are making a second installation which looks at the experience of South African Jews of Litvak descent, who grew up during the Apartheid era in South Africa and who have journeyed back to Lithuania in search of ‘der Heim’, their grandparent’s lost world. It is in this installation a work of David Goldblatt’s will be shown of the Popolan forest. The Popolan forest is where the Jews of Popolan, homosexuals, Roma and mentally ill of the town were murdered and buried.

In the Siaudine forest outside Popolan-Papile, Lithuania, where on 22 July 1941, 50 Jews and 5 Lithuanians were shot dead by Nazi soldiers and their local collaborators.

Photograph copyright by David Goldblatt

 

The funding we are trying to raise would go towards: 

  • Recreating the original Kaddish installation
  • Implementing a second installation using South African Jewish voices
  • Editing film footage of survivor testimonies and recording new stories

 

For contributing to our project, the rewards include the following: 

For $30: 1 Set of 9 postcards with narrative text (choice between buildings or objects) 

For $50: 2 Sets of 9 postcards with narrative text

Traces of A Vanished Community - Buildings

 

Traces of A Vanished Community - Objects

 

For $75: Choice of Two A3 Posters: 

Map of Jewish Community buildings in Kaunas/Kovno

 

Where is Kovno? poster with the Lithuanian 1939 telephone book​ - design to come 

 

For $250: 3 A4 Object Prints

For $400: 6 A4 Objects Prints

 

$500: 9 A4 Prints

 

For $600: 

The Choral Synagogue 

Handprinted, editioned and signed A3 linocut on cotton rag paper.

For $1000:

The Where is Kovno Package

Both sets of the Traces of the Vanished Community postcards, both designs of the signed poster, 6 A4 Object,  the editioned, handprinted and signed Choral Synagogue Linocut and a thank you in our catalogue.

For $2000:

The Where is Kovno Package Plus

Both sets of the Traces of the Vanished Community postcards, both designs of the signed poster, 9 A4  Object prints,  the editioned, handprinted and signed Choral Synagogue Linocut and a thank you in our catalogue.

For $5000

The Where is Kovno Platinum Package

Both sets of the Traces of the Vanished Community postcards, both designs of the signed poster, 9 A4 handprinted Object linocuts,  the editioned, handprinted and signed Choral Synagogue Linocut and a thank you in our catalogue.

As racism and xenophobia escalates in our modern world, we must make sure that this kind of tragedy never happens again.

For $5000
The Where is Kovno Platinum Package
Both sets of the Traces of the Vanished Community postcards, both designs of the signed poster, 9 A4 handprinted Object linocuts,  the editioned, handprinted and signed Choral Synagogue Linocut and a thank you in our catalogue.
As racism and xenophobia escalates in our modern world, we must make sure that this kind of tragedy never happens again.

story:
Short Summary

We are a small group of computer geeks who just want to make a difference in the world. Technology as we know it is advancing at an unimaginable rate, but there are many who are left behind. While children in some countries are learning to code and have access to the internet, many children in poor countries don't even have the basic environment for education. We want to use our knowledge and resources to help them catch up with life, and to get them out of poverty.

We believe in "teaching how to fish" rather than "give them fish" as the more effective thing to do. The Village PC project is not about sending computers to the village schools. It is about bringing knowledge and training to them, together with the tools to kickstart a basic IT education programme. We will bring over a 100 mini Pi PCs  and teach them how to build these simple computers, and how to use them to teach English, Math and office skills.

Each Mini PC consists of a 7-inch screen, keyboard and mouse, a single board computer running Raspbian or equivalent, and a battery. We do not think a tablet is the right way to go as it does not really allow typing and mouse use. We want to expose and train them how to use PCs, as jobs in the city will require these skills rather than swiping and tapping.

The parts for the Village PC costs about USD$160 per set. Together with shipment and transportation, we estimate the cost per set to be about $200. We will be sending a team of 3 to train the teachers and students at two sites for 6 days, which we estimate will cost about USD$4500 for air-fare, insurance, lodging and expenses. We also think running costs of the school may increase in terms of power consumption and also building storage for the PCs, so a cash grant of about USD1000 will be sufficient to run this programme over two years.

We will be equipping the school with 110 computers and 10% spares. 100 for the children, and 9 for the teachers. It is important for each teacher to have one, so they can learn how else to use it to teach the children more. The teachers are paid about USD$40 a month, so they may not be able to afford a PC. We hope them to build the capability to be self-sustaining over the next few years.

So, we need about $30,000 for this project. This will impact the lives of 600 children and their families in a positive way.

story:
My Goals

1. First and most important is that I need a money to fix an empty room.
The room is about 40 square meters and will be where I teach programming and photography to my students. If there is a lot of people, I will arrange several groups during the day. 
Average price: $15,000

story:
Support World Peace!

World Peace Football brings together two great passions - world peace and football!

  • Help us spread world peace through football, with your grass-roots support, by sponsoring our local programs and the WPF Peace Festival
  • Your support will directly help with our local programs, initially focused on refugee integration through participation in local football activities - great for the children and parents to meet their new neighbors and integrate through positive activities in their new communities
  • Your support will also help bring WPF Peace Ambassadors to our WPF Peace Festival, in Reykjavik, Iceland Oct 6-9, 2016. Selected from the world's conflict hot spots, they will return to their homelands as Peace Ambassadors, with a new understanding of their brothers and sisters from other nations, spreading the word for world peace
  • Join us yourself, as a player or not, with or without your own team, for our 2016 WPF Peace Festival in Iceland Oct 6-9. We will be celebrating Iceland's peaceful presence in the world while recognizing its passion for football
  • If you cannot personally make it to the event, but would like to support world peace - through the global language of football - please make a contribution!
  • Whether or not you're not in a position right now to help financially, please share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn - that will help and be greatly appreciated!!

Read on for more detail on how World Peace Football works.

What We Need & What You Get

We need financial assistance for our local refugee programs, and to organize the Peace festival.

  • Our local programs provide full kit and boots, as well as the local fees, for participation in local football (aka soccer) programs, to newly-arrived refugee families. The current programs are budgeted at $20,000 but with your support we can help many more families.
  • Organizing the Peace Festival will cost at least $20,000, and more depending on how many Peace Ambassadors participate
  • In the first year, we hope to defray the costs for up to 4 teams to join us for the WPF Peace Festival, which will cost at least $40,000 depending on travel cost defrayments
  • So all up, including basic operating costs of $20,000, to fully realize our goals we need to raise $100,000. If we raise more, we can support more refugee families and potentially bring more teams from trouble hot spots to the Peace Festival. If we raise much more, we'll expand the format with regional WPF Peace Festivals in 2017
  • Whatever we raise, we'll sponsor as many families and teams as we can. When it comes to world peace, every little bit helps! Next year (2017) we'll aim bigger - this is just the beginning of a global movement!
  • What you get is to help create an important new grass-roots movement from scratch. In a world where people have become very cynical regarding the 'football elite', known for corruption and back-room deals, we're bringing football back to the people. Join in from the beginning, be recognized as a Founder of WPF!
  • Helping is as easy as 1-2-3, and you can do all three! 
  •     1 = participation in the events 
  •     2 = contributions through purchasing some of the awesome perks
  •     3 = helping with social networking for the campaign by forwarding the link to our campaign to your email contacts and sharing the campaign on your social networks

The Impact

We strongly believe that together we can have a huge impact on world peace, through the international language of football. 

Much as people are fed up with the football elite, there is also great cynicism in many countries regarding a lack of political leadership and the failure of the political elite to lead countries to peace. 

We are taking the initiative by declaring Peace! And we're reaching out to some of the most troubled parts of the world to change people's lives and create WPF Peace Ambassadors to spread the message.

In a unique format (explained below under World Peace Football Rules) we will build new friendships, greater understanding, and enthusiasm for going home and spreading the good word about their new friends.

Special WPF Peace Rules

Since our goal is to promote world peace through football, our football format has several important peace-promoting differences. We have tested them extensively in on-field R&D, and they work!:

  • Goals are not counted, though great plays and acts of sportsmanship are applauded and rewarded
  • There is no referee, instead, the game is 'self called' by the players. Any disagreement is quietly and peacefully resolved by the 2 team captains
  • The game is contact-free under these rules, like basketball. This easily encourages mixed gender games and also games with a wide age range
  • A 'yellow card' infraction is treated as a red card, including a suspension for one immediately subsequent match
  • We play a reduced-numbers format, depending on the surface and the number of players available. Minimum 6 per side, ideally 2 subs per side
  • ... and: the two teams are mixed together!

Why Iceland?

We chose to hold the inaugural WPF Peace Festival in Iceland for a number of reasons:

  • Iceland is easy to get to and very central between Europe and the Americas. With two domestic airlines (WOW Airlines and IcelandAir) plus others now serving it, it is inexpensive and easy to get to
  • Iceland, if you think per capita, is probably the highest-ranking football nation on the planet. They're crazy about football and will be a wonderful participating country
  • Iceland is also famous for warm hospitality and community initiatives - they're looking forward to meeting you!

Note that for Iceland 2016 your travel, accommodations, meals, local transport and refreshments are at your expense. Your team may be selected however for expense defrayment as an official Peace Ambassador squad, depending on how much funds we succeed in raising together.

If you'd like to know more, you can purchase the Q&A Videoconference perk and we'll be happy to answer your questions - and get your additional ideas!!!
