story:
You Give.  They Read.  They Smile.  We Win.

We are basking in the HAPPY comments from schools and families, who say that they can barely believe the positive change in their learners.  It's because we do things very differently than most.  This is not summer school, and it's so much more than a summer camp.  HAPPY Reading is answering a decades-old problem that is hurting America.  We help close the achievement gap by giving kids reading skills, confidence, hope, and HAPPINESS in just a few weeks.

This is not skill and drill.  This is a joyful exploration of history, science, sports, the arts, community service and so much more---through, with and for the sake of reading.  We lead children to a natural love for books by thinking outside the book.

We served 57 children last summer.  And most of them attended for free.  Virtually every child saw MAJOR, measured gains in their ability and attitudes about reading.  This school year, reading and writing has been so much easier for them than ever before!  Help us to make reading HAPPY for even more young learners. 

Why this matters...

Poverty.  Unemployment.  Crime.  Incarceration.  Racism. Bullying.  Questionable character.  Low self-esteem.  Fractured families. Dysfunctional communities.

Name almost any problem that eats away at a cohesive, American fabric.  Think of all the reasons for underachievement and emotional distress.  Research tells us that for a large percentage of what's hurting us, poor reading skill is a common denominator.  Building a brighter future can be as simple as helping more kids become proficient readers...helping more families bond through books....giving more people access to the healing power of simple stories and helping them to unleash the creative genius we all have within.

We've started something special...

The achievement gap...the cavernous difference between the academic success of white, middle-class America and virtually everyone else.... has remained a persistent problem for decades. 

But guess what?  The newest research tells us there's NOT a huge difference in intelligence.  There's a difference in resources...especially in access to books,  intellectual stimulation and enrichment during the summer months.

Our camps address this by thinking outside the book and making reading another fun part of summer camp...with outstanding results.

This time next year...

 ...at least 10 kids will be better readers and writers than they are right now.  They will be stronger communicators and much HAPPIER about it...if you will help us.  We know this because of what we've seen with our campers who attended in the first two years!  Some hated reading and now won't put down books!  Others have gone on to win reading awards and writing contests!  And some have said that for the first time in their lives, they feel smart.

We want to raise enough money for AT LEAST 10 kids to attend summer reading camp for at least two weeks.  These are kids recommended by their schools for extra help.  These are kids who will be able to attend for FREE because of your generosity.

With your help...

...year 3 of our specialty camps will be even better than last year's.  We're looking for $3,000 to cover camp costs for location, staffing, materials, and camp essentials for 10 campers.  We would love to reach even more by exceeding our goal!  If you will make this investment in our project, we will deliver great results for the good of our campers and the good of our world.

For camp director credentials and for testimonials:  http://www.happyreadingcamp.com/campdirector.html

Parents' feedback: 

https://youtu.be/9fxIvmB4NN8

story:
THERE'S JUST 1 DAY LEFT!

Breaking News!!!

WE HAVE A MATCHING GRANT INCENTIVE WITH A DONOR WHO WILL MATCH EVERY DOLLAR UP TO $5,000 FOR A TOTAL OF $10,000!

BUT WE HAVE ONLY 1 DAY LEFT TO RAISE $5K -- SO PLEASE HELP US OUT. EVEN $20 OR $25 MAKES A DIFFERENCE!

WE REALLY NEED YOUR HELP NOW WITH ONLY 1 DAY TO GO... 
                                                         THANKS FOR YOUR SUPPORT!!!

Hello folks, 

I'm Lauren, founder of Reading Opens Minds. 

I started Reading Opens Minds as a volunteer passion project 5 years ago with my wallet and a dream that someday low-income areas in LA would embrace reading as a gateway to personal success and fulfillment.

We've partnered with LA Review of Books 
to bring you The REAL WORD Podcast so you can hear our sometimes crazy, sometimes heartbreaking, book club discussions and get to know our kids on a more personal level, like the MTV show The Real World. 

You'll get to know (and LOVE) the teens in this tight-knit high school group, all of whom come from low-income families in the San Fernando Valley, CA.

By funding this podcast project, you'll be part of giving young voices in at-risk communities a public platform to be heard, talking about books and about life, voices we don't ordinarily get to hear in the mainstream -- voices to which we need to pay attention.

The Real Deal:

We're asking for 15K to launch this first season of The REAL WORD podcast. 

So far we got help from a NPR podcast expert (producer, editor, equipment plus a teeny bit of advertising to get the WORD out) for the launch of our first season.

Whatever funds we raise, even if we don't make the entire 15K, will go directly toward this project and our kids and BOOKS!

The Impact:

By joining our podcast audience you will be bringing important voices into the mainstream of our literary culture. We're a 501 (c) (3) non-profit organization that endeavors to give at-risk communities a VOICE and a CHOICE and you're providing the perfect OPPORTUNITY. YOU!!

YOU'LL be in the room where it happens now, after 5 years of bearing witness behind closed doors (or behind bars). Now, we get to bring YOU with us!

Challenges:

Here's the deal about being in the non-profit sector: sometimes it can really stink. I don't mean to be negative and complain, but seriously, it is a Herculean effort to stay afloat every day in this funding roulette and to keep the passion burning for all of our volunteers, board members and participants. 

Reading seems to have taken a dive in popularity and in value and if you've never developed a reading habit, it's really difficult to get engaged and excited about it, but READING is so essential to personal success.

We want YOU -- you beloved people who care about others who have less, and who care about keeping the love of READING alive and passing on this "Portable Magic" (thank you Stephen King!) to everyone you can! Join us!

Other Ways You Can Help:

Hey, if you feel as passionate as we do but you've only got lint in your pockets right now, you can help by sharing the crap out of this campaign -- EMAIL, FACEBOOK, INSTAGRAM, TWITTER, SNAPCHAT, SMOKE SIGNALS, any which way you can!

Please, please use the Indiegogo share tools to help us spread the WORD!

T H A N K   Y O U !!!

story:
What’s the problem we’re trying to solve?
To deliver basic humanitarian items like food, water and shelter to refugees who arrive in Lesvos in Greece. Over 181,000 refugees have arrived by sea in Greece this year, most to Lesvos. 66% come from Syria. Greece is in crisis and cannot cope with managing the situation. There is very limited presence of international NGOs and the backbone of the humanitarian response has come from grassroots voluntary groups. Let’s support them to provide clean water, food & shelter for the refugees.

Why do we care about this?
No human should be without food, water and shelter. It is simply heartbreaking to see the refugees who have escaped war, arrive in Europe and not even have a tent to sleep in. There are volunteer groups on the island like Oloi Mazi (the village of altogther) and Help the Molyvos Refugees who work tirelessly and selflessly and this is an effort to support them.

How will the money be spent?
1. Food – to be distributed at camps and bus stops 2. Tents – to be used at the camps and other informal settings because there are not enough 3. Water – for refugees walking the 70km journey on arrival/waiting for bus 4. Transport – to transfer volunteers & food to the camps to deliver food; to help ferry children & disabled from arrival points to the bus stop 5. Interpreting costs 6. Cleaning materials because the camps are filthy

When will supporters see the difference?
Immediately. As soon as the crowdfunding date expires, I will go to Lesvos and work with the existing grassroots organisations to deliver the funds.

we created also a bank account EUROBANK GR
IBAN:GR8802600340000760101834714
second camp.
http://igg.me/at/helprefugeesgreece/x/11951187

Transport – to transfer volunteers & food to the camps to deliver food; to help ferry children & disabled from arrival points to the bus stop 5. Interpreting costs 6. Cleaning materials because the camps are filthyWhen will supporters see the difference?Immediately. As soon as the crowdfunding date expires, I will go to Lesvos and work with the existing grassroots organisations to deliver the funds.we created also a bank account EUROBANK GRIBAN:GR8802600340000760101834714second camp.http://igg.me/at/helprefugeesgreece/x/11951187

story:
Short Summary

Proyecto Bembe (Project "Bembe") is an Afro-Latino percussion-based performing arts after-school program for youth in grades 1-8 on Milwaukee’s South Side where over 90% of the community is of Latino decent. Through the use of applied ethnomusicology techniques within a Positive Youth Development model, Proyecto Bembe will promote musical and performance skills that are structured to supplement schools' academic curriculum in an inclusive environment for children of all abilities, including those with special needs, hyperactivity and ADHD diagnoses. With a unique parental involvement component, Proyecto Bembe also builds youth leadership, assertive communication and collaboration skills, and self-respect and cultural identity exploration through Latino musical culture.

100% of your donation is tax-deductible thanks to the fiscal and program support of Milwaukee Public Theatre.

$2,500 will provide  

  •  22 one-hour workshops for youth grades 1-8 enrolled in the Project, with the teaching artist earning a living wage. Grades 1-3 will enjoy "exploration" of dance, capoeira and drumming. Grades 4-8 will enjoy a commitment-based practice and performance group. 
  • 3 one-hour parent-only workshops for parents of students in the Project to enjoy, learn, release stress, and further connect with the school community
  • Drop-in "Drum It Out!" sessions for students struggling with containing high energy levels throughout the academic school day. 
  • 2 community performances with professional Latino guest artist cameos.
  • 3 field trip visits to Milwaukee's arts-based high school, University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee Peck School of the Arts, and a local radio station with recording capabilities.
If we exceed our goal of $2,500 and can reach $3,500, we can provide the foundation for a new music therapy program, with oversight by Neurologic Music Therapist, Erica Flores, NMT, to include small group sessions, parent therapy sessions, and IEP support, all within an enriching, supportive and motivating environment. 
100% of your donation is tax-deductible thanks to the fiscal and program support of Milwaukee Public Theatre.
Perks for your support
By supporting this Project, you'll receive
  • Web and social media shout outs 
  • Proyecto Bembe video dedication 
  • Proyecto Bembe postcard artwork via postal mail 
  • Proyecto Bembe T-shirts and guayaberas
  • An invitation to a Proyecto Bembe performance
  • A plaque dedication on one of Proyecto Bembe's conga or bongo drums.

The Impact

With 70% of our community's student body enrolled in after-school care, high quality after-school activities are critical. With 80% of our students qualifying for free or reduced lunch, often with single parents or 2-parent families working 1 or more jobs each, the high quality of Proyecto Bembe arts instruction and the convenient schedule/location for school families make it an exceptional opportunity for arts enrichment.
The impact of Proyecto Bembe will be especially strong within the special needs student body that often struggles in the academic environment, especially those children with hyperactivity, ADHD and distractibility. Hand drumming and dancing release high amounts of physical, mental and creative energy, and connect children to rhythm in ways that calm and provide order. In most cases, these drumming activities highlight the cognitive and physical GIFTS of children with hyperactivity/ADHD - a powerful confidence-builder after a school day of being redirected or asked to calm down.

There is an even greater social impact resulting from this program as well. Milwaukee is America's most racially-segregated city and, based upon the educational gap, incarceration rates and other social factors, in 2013 Milwaukee was sited by multiple sources as statistically the "worst city in America" to grow up as a Black child.  Growing up in a "black or white" city, there are few opportunities for children of all backgrounds, especially Latino, to form open and positive associations with the African cultural roots of US-American/Latin American/Latino culture - especially the music we all love. Moreover, there are few structured opportunities to explore this in a school-based setting that connects the practicing of the arts to history, foreign language, social studies and art history through ethnomusicology. 

CO-FOUNDERS

Proyecto Bembe Co-Founding Director, Johanna De Los Santos (BA-University of Wisconsin, Latin American Studies, MA-New York University-Latin American and Caribbean Studies) has dedicated over 20 years of professional work, community volunteerism and academic study toward using the integration of Latino/Latin American/Caribbean and general creative arts & media to advance inside-out personal and community development. Since 2007, she has been Executive Director of the New York City-based youth development non-profit, Art Start, that uses the creative arts to facilitate personal development with homeless youth and those at risk of incarceration, ages 5-21. A Milwaukee-native, she is also a South Side parent with two children enrolled as students in the community. 

Co-Founding Director and Master Latin Percussionist, Cecilio Negron, Jr. has been performing & providing ethnomusicology-based music education to Milwaukee youth for over 15 years, both through the Wisconsin Conservatory of Music as well as Milwaukee Public Theatre. Hailing from a family of multiple generations of drummers and artists, Cecilio connects his students to the rich lineage of world drumming, oral history and Latin musicianship in Milwaukee.

Additional Support

For our Pilot Year, Proyecto Bembe is empowered by the fiscal sponsorship and program planning support of the Milwaukee Public Theatre, the University of Wisconsin's Center for Latin American and Caribbean Studies and UWM's Department of Africology. We require an individually-funded pilot session to get the project going as well as build and measure outcomes so that we can fundraise from grant-giving institutions for year two.


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Volunteer your time as a workshop volunteer
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to encourage other education, music, Latino culture enthusiasts to support this campaign!

100% of your donation is tax-deductible thanks to the fiscal and program support of Milwaukee Public Theatre.

story:
Echoing Green Direct Impact Program

Please check out the video above to learn more about the Echoing Green Direct Impact program, which is a board leadership program I have been accepted into, and why I feel it is such an important experience.  While I have gotten a scholarship for part of the program cost, and have donated myself, I'm crowdfunding the remaining $5000.00 of the program cost.  Echoing Green truly is a great organization and I'm excited about my continued involvement with their social entrepreneurs. No amount is too little and your support is appreciated!!!

story:
Our Rock N' Roll Story

 Cutting edge music & recording instruction/ artist development, creating artists for the future. Every youth should have the chance to follow their musical dreams, be it rockstar, producer, manager, promoter, marketing, entertainment lawyer, record label owner and any of the many other facets in the music business, receiving mentorship within artist development along the way. We grow together while create the soundtrack to your life through music.
Features/ Awards:
House Of Blues / Action For The Arts Award Winner 2013
FORD Motor Co. "Built Tough Good Works" National Campaign Feature 2015
Thumbtack "Best of" 2015
KEGL 97.1FM
CultureMap Dallas
Dallas Observer
Whiterock Lake Weekly
CBS 11
Neiman Marcus 2014 Catalogue
PopVulture Magazine
Shock Value Magazine

What We Need & What You Get

The "TSF Rock Scholarship" helps give those who don't have the financial oppurtunities a chance to chase their dreams, develop their inner artist and grow with a musical mentor in the musical and loving community that is The Sound Foundation family, along with helping boost the visibility of our artists through live performance ventures, CD's, digital distribution (iTunes,amazon), social media marketing and anything needed to reach the goal of each aspiring artist. Every Donation impacts an artists live in one way, shape or form.

Risks & Challenges

 With music being taken out of school curriculum on annual basis and programs being downsized. Unlike sports or larger school programs, many aspiring artists do not even have the chance to attempt to chase their dream until the collegiate level, missing out on the opportunity to make the most of their formative years and reall finding who they are, along with being a part of a musical mentorship program and community of musical peers. The Biggest challenge is creating the awareness and every donation helps TSF outreach.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Spread the word to your network via social media, email, etc
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word on the awareness

Thank you! We could not be Us without yoU \m/

story:
Why Your Support Now? #ChancetoReset

We’ve garnered incredible support from government, community partners, individuals, and foundations to open our Bay Area campus. And we have never been more excited about the potential of the organization to transform criminal justice. However, we urgently need to secure funding so that we can access our next round of grants from foundations and government. By providing your support now, we can continue to serve our current cohort of eight students and empower them with the #ChancetoReset. By the end of year, we will enroll ten new students. And you will put us in a position to change the way justice is delivered in America.

A "New Day" for Reset Students

Over 2.3 million Americans are incarcerated in the US, most for nonviolent offenses. 68% of those who leave prison will be rearrested within three years. The young men we serve have faced systemic barriers to success all throughout their lives—under-resourced schools, daily risks of violence, and limited access to the opportunities young people deserve.

A young man in our program lives and learns at our campus instead of serving time in a dehumanizing prison environment. Students come to us from the courts: promising candidates are accepted into Reset based on a personal application and with a judge’s consent. Students live onsite for a minimum of 1 year, followed by at least 1 year of non-residential transition support. Students in our program:

  • Engage in a personalized, rigorous EDUCATION, working towards either a high school diploma or college degree.
  • Master PROFESSIONAL SKILLS through on-site work, skills training, internships and job placement.
  • Develop a HEALTHY WELL-BEING and critical life skills (parenting, violence prevention) through physical & mental health supports, leadership and life skills training.

Our residential education program integrates best practices from education, workforce, youth development, health, and justice. By creating an environment where these young men can thrive, we equip our students to break free of the vicious cycle created by institutionalized mass incarceration.

Meet Darahn

“I see this as a stepping stool, as well as a blessing.”

Darahn was facing a 3-5 year prison sentence when he was instead accepted into Reset. He came to us with resolve: to figure out how to build a better life for himself.

“My goals for the future are to start working to build my own foundation. I’m trying to start a family, be financially stable, and be more wise—and not let circumstances dictate my behavior.”

Over the last 6 months at Reset, Darahn has spent his time studying hard toward his AA degree and coaching little league baseball. He has emerged as a natural leader for new students:

“The fact that it’s a new program—we are helping to shape it…I’m becoming even more of a leader from being in the program. I try to lead by example.”

Reset’s Impact

A first-of-its-kind model, the Bay Area campus is the first in a network that will reimagine the justice system for young adults in the US. We are proving the potential of our model and aim to grow to three more regions in the next five years.

Our current cohort consists of eight young men who are turning their lives around. With your support, we can enroll 45 more students in the next three years.

Reset students leave our program will the skills and mindset to lead healthy, successful lives. Our program significantly reduces students’ risk of recidivism, or getting another conviction. And we aim for these additional student outcomes:

  • All students demonstrate two years of academic growth for every one year enrolled
  • All graduates leave with stable housing
  • All graduates leave with an education or employment option in hand

Through our students’ success, Reset will demonstrate an impactful public-private partnership for justice that can then be scaled across California and the US. This will not only result in significant cost savings to government (estimated 7:1 return on investment for each Reset graduate) but will change the way justice is delivered in America.

Where We're Going with Your Support

Your support now helps us make the first big steps in breaking the cycle of poverty, incarceration, and injustice in America. It will help our current cohort of eight to graduate and allow us to enroll 45 more students in the next three years. And this support this will put us into a position to open new Reset campuses and help even more young men get on the path to success.

story:
What is a MakerSpace?

Simply put: a Makerspace is a place where students can develop their own interests, be creative, explore new ideas and figure out how to turn those ideas into reality. Next year at the TA Library teen makers will move in to one of our library offices, use the 3-D printer in part of the computer lab, and be able to set up shop using portable kits at any of our tables. In the coming year we are going lay the foundation for a Makerspace that will be responsive to student and teacher interests and needs-- but we need your help.

 

Why TA Library?

Libraries have always been about providing people with the resources they need to learn. They're also about sharing resources in a way that is efficient and cost-effective to communities. While the shop and art room already provide space for student making, the addition of resources in the library will mean that both students and teachers can easily access tools, materials and support during and after school. We will be building a collection that includes both high-tech and low-tech tools for making things and spans both traditional and cutting edge methods.

 

Our Fundraising Goals

With the funds we raise we will be purchasing resources that make it easier to bring hands-on projects into the classroom as well as tools and materials that students can use to pursue personal projects and learn new skills. Here's some of what is on our shopping list:

  • filament for our 3d printer so students can print the designs they create ($250)
  • electronic components, two soldering irons  and lead-free solder ($175)
  • a MakeyMakey ($50)
  • LittleBits Synth Kit ($159) and Smart Home kit ($249)
  • Adobe Creative Cloud software for graphic design, illustration, audio editing and photo editing to be installed on two computers. ($300/computer each year=$600)

    The grand total for everything listed? $1,483. If we fall short of our goal-- or exceed it-- all funds raised will be used to provide materials for students to work with.
     

Our Vision for Student Learning

We will be kicking off next year with the student-led construction of our new 3-D printer from a kit. This, and other Makerspace projects will be visible to the entire school. It's our goal to foster the spread of excitement about creating throughout the student body by helping students succeed in their projects so that other students see that they can succeed, too. We want our students to be empowered as active creators and makers rather than just passive consumers. We will know we are reaching our goals when students choose to use their free time to learn, tinker and create.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially there are still plenty of ways you can help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. 
  • Use the share tools to spread news about the TA Library Makerspace online.
  • Spend the summer gathering items to donate to our material drive in the Fall. We will be soliciting used tools, art supplies, legos and more.

story:
Spanish Citizenship for Sephardim

(Texto en Español Abajo)  

When the Sephardim (Spanish Jews) were expelled from Spain in 1492, they took with them the keys to their homes in the hope of one day returning. Over 500 years later, a law has been passed reinstating Spanish Citizenship to the descendants of those expelled, allowing that dream of returning to finally come true.

La Kaza Muestra has been created to act as that key, facilitating projects between Spain and the Sephardic Diaspora with the goal of returning the centre of Sephardic Culture back to Spain with the hope of recreating the model of coexistence that allowed the three great religions to thrive during centuries. 

Citizenship project:  For the next three years, all those descendants of Jews expelled in 1492 have the right to reclaim their Spanish Citizenship. Our main objective is to allow as many Sephardim as possible to recover their Spanish Citizenship by streamlining processes and reaching out to all who can benefit, regardless of their current religious affiliation or social status. 

I have just returned from obtaining my Notary Act, which is the previous step to getting the passport. I therefore have gone through the whole process and know the cost and how it needs to get done. Proof of this is that the process began on November 5th and less than two months later, the process has been completed, with no lawyers and no external actors. 

In order to facilitate this process and help as many Sephardim as possible, we need your help in getting started. Here's a breakdown of our current and projected expenses:

Legal setup costs € 4.000 (Current)

IT (computers, printer, etc.) €3.000 (1.400€ Current)

3 months salaries &Social charges  (1 Sr. 2 Jr. 3@5.000) 15.000€ (projected)

Operating Expenses 8.000€ (4.000€ Current)

Total: 30.000€ (13.400 Current)

These costs are calculated for the first three months of operation. Seeing the great demand from the interested parties, our project should be self-sustaining from then onwards

We are the Key  in allowing us Sephardim, as we say in Djudeo Espanyol, "Aboltar a La Kaza Muestra" To come back to our home, SEFARAD-SPAIN. Your support is greatly appreciated.


Munchas Grasyas , Kaminos de leche i miel 

(Thank you, paths of honey and milk, traditional Sephardic salutation)



Ciudadanía Española para Sefardíes 

Cuando los sefardíes (Judios españoles) fueron expulsados ​​de España en 1492, se llevaron con ellos las llaves de sus casas con la esperanza de algún día regresar . Más de 500 años después, una ley se ha aprobado que restablece la ciudadanía española a los descendientes de los expulsados, lo que permite que el sueño de volver a finalmente se haga realidad.

La Kaza Muestra ha sido creada para actuar como la llave para ese retorno, facilitando proyectos entre España y la diáspora sefardí con el objetivo de retornar el centro de la Cultura Sefardí de vuelta a España con la esperanza de recrear el modelo de convivencia que permitía a las tres grandes religiones prosperar durante siglos.

Proyecto Ciudadanía: Por los próximos tres años, todos los descendientes de Judíos expulsados ​​en 1492 tienen derecho a reclamar su ciudadanía española. Nuestro principal objetivo es permitir que el mayor número sefardíes recuperar su ciudadanía española mediante la racionalización de los procesos y llegar a todos los que puedan beneficiarse, independientemente de su afiliación religiosa actual o condición social.

Acabo de regresar de la obtención de mi Acta de Notoriedad que es el paso previo para conseguir el pasaporte. Yo por lo tanto, he pasado por todo el proceso y conozco tanto el coste del mismo, como su metodología. Prueba de ello es que el proceso se inició el 5 de noviembre, y  menos de dos meses después, este se ha completado, sin abogados y ni actores externos.

Con el fin de facilitar este proceso y ayudar a tantos sefardíes como sea posible, necesitamos su ayuda para empezar. He aquí un desglose de los gastos actuales y proyectados:

Gastos legales de Establecimiento € 4.000 (Actual)

Informática  (ordenadores, impresoras, etc.) € 3.000 (1.400 € actuales)

3 meses de sueldos y cargas sociales (1 Senior 2 Jr. 3@5.000) 15.000 € (proyectado)

Gastos Operativos 8.000 € (4.000 € actuales)

Total: 30.000 € (13.400 actuales)

Estos costos se calculan para los tres primeros meses de funcionamiento. Al ver la gran demanda por parte de las partes interesadas, nuestro proyecto debe ser autosuficiente a partir de entonces

Somos la clave en lo que nos permite sefardíes, como decimos en Djudeo Espanyol, "Aboltar a La Kaza Muestra" Para volver a nuestro hogar, SEFARAD-ESPAÑA.  Muchas gracias por su apoyo y difusión
story_txt:
Spanish Citizenship for Sephardim
(Texto en Español Abajo)  
When the Sephardim (Spanish Jews) were expelled from Spain in 1492, they took with them the keys to their homes in the hope of one day returning. Over 500 years later, a law has been passed reinstating Spanish Citizenship to the descendants of those expelled, allowing that dream of returning to finally come true.
La Kaza Muestra has been created to act as that key, facilitating projects between Spain and the Sephardic Diaspora with the goal of returning the centre of Sephardic Culture back to Spain with the hope of recreating the model of coexistence that allowed the three great religions to thrive during centuries. 
Citizenship project:  For the next three years, all those descendants of Jews expelled in 1492 have the right to reclaim their Spanish Citizenship. Our main objective is to allow as many Sephardim as possible to recover their Spanish Citizenship by streamlining processes and reaching out to all who can benefit, regardless of their current religious affiliation or social status. 
I have just returned from obtaining my Notary Act, which is the previous step to getting the passport. I therefore have gone through the whole process and know the cost and how it needs to get done. Proof of this is that the process began on November 5th and less than two months later, the process has been completed, with no lawyers and no external actors. 
In order to facilitate this process and help as many Sephardim as possible, we need your help in getting started. Here's a breakdown of our current and projected expenses:
Legal setup costs € 4.000 (Current)
IT (computers, printer, etc.) €3.000 (1.400€ Current)
3 months salaries &Social charges  (1 Sr. 2 Jr. 3@5.000) 15.000€ (projected)
Operating Expenses 8.000€ (4.000€ Current)
Total: 30.000€ (13.400 Current)
These costs are calculated for the first three months of operation. Seeing the great demand from the interested parties, our project should be self-sustaining from then onwards
We are the Key  in allowing us Sephardim, as we say in Djudeo Espanyol, "Aboltar a La Kaza Muestra" To come back to our home, SEFARAD-SPAIN. Your support is greatly appreciated.

Munchas Grasyas , Kaminos de leche i miel 
(Thank you, paths of honey and milk, traditional Sephardic salutation)

story:
Watch the video above and download English version


Index 

  1. Bijzondere droom (Probleem & Oplossing)
  2. Hoe kan jij helpen
  3. Doelstelling, plan en begroting
  4. De toekomst en ambassadeur Alan Murphy
  5. Sponsoring
  6. Facts & Figures
  7. Mensen achter dit project
  8. Veelgestelde vragen


1.  Bijzondere droom wordt gerealiseerd


Probleem: Tiko is OP DIT MOMENT nog afhankelijk van donaties.

Tiko heeft vanuit het NIETS heel veel bereikt, MAAR is nog steeds voor 85% afhankelijk van donaties. Een essentieel doel van de Tiko gemeenschap is ondernemerschap stimuleren en inkomsten proberen te werven uit toerisme.

 Helaas kunnen de eigen leveranciers en het eigen personeel niet geheel betaald worden voor hun diensten en dus is er ook geen inkomen voor de te onderhouden gezinnen. 

Deze gezinnen hebben minimaal 3,5 euro per dag nodig en dat lukt op dit moment helaas nog niet! Doordat er onvoldoende toegang is tot een betaalbare lening wordt hun droom naar zelfredzaamheid geblokkeerd! 


Oplossing: een nieuwe Lodge 

Door verscheidende gebouwen en faciliteiten binnen het Tiko terrein aan te passen, kunnen er meer toeristen en klanten van de lokale bevolking terecht voor een verblijf in de Tiko Lodge. Dit is belangrijke stap om een gemeenschap te creëren die onafhankelijk is van Donaties. 

Op die manier stimuleert Tiko ondernemerschap…en dat is de weg naar zelfredzaamheid!

De zes gebouwen en faciliteiten die aangepast dienen te worden, noemt men te samen: De nieuwe Lodge. 

De nieuwe Lodge


2.  Hoe kun jij helpen, het verschil te maken?


Op de volgende vier manieren kun je helpen:

I.   Door te doneren, zoek deze roze knop rechts bovenin

Vul daarboven je bedrag in en druk op de knop, de rest volgt vanzelf.

II.  Door een donatie te doen waar een "Perk" tegen over staat,

Perks zijn donaties waar iets tegenover staat. Meer details weten? KLIK op de tegenprestaties rechts onder de roze knop!

III.  Door je mening achter te laten.

        Laat Tiko weten wat jij zou willen bezoeken in Zambia?

IV.  Door deze campagne op Facebook, Twitter, Google+ te delen, maak je kans op een Reischeque van 1.000,- euro, vrij te besteden! Zie in de video hieronder hoe: 


Meerdere combinaties van de vier punten is naar eigen keuze mogelijk!

DONATIES ZIJN AFTREKBAAR VOOR NEDERLANDSE DONATEURS 

(ANBI-STATUS TFN)

NB; Als het doneren niet lukt, bekijk dan even de instructievideo's op: http://www.tikondanefoundation.nl 


3.   Doelstelling, plan en begroting


Doelstelling

Het doel is om binnen 5 jaar de nieuwe Lodge financieel onafhankelijk te laten functioneren als onderneming, door middel van zelfstandig lokaal management. Voor de aanpassingen van de gebouwen en het stimuleren van ondernemerschap door microkredieten is eenmalig €100.000,- nodig. 

Dit bedrag zal beheerd worden via een lokaal Trust fonds, dat gekoppeld is aan Tiko. De Trust zorgt ervoor dat alleen financieel gezonde initiatieven zullen worden gefinancierd vanuit dit fonds. Op deze manier zal er er een betaalbare geldstroom ontstaan voor en door ondernemers. 


Plan, Stimuleren van ondernemerschap 

De te verstrekken leningen vanuit het Trust fonds hebben geen winst oogmerk en hebben een sociaal karakter. Dit houdt in dat Tiko initiatiefnemers goedkoper geld kunnen lenen dan bij de gebruikelijke partijen in Zambia, Dit is noodzakelijk voor stimuleren en ontwikkelen van ondernemerschap.

Zodra de Lodge winst boekt, na aftrek van alle kosten, zal deze winst ten goede komen aan het ontwikkelingswerk binnen Tiko.


Waarom is juist NU het beste moment om ondernemerschap te stimuleren?

  • het ondernemersklimaat is nog nooit zo gunstig geweest. De verwachting is dat het aantal toeristen in 2020 ten opzichte van 2015 vier maal zo groot gaat worden. Dit kan de bezetting van de Lodge enorm vergroten. Zambia kent al jaren een politiek stabiel klimaat. Daarnaast investeert de overheid in toerisme.
  • Tiko moet een bijzonder onderdeel kunnen zijn voor de toerist van een unieke reis in Zambia.
  • de ondernemende studenten die nu van de Tiko Academy af komen, kunnen op dit moment hun kennis niet omzetten in kunde en zullen daarom vertrekken!
  • de groei van Tiko is niet houdbaar op basis van donaties en daarom is het NOODZAKELIJK om Tiko onafhankelijk te krijgen.
  • het gehele project kan nu vijf jaar lang ter plaatse begeleid worden.


De Begroting


De begroting en het 5 jaren plan zien er op hoofdlijnen als volgt uit:

wanneer de nieuwe Lodge gerealiseerd is, zal er bij een jaarlijkse kamer bezetting van 48% een “break even*” punt bereikt worden. 

*break even = als kosten gelijk zijn aan de baten

Indien er jaarlijks een kamerbezetting is van 60%, zal men in staat zijn om zelf investeringen en aflossingen af te handelen. 

Indien de bezetting boven de 60% stijgt, zal dit ten gunste komen van de Tiko community. Mocht de begroting te krap blijken, dan zal de Lodge minder snel onafhankelijk zijn en daarmee dus ook de Tiko community in zijn algemeen. 

Het geld wat eventueel over zal blijven, zal worden ingezet voor:

1.   aantrekkelijke leningen voor andere Tiko ondernemers
2.   investering in scholing, vakonderwijs en armoede bestrijdingsprogramma’s
3.   het faciliteren van overnachtingen in de omliggende dorpen.   

Meer weten over doelstelling het plan of de begroting die overeengekomen is met Tiko! Lees dan de management samenvatting! van het businessplan.


4. De toekomst en ambassadeur Allan Murphy  


Wordt Tiko ZELFREDZAAM?


Zou het niet geweldig zijn als dit OVER 5 jaar in de kranten staat:

“Tiko is een bijzondere gemeenschap in Zambia die in staat is om je de echte Afrikaanse cultuur te laten ervaren zoals je die nergens anders tegenkomt. 

Ze weten vele reizigers en toeristen te verbazen, zodanig dat ze zich als ware ambassadeurs ontpoppen. 

Deze gemeenschap is nu 100% ONAFHANKELIJK van donaties! Ze hebben geen hulp van buitenaf meer nodig, ze zijn volledig zelfredzaam! Vijf jaar geleden werd dit mogelijk gemaakt door DEZE CROWDFUNDING CAMPAGNE: het bleek een succesformule!”  


ZORG JIJ DAT DIT IN DE KRANT KOMT?

STEL dat dit bericht ECHT over vijf jaar in de krant staat. Zou dat niet fantastisch zijn? Willen we dat niet allemaal? ZELF-redzaam zijn in onze eigen leefomgeving? 

Tiko kan niet zonder jouw hulp. KLIK op de Perks aan de rechterkant om Tiko te helpen. Je krijgt er zelfs wat voor terug! 

Je kunt zelfs een reis naar Zambia winnen. Verder kun je Tiko ook helpen door je mening achter te laten! Ook dat helpt!


Alan Murphy van Lonely Planet over Tiko


De Australische Alan Murphy, coördinerend redacteur van de Lonely Planet (reisgids Zuidelijk Afrika) beschrijft kernachtig en treffend waarom de toerist naar Tiko moet komen: 

“Wat mij heeft bewogen is de armoede en moeilijke voorwaarden waaronder mensen leven. Tiko verzorgt kritische diensten voor deze arme gemeenschap. Tiko geeft toeristen de kans om met de Zambiaanse bevolking te leren kennen op een manier, die op andere toeristische locaties niet mogelijk is. 

Bezoekers krijgen een echte glimp van culturele tradities en kunnen deelnemen aan het dagelijks leven van de meest vriendelijk denkbare mensen. Tiko wordt waarschijnlijk nooit een 3-sterren hotel. Maar het is een geweldige springplank voor het verkennen van Zambia en het aangaan van ontmoetingen met de lokale gemeenschap. 

De Nederlandse Tiko Foundation investeert met de actie in de zelfredzaamheid van Tiko en ik beveel deze campagne van harte bij je aan om hun poging -voor het verbeteren van de accommodaties- te ondersteunen. "Please give generously. I know I will.”

November 2015, Alan Murphy

Dit verhaal omschrijft perfect wat Tiko te bieden heeft en dit is uniek in Zambia!


5. Sponsoring


Wanneer organisaties aan dit project doneren, zullen zij daar zelf ook baat bij hebben omdat zij er sponsoring voor terugkrijgen. Zorg dus dat jouw Logo hier ook komt te staan! Dan profiteer je al tijdens deze crowdfunding campagene van de aandacht! We verwachten meer dan 40.000 mensen met deze crowdfunding campagne te bereiken. Zie voor meer informatie; Perk 7. Bedrijfssponsoring.


6. Facts & Figures 

1

16 jaar geleden is Elke Kroeger-Radcliffe vanuit het niets gestart met het bestrijden van analfabetisme voor volwassenen en kreeg twee hectare grond toegewezen.

2

Tiko heeft in 16 jaar meer dan 12.000 mensen, waaronder weeskinderen en analfabeten geholpen aan voedsel en verbeterde gezondheid en ontwikkeling. 

3

Tiko ontsluit (basis/vak) onderwijs voor degene die hier geen toegang toe hebben (er bestaat geen leerplicht in Zambia).Tiko faciliteert:
-   een peuterspeelzaal.
-   basisonderwijs voor ruim 450 kinderen (wees)kinderen), 
-   vakonderwijs (denk aan: timmerwerkplaats, rietvlechterij, weverij, naaiatelier, productie plantaardige olie, administratie, ect.)
-  sinds kort ook de Tiko Academy (voortgezet onderwijs) met de nadruk op betere landbouw technieken. 

Verder is er ook een ‘Interns' programma, waarbij jonge mensen met een middelbare school diploma -maar met geen hoop op voortgezet onderwijs- werken in de verschillende Tiko afdelingen en proberen tegelijkertijd hun kansen op de arbeidsmarkt te verbeteren.

4

Tiko bestrijdt met een zeer effectief programma de armoede in de omliggende dorpen. In 26 dorpen werkt men met het programma “19 steps out of poverty”. Door middel van dit programma wordt geprobeerd de zelfredzaamheid van de plaatselijke bevolking te stimuleren.

5

De gezondheidszorg in de omgeving verbetert door een gezondheidsadviseur van Tiko.

6

Tiko is een veilig thuis voor inmiddels 85 werkzame mensen.

7

Elke Kroeger-Radcliffe wil dat de plaatselijke bevolking op termijn zelfstandig bestuur moet kunnen voeren. Hierbij is het van belang dat men ook financieel loskomt van fondsen en sponsoring, zodat onafhankelijk bestuur daadwerkelijk mogelijk is.

8

Zambia kent al jaren een politiek stabiel klimaat. De overheid investeert in toerisme.

9

Er zijn meerdere kleine boeren die duurzaam voedsel verbouwen en toeleveren

10

In de lokale taal betekent Tiko ‘lief zijn voor elkaar’. De gasten beleven niet alleen een Lodge, maar ervaren nauwe contacten met de lokale bevolking.

11

De verwachting is dat het aantal toeristen in 2020 ten opzichte van 2015 verviervoudigd, dit kan de bezetting van de Lodge enorm vergroten.

7. Mensen achter dit project


Van links naar rechts én van boven naar beneden: Elke Kroeger-Radcliffe, Peter Kok, Catherine Munyansho, Maria Floré, Anne Steenhauer, Annie Crombag, Harro Zeelenberg, Lorraine van Dam en Frans van der Grinten.


8. Veel gestelde vragen


1. Zijn de donaties aftrekbaar van de belasting? 

Sinds 1 januari 2008,  wordt  Tikondane Community Support Foundation, of Stichting Tiko door de Nederlandse Belastingdienst gekenmerkt als een Algemeen Nut Beogende Instelling. Dit ANBI nummer is: 8197.65.235 

Dit geeft bij opgave van de belasting recht op aftrek.


2. Ik heb geen Pay-pal of creditkaart, maar ik wil wel doneren, is dat mogelijk?

Ja dat is mogelijk, je kunt je donatie overmaken naar het bankrekeningnummer van de stichting Tiko. Geef in de omschrijving aan van welk Perk nummer je gebruik wilt maken en wij zorgen dat het in de campagne komt. Het rekening nummer is: 

NL71 ABNA O513694404

3. Is €50.000 jullie doel? 

Nee dit is NIET ons doel, we gaan voor de € 100.000 natuurlijk.

We willen zelfredzaamheid in de komende 5 jaar stimuleren. De nieuwe Lodge is begroot op €88.000,-. Indien de renovatie binnen de begroting blijft kan de rest gebruikt kan worden voor de microkredieten om ondernemerschap te stimuleren. Dan is er een grotere kans dat Tiko financieel zelfredzaam wordt. 

4. Houden jullie ons op de hoogte?

Ja, iedereen die doneert of een ieder die wenst op de hoogte gehouden te worden krijg maandelijks een nieuwsbrief!

5. Is de verzending van bijvoorbeeld de DVD inclusief verzendkosten in de Perk?

Nee niet bij alle. Het staat apart vermeld.

6. Hoeveel geld gaat er uiteindelijk van het bedrag naar het trustfonds?

Het is nog niet helemaal zeker hoeveel dit precies zal zijn. De crowdfundings kosten zullen verrekent worden met het uiteindelijk verworven bedrag en alles wat daarna overblijft gaat naar het trustfonds.  

7. Het doneren lukt niet

Als het doneren niet lukt, kijk dan even naar de aparte instructievideo's op http://www.tikondanefoundation.nl/  of stuur een mail naar tikondanefoundation@gmail.com 
8. Wat als het doelbedrag niet wordt behaald?
Als het doelbedrag niet geheel opgehaald wordt, zal Tiko niet alle gebouwen kunnen renoveren. Dit betekend, minder gezinnen een inkomen. Het financieel onafhankelijk worden zal langer duren en dat is ongunstig gezien de kansen die er nu zijn!

Op deze manier zal er er een betaalbare geldstroom ontstaan voor en door ondernemers. Plan, Stimuleren van ondernemerschap De te verstrekken leningen vanuit het Trust fonds hebben geen winst oogmerk en hebben een sociaal karakter. Dit houdt in dat Tiko initiatiefnemers goedkoper geld kunnen lenen dan bij de gebruikelijke partijen in Zambia, Dit is noodzakelijk voor stimuleren en ontwikkelen van ondernemerschap.Zodra de Lodge winst boekt, na aftrek van alle kosten, zal deze winst ten goede komen aan het ontwikkelingswerk binnen Tiko.Waarom is juist NU het beste moment om ondernemerschap te stimuleren?

het ondernemersklimaat is nog nooit zo gunstig geweest. De verwachting is dat het aantal toeristen in 2020 ten opzichte van 2015 vier maal zo groot gaat worden. Dit kan de bezetting van de Lodge enorm vergroten. Zambia kent al jaren een politiek stabiel klimaat. Daarnaast investeert de overheid in toerisme.

Tiko moet een bijzonder onderdeel kunnen zijn voor de toerist van een unieke reis in Zambia.
de ondernemende studenten die nu van de Tiko Academy af komen, kunnen op dit moment hun kennis niet omzetten in kunde en zullen daarom vertrekken!
de groei van Tiko is niet houdbaar op basis van donaties en daarom is het NOODZAKELIJK om Tiko onafhankelijk te krijgen.
het gehele project kan nu vijf jaar lang ter plaatse begeleid worden.
De BegrotingDe begroting en het 5 jaren plan zien er op hoofdlijnen als volgt uit:wanneer de nieuwe Lodge gerealiseerd is, zal er bij een jaarlijkse kamer bezetting van 48% een “break even*” punt bereikt worden. *break even = als kosten gelijk zijn aan de batenIndien er jaarlijks een kamerbezetting is van 60%, zal men in staat zijn om zelf investeringen en aflossingen af te handelen. Indien de bezetting boven de 60% stijgt, zal dit ten gunste komen van de Tiko community. Mocht de begroting te krap blijken, dan zal de Lodge minder snel onafhankelijk zijn en daarmee dus ook de Tiko community in zijn algemeen. Het geld wat eventueel over zal blijven, zal worden ingezet voor:1.   aantrekkelijke leningen voor andere Tiko ondernemers2.   investering in scholing, vakonderwijs en armoede bestrijdingsprogramma’s3.   het faciliteren van overnachtingen in de omliggende dorpen.   Meer weten over doelstelling het plan of de begroting die overeengekomen is met Tiko! Lees dan de management samenvatting! van het businessplan.4. De toekomst en ambassadeur Allan Murphy  Wordt Tiko ZELFREDZAAM?Zou het niet geweldig zijn als dit OVER 5 jaar in de kranten staat:“Tiko is een bijzondere gemeenschap in Zambia die in staat is om je de echte Afrikaanse cultuur te laten ervaren zoals je die nergens anders tegenkomt. Ze weten vele reizigers en toeristen te verbazen, zodanig dat ze zich als ware ambassadeurs ontpoppen. Deze gemeenschap is nu 100% ONAFHANKELIJK van donaties! Ze hebben geen hulp van buitenaf meer nodig, ze zijn volledig zelfredzaam! Vijf jaar geleden werd dit mogelijk gemaakt door DEZE CROWDFUNDING CAMPAGNE: het bleek een succesformule!”  ZORG JIJ DAT DIT IN DE KRANT KOMT?STEL dat dit bericht ECHT over vijf jaar in de krant staat. Zou dat niet fantastisch zijn? Willen we dat niet allemaal? ZELF-redzaam zijn in onze eigen leefomgeving? Tiko kan niet zonder jouw hulp. KLIK op de Perks aan de rechterkant om Tiko te helpen. Je krijgt er zelfs wat voor terug! Je kunt zelfs een reis naar Zambia winnen. Verder kun je Tiko ook helpen door je mening achter te laten! Ook dat helpt!Alan Murphy van Lonely Planet over Tiko


De Australische Alan Murphy, coördinerend redacteur van de Lonely Planet (reisgids Zuidelijk Afrika) beschrijft kernachtig en treffend waarom de toerist naar Tiko moet komen: “Wat mij heeft bewogen is de armoede en moeilijke voorwaarden waaronder mensen leven. Tiko verzorgt kritische diensten voor deze arme gemeenschap. Tiko geeft toeristen de kans om met de Zambiaanse bevolking te leren kennen op een manier, die op andere toeristische locaties niet mogelijk is. Bezoekers krijgen een echte glimp van culturele tradities en kunnen deelnemen aan het dagelijks leven van de meest vriendelijk denkbare mensen. Tiko wordt waarschijnlijk nooit een 3-sterren hotel. Maar het is een geweldige springplank voor het verkennen van Zambia en het aangaan van ontmoetingen met de lokale gemeenschap. De Nederlandse Tiko Foundation investeert met de actie in de zelfredzaamheid van Tiko en ik beveel deze campagne van harte bij je aan om hun poging -voor het verbeteren van de accommodaties- te ondersteunen. "Please give generously. I know I will.”November 2015, Alan MurphyDit verhaal omschrijft perfect wat Tiko te bieden heeft en dit is uniek in Zambia!5. SponsoringWanneer organisaties aan dit project doneren, zullen zij daar zelf ook baat bij hebben omdat zij er sponsoring voor terugkrijgen. Zorg dus dat jouw Logo hier ook komt te staan! Dan profiteer je al tijdens deze crowdfunding campagene van de aandacht! We verwachten meer dan 40.000 mensen met deze crowdfunding campagne te bereiken. Zie voor meer informatie; Perk 7. Bedrijfssponsoring.6. Facts & Figures 



1


16 jaar geleden is Elke Kroeger-Radcliffe vanuit het
  niets gestart met het bestrijden van analfabetisme voor volwassenen en kreeg
  twee hectare grond toegewezen.




2


Tiko heeft in 16 jaar meer dan 12.000 mensen, waaronder weeskinderen en analfabeten geholpen aan voedsel en verbeterde gezondheid en ontwikkeling. 




3


Tiko ontsluit (basis/vak) onderwijs voor degene die
  hier geen toegang toe hebben (er bestaat geen leerplicht in
  Zambia).Tiko faciliteert:
  -   een peuterspeelzaal.
  -   basisonderwijs voor ruim 450 kinderen (wees)kinderen), 
  -   vakonderwijs (denk aan: timmerwerkplaats, rietvlechterij, weverij,
  naaiatelier, productie plantaardige olie, administratie, ect.)
  -  sinds kort ook de Tiko Academy (voortgezet onderwijs) met de nadruk
  op betere landbouw technieken. 
Verder is er ook een ‘Interns' programma, waarbij jonge
  mensen met een middelbare school diploma -maar met geen hoop op voortgezet
  onderwijs- werken in de verschillende Tiko afdelingen en proberen
  tegelijkertijd hun kansen op de arbeidsmarkt te verbeteren.




4


Tiko bestrijdt met een zeer effectief programma de armoede in
  de omliggende dorpen. In 26 dorpen werkt men met het programma “19
  steps out of poverty”. Door middel van dit programma wordt geprobeerd de zelfredzaamheid van de
  plaatselijke bevolking te stimuleren.




5


De gezondheidszorg in de omgeving verbetert door een
  gezondheidsadviseur van Tiko.




6


Tiko is een veilig thuis voor inmiddels 85 werkzame
  mensen.




7


Elke Kroeger-Radcliffe wil dat de plaatselijke bevolking op termijn
  zelfstandig bestuur moet kunnen voeren. Hierbij is het van belang dat men ook
  financieel loskomt van fondsen en sponsoring, zodat onafhankelijk bestuur daadwerkelijk mogelijk is.




8


Zambia kent al jaren een politiek stabiel klimaat. De
  overheid investeert in toerisme.




9


Er zijn meerdere kleine boeren die duurzaam voedsel
  verbouwen en toeleveren




10


In de lokale taal betekent Tiko ‘lief zijn voor
  elkaar’. De gasten beleven niet alleen een Lodge, maar ervaren nauwe
  contacten met de lokale bevolking.




11


De verwachting is dat het aantal toeristen in 2020 ten
  opzichte van 2015 verviervoudigd, dit kan de bezetting van de Lodge
  enorm vergroten.



7. Mensen achter dit projectVan links naar rechts én van boven naar beneden: Elke Kroeger-Radcliffe, Peter Kok, Catherine Munyansho, Maria Floré, Anne Steenhauer, Annie Crombag, Harro Zeelenberg, Lorraine van Dam en Frans van der Grinten.
8. Veel gestelde vragen
1. Zijn de donaties aftrekbaar van de belasting? Sinds 1 januari 2008,  wordt  Tikondane Community Support Foundation, of Stichting Tiko door de Nederlandse Belastingdienst gekenmerkt als een Algemeen Nut Beogende Instelling. Dit ANBI nummer is: 8197.65.235 Dit geeft bij opgave van de belasting recht op aftrek.2. Ik heb geen Pay-pal of creditkaart, maar ik wil wel doneren, is dat mogelijk?Ja dat is mogelijk, je kunt je donatie overmaken naar het bankrekeningnummer van de stichting Tiko. Geef in de omschrijving aan van welk Perk nummer je gebruik wilt maken en wij zorgen dat het in de campagne komt. Het rekening nummer is: NL71 ABNA O5136944043. Is €50.000 jullie doel? Nee dit is NIET ons doel, we gaan voor de € 100.000 natuurlijk.We willen zelfredzaamheid in de komende 5 jaar stimuleren. De nieuwe Lodge is begroot op €88.000,-. Indien de renovatie binnen de begroting blijft kan de rest gebruikt kan worden voor de microkredieten om ondernemerschap te stimuleren. Dan is er een grotere kans dat Tiko financieel zelfredzaam wordt. 4. Houden jullie ons op de hoogte?Ja, iedereen die doneert of een ieder die wenst op de hoogte gehouden te worden krijg maandelijks een nieuwsbrief!5. Is de verzending van bijvoorbeeld de DVD inclusief verzendkosten in de Perk?Nee niet bij alle. Het staat apart vermeld.6. Hoeveel geld gaat er uiteindelijk van het bedrag naar het trustfonds?Het is nog niet helemaal zeker hoeveel dit precies zal zijn. De crowdfundings kosten zullen verrekent worden met het uiteindelijk verworven bedrag en alles wat daarna overblijft gaat naar het trustfonds.  7. Het doneren lukt niet
Als het doneren niet lukt, kijk dan even naar de aparte instructievideo's op http://www.tikondanefoundation.nl/  of stuur een mail naar tikondanefoundation@gmail.com 
8. Wat als het doelbedrag niet wordt behaald?
Als het doelbedrag niet geheel opgehaald wordt, zal Tiko niet alle gebouwen kunnen renoveren. Dit betekend, minder gezinnen een inkomen. Het financieel onafhankelijk worden zal langer duren en dat is ongunstig gezien de kansen die er nu zijn!

story:
Summary

Girl Museum is the world's first and only museum dedicated to celebrating girlhood.  We collect, preserve, and present the stories of girls around the world in the past and present -- telling history from a girl's point of view.  

Operating entirely on the Internet, all of our projects are accessible from anywhere at any time -- including exhibits, blogs, podcasts, educational guides, and more. 

We began in 2009, with a shoe-string budget and a team of volunteers.  Now, we need your help to continue and expand our operations over the next 5 years -- keeping our programs free and accessible for all, while expanding to include more girls, more stories, and more collaborations.

By giving girls a museum of their own, we give them a history and culture from which they can draw inspiration, innovation, and self-confidence.  We also empower them, showcasing to the world that girls have been important throughout history and are the key to our future.  Help us give girls their own museum and become part of an international community dedicated to giving girls the representation and rights they deserve.


What We Need & What You Get

Our main goal is to raise $35,000 to cover our expenses for the next 5 years, including:

  • Operational funds, including costs like website maintenance,
  • Producing virtual exhibits and pop-up events in physical spaces,
  • Producing our GirlSpeak podcast and educational programs, and
  • Hiring a contract web developer to help us improve our virtual space.
If we reach that goal, we hope to go even further -- raising funds to produce new types of projects, upgrade our hardware, and invest in our team.  We have so many dreams -- and you can help us achieve them.
You'll also get exclusive rewards for supporting us.  Our unique perks include digital art prints produced exclusively for our backers by female artists and the opportunity to personally contribute to backers-only projects featured in our museum. 


Risks & Challenges

Our biggest challenge is raising funds.  We've countered this risk by making our campaign flexible funding, meaning that we receive whatever we raise.  We're also reaching out to potential sponsors with like-minded missions, hoping to increase our funds raised and spread the word about our campaign.  So whether we meet our goal or not, your donations ensure that Girl Museum continues on -- providing a safe, inspiring place for girls to learn about their unique history and culture.

Our next challenge is reward delivery.  Nearly all of our rewards are digital-only.  Only rewards above the $100 level require shipping, and we've made sure that their costs are minimal in order to maximize your donations.  We also have a global team -- based in the U.S., U.K., and New Zealand among others -- that will ensure your rewards are shipped cost-effectively and on time.  

Our last challenge was raising above and beyond what we hope for -- and we have a plan for that, too.  We have several stretch goals, meaning that you can help expand our operations even further.  These goals include investing in our team, investing in our hardware, and funding projects that we'd love to make come to life, like our Girl Culture Digital Archive.  And the rewards match our hopes -- including exclusive backers-only invitations to a live Google Hangout with us or contributing to our first-ever YouTube productions.  We'll reveal more details when we get close to these goals.


Other Ways You Can Help

Don't worry if you can't contribute -- we understand that not everyone has the funds.  But you can still help us in many ways:

  • Spread the word on social media and via email to your friends, family, and colleagues through Indiegogo's share tools!
  • Participate in our audience-led projects, like Heirloom and Why I Game.
  • Subscribe to our podcast series, GirlSpeak.
  • Become a volunteer, intern, or partner with us.
  • Consider shopping through Amazon Smile -- and a portion of your purchase will be donated to us, at no cost to you!


Girls are the key to the planet’s future, and they deserve a museum as much as hammers, dog collars, celebrity underwear, and pizzas do.  Let's give them the history, culture, and representation they deserve.  

All are welcome at Girl Museum.

story:
OVERVIEW

Project Rhythm is a 501c3 non-profit organization committed to using music as an educational tool to empower underserved youth. We deploy music education programs to learning environments, which help students learn technical & collaboration skills.

Ultimately, Project Rhythm believes these outcomes will empower youth to make constructive choices and to become beneficial contributors in society.

We're raising $30,000 to continue operations and grow in 2016. The funds go towards supplying equipment and training teachers for schools in New York City.

Your generous donations combined with our incredible team of volunteers allows us to serve more youth that would otherwise be without music based education. 

Learn more at http://projectrhythm.org


STORY - MEET DANIELLE

Today, Project Rhythm has served thousands of students like Danielle, inspiring them to collaborate, create and develop life skills through music.

In 2009, Danielle J. was roaming the halls of Public School #753 in Brooklyn NY, instead of attending class.  She felt lost and could not face the idea of sitting in a classroom after tragically losing her best friend to an unfair death at a young age.  Government budget cuts made music-the medium which is by far the most influential in her life-virtually non-existent. For Danielle, expressing herself, overcoming her conflicts and growing seemed impossible to do on her own, especially without a vehicle that could drive her feelings towards healing and productivity.  But then, Project Rhythm came to her school for the first time. She was able to take part in a Project Rhythm program, where she collaboratively wrote, recorded, produced and performed songs. She was empowered to express herself, learn about the collaborative and creative process, stay out of trouble, and overcome the loss of her friend. She graduated from high school and gained the confidence and skills she needed to secure a job. Danielle continues her involvement in Project Rhythm programs and she continues to writes songs and grow through music.  She said to us, "Thank you for this opportunity, I got a job and I'm happy for myself."


Youth + Song Creation = Goodness

Through our programs, young people build valuable personal and professional skills like collaboration, conflict resolution, computer skills, engineering skills, performance, public speaking, and product creation. And all while they have fun doing it!


OUTCOMES

  • Improved collaborative leadership skills
    • Collaboration
    • Conflict Resolution
    • Leadership
    • Confidence
  • Improved cognitive development (executive functions)
    • Planning
    • Task Flexibility
    • Problem Solving
    • Execution
  • Increased career readiness skills
    • Technology / Computer Skills
    • Engineering / Troubleshooting
    • Production / Product Creation
    • Public Speaking

Ultimately, Project Rhythm believes these outcomes will empower youth to make positive life choices and to become beneficial contributors to society.


WHAT WE DO

We partner with community-based organizations to provide music education programs that encompass musicianship, song writing, collaboration, recording, production, and performance.  

Project Rhythm's programs are designed to provide youth with access to music education that they might not have otherwise.

story:
Do you want to know more about us?

Los Ricos started the project with great motivation to help to preserve the environment, we found that the companies generate heavy pollution, and we concluded that responsible entrepreneurship education is a viable solution. So we combined the technology that is our specialty, with social responsibility, to create an educational platform.

Run the project has been a bit complex, but we have come to develop the platform, and educational games developed nine prototypes, they are of practical training with mechanical games that appeal to children. Pedagogy is very important, we want students to be trained in the best way, also requires research and develop great work, we are starting from the largest to the smallest children.

We want that our platform will be free for children from public schools, so we created a social responsibility project and find sponsors to make this possible, because we have maintenance costs and we can't assume, and we have to being a social entrepreneurship but sustainable .

With your support we can build our dream and the dream of many leaders who change the world with their entrepreneurial ideas.

What we need and what you get

We need $ 20,000 to develop METRICO in 2015, we use for human talent to develop educational games and pedagogy.

For every time you become Rico with rewards, we are committed to benefit free the children when we finished and the solution is working .

The awards we have for you, are the most original, our identity as Los Ricos makes us different and unique!

If we achieve the goal in this campaign, we compromise to give free access to 8000 children, we can demonstrate with certificates issued by colleges.

If we fail in this goal crowdfunding campaign, we use the funds too for development and pedagogy, to the extent they reach us.

The Impact

We need responsible leaders to positively impact society, our platform trains the next generation of entrepreneurs !!

We can measure the impact of the platform, we focus on students, but we strengthen the development of the user evolution, the platform allows many people colaborate with information, advice ... is a directory of information for entrepreneurs, we want the student to continue using platform and keep us informed of their progress. You can also collaborate and be aware of all our progress.

Risks and Challenges

Our greatest asset is perseverance, we knew when we started that developing this solution was difficult, still we have not given up and we have managed to obtain several recognition for our work, Apps.co chose us as one of the best proposals and gave us advice, Fondo emprender chose us how a viable project and they supported funding for the first year, TIC Americas 2015 chose from over 2700 projects as one of the top 3 Eco-Challenge Colombia projects in environmental education us, we have benefited from mentoring programs Camera of Commerce of Bucaramanga.

Other ways you can help

We really thank you if you become rich sharing our campaign, and we explain how! so go ahead and Grow Rich with us!

We want to bring technology to children who have no resources to access, if you have a computer you can donate, we gladly received!

Follow Los Ricos in the Social Networks!

Infinite Thanks!!


Español:

Quieres saber más de nosotros?

Los Ricos comenzamos el proyecto con una gran motivación por ayudar a conservar el medio ambiente, encontramos que las empresas generan gran contaminación, y concluimos que la educación para el emprendimiento responsable es una solución viable. Así que combinamos la tecnología que es nuestra especialidad, con la Responsabilidad social, para crear una plataforma educativa.

Ejecutar el proyecto ha sido  un poco complejo, pero ya hemos llegado a desarrollar la plataforma, y los juegos educativos llevamos 9 prototipos, son de entrenamiento práctico con mecánicas de juegos que gustan a los niños. La pedagogía es muy importante, queremos que los estudiantes se entrenen de la mejor forma, igualmente requiere de investigación y gran trabajo desarrollarla, estamos comenzando desde los niños más grandes hasta los más pequeños.

Queremos que nuestra plataforma sea gratuita para los niños de colegios públicos, por ello creamos un proyecto de responsabilidad social y buscamos colaboradores para que esto sea posible, pues tenemos costos de mantenimiento que no podemos asumir y tenemos que ser un emprendimiento social pero sostenible.

Con su apoyo lograremos construir nuestro sueño y el sueño de muchos líderes que cambiarán el mundo con sus ideas emprendedoras.

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

Necesitamos $20.000 USD para desarrollar METRICO en el 2015, los destinaremos en talento humano para desarrollar los juegos educativos y la pedagogía.

Por cada vez que te haces Rico con las recompensas, nos comprometemos para que niños se beneficien gratuitamente cuando tengamos la solución terminada y funcionando.

Los reconocimientos que tenemos para ti, son de lo más original, nuestra identidad como Ricos nos hace diferentes y únicos!

Si logramos la meta en esta campaña, nos comprometemos a darle acceso gratuito a 8000 niños, lo demostraremos con certificados expedidos por los colegios.

Si no logramos la meta en esta campaña de crowdfunding, igualmente los fondos son para desarrollo y pedagogía, en la medida que nos alcancen.

El impacto

Necesitamos líderes responsables que impacten positivamente en la sociedad, nuestra plataforma entrena a la nueva generación de empresarios!! 

Podemos medir el impacto por la plataforma, nos enfocamos en los estudiantes, pero fortalecemos la evolución del usuario, la plataforma permite que muchas personas colaboren con información, asesoría... es un directorio de información para el emprendedor, buscamos que el estudiante continúe utilizando la plataforma y nos mantenga informados de su progreso.  Tú también puedes colaborar y estar enterado de todo nuestro progreso.

Riesgos y desafíos

Nuestra mayor cualidad es la perseverancia, cuando iniciamos sabíamos que desarrollar esta solución era difícil, aún así no hemos desistido y ya hemos logrado obtener varios reconocimiento por nuestro trabajo, Apps.co nos escogió como una de las mejores propuestas y nos brindó asesoría, Fondo emprender nos catalogó como un proyecto viable y nos apoyó financiamiento para el primer año, TIC Americas 2015 nos escogió entre más de 2700 proyectos como uno de los mejores 3 proyectos Eco-Reto Colombia en educación ambiental, hemos sido beneficiados con mentoría en programas de la Cámara de Comercio de Bucaramanga.

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Les agradecemos que se hagan Ricos compartiendo nuestra campaña, ya te explicamos cómo hacerlo! así que no esperes más y Hazte Rico con nosotros!

Queremos llevar la tecnología a niños que no tienen recursos para acceder, si tienes un computador que puedas donar, con gusto lo recibimos! 

Sígue a Los Ricos en las Redes Sociales!

Infinitas Gracias!!
story_txt:
Do you want to know more about us?
 
Los Ricos started the project with great motivation to help to preserve the environment, we found that the companies generate heavy pollution, and we concluded that responsible entrepreneurship education is a viable solution. So we combined the technology that is our specialty, with social responsibility, to create an educational platform.
Run the project has been a bit complex, but we have come to develop the platform, and educational games developed nine prototypes, they are of practical training with mechanical games that appeal to children. Pedagogy is very important, we want students to be trained in the best way, also requires research and develop great work, we are starting from the largest to the smallest children.
We want that our platform will be free for children from public schools, so we created a social responsibility project and find sponsors to make this possible, because we have maintenance costs and we can't assume, and we have to being a social entrepreneurship but sustainable .
With your support we can build our dream and the dream of many leaders who change the world with their entrepreneurial ideas.

What we need and what you get
We need $ 20,000 to develop METRICO in 2015, we use for human talent to develop educational games and pedagogy.
For every time you become Rico with rewards, we are committed to benefit free the children when we finished and the solution is working .
The awards we have for you, are the most original, our identity as Los Ricos makes us different and unique!
If we achieve the goal in this campaign, we compromise to give free access to 8000 children, we can demonstrate with certificates issued by colleges.
If we fail in this goal crowdfunding campaign, we use the funds too for development and pedagogy, to the extent they reach us.

The Impact
We need responsible leaders to positively impact society, our platform trains the next generation of entrepreneurs !!
We can measure the impact of the platform, we focus on students, but we strengthen the development of the user evolution, the platform allows many people colaborate with information, advice ... is a directory of information for entrepreneurs, we want the student to continue using platform and keep us informed of their progress. You can also collaborate and be aware of all our progress.

Risks and Challenges
Our greatest asset is perseverance, we knew when we started that developing this solution was difficult, still we have not given up and we have managed to obtain several recognition for our work, Apps.co chose us as one of the best proposals and gave us advice, Fondo emprender chose us how a viable project and they supported funding for the first year, TIC Americas 2015 chose from over 2700 projects as one of the top 3 Eco-Challenge Colombia projects in environmental education us, we have benefited from mentoring programs Camera of Commerce of Bucaramanga.

Other ways you can help
We really thank you if you become rich sharing our campaign, and we explain how! so go ahead and Grow Rich with us!
We want to bring technology to children who have no resources to access, if you have a computer you can donate, we gladly received!
Follow Los Ricos in the Social Networks!
Infinite Thanks!!

Español:
Quieres saber más de nosotros?Los Ricos comenzamos el proyecto con una gran motivación por ayudar a conservar el medio ambiente, encontramos que las empresas generan gran contaminación, y concluimos que la educación para el emprendimiento responsable es una solución viable. Así que combinamos la tecnología que es nuestra especialidad, con la Responsabilidad social, para crear una plataforma educativa.
Ejecutar el proyecto ha sido  un poco complejo, pero ya hemos llegado a desarrollar la plataforma, y los juegos educativos llevamos 9 prototipos, son de entrenamiento práctico con mecánicas de juegos que gustan a los niños. La pedagogía es muy importante, queremos que los estudiantes se entrenen de la mejor forma, igualmente requiere de investigación y gran trabajo desarrollarla, estamos comenzando desde los niños más grandes hasta los más pequeños.
Queremos que nuestra plataforma sea gratuita para los niños de colegios públicos, por ello creamos un proyecto de responsabilidad social y buscamos colaboradores para que esto sea posible, pues tenemos costos de mantenimiento que no podemos asumir y tenemos que ser un emprendimiento social pero sostenible.
Con su apoyo lograremos construir nuestro sueño y el sueño de muchos líderes que cambiarán el mundo con sus ideas emprendedoras.
Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes
 Necesitamos $20.000 USD para desarrollar METRICO en el 2015, los destinaremos en talento humano para desarrollar los juegos educativos y la pedagogía.
Por cada vez que te haces Rico con las recompensas, nos comprometemos para que niños se beneficien gratuitamente cuando tengamos la solución terminada y funcionando.
Los reconocimientos que tenemos para ti, son de lo más original, nuestra identidad como Ricos nos hace diferentes y únicos!
Si logramos la meta en esta campaña, nos comprometemos a darle acceso gratuito a 8000 niños, lo demostraremos con certificados expedidos por los colegios.
Si no logramos la meta en esta campaña de crowdfunding, igualmente los fondos son para desarrollo y pedagogía, en la medida que nos alcancen.
El impacto
 Necesitamos líderes responsables que impacten positivamente en la sociedad, nuestra plataforma entrena a la nueva generación de empresarios!! 
Podemos medir el impacto por la plataforma, nos enfocamos en los estudiantes, pero fortalecemos la evolución del usuario, la plataforma permite que muchas personas colaboren con información, asesoría... es un directorio de información para el emprendedor, buscamos que el estudiante continúe utilizando la plataforma y nos mantenga informados de su progreso.  Tú también puedes colaborar y estar enterado de todo nuestro progreso.
    Riesgos y desafíos Nuestra mayor cualidad es la perseverancia, cuando iniciamos sabíamos que desarrollar esta solución era difícil, aún así no hemos desistido y ya hemos logrado obtener varios reconocimiento por nuestro trabajo, Apps.co nos escogió como una de las mejores propuestas y nos brindó asesoría, Fondo emprender nos catalogó como un proyecto viable y nos apoyó financiamiento para el primer año, TIC Americas 2015 nos escogió entre más de 2700 proyectos como uno de los mejores 3 proyectos Eco-Reto Colombia en educación ambiental, hemos sido beneficiados con mentoría en programas de la Cámara de Comercio de Bucaramanga.
Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar
 Les agradecemos que se hagan Ricos compartiendo nuestra campaña, ya te explicamos cómo hacerlo! así que no esperes más y Hazte Rico con nosotros!
Queremos llevar la tecnología a niños que no tienen recursos para acceder, si tienes un computador que puedas donar, con gusto lo recibimos!

Infinitas Gracias!!

story:
About Me:

I am a passionate humanitarian committed to a life of social change and social justice. As a lifelong resident of Erie, PA, I have consistently been drawn to global travel and non-profit work.

I am currently serving as a full-time volunteer through the AmeriCorps VISTA program at the Quality of Life Learning Center. Starting July 6th, I will begin a 6 month fellowship in Bangalore as part of the IDEX Global Fellowship.

Please support me as I embark on my next journey to India  and share this wonderful experience with me. All funds raised from this campaign will be used to offset the cost of flight and living expenses in India. Any funds raised in excess of my goal will be used to support the Wings Learning Center.

About the Fellowship:

Each year, the IDEX Global Fellows Program invites a select number of individuals to take part in six-months of leadership training across India. Fellows gain emerging market experience while working hands on with socially-focused enterprises who deliver high impact solutions in local and global communities.

A social enterprise can be thought of in a variety of ways, but is generally considered a business with a social mission. This means that its mission is to generate profit while also tackling social problems and improving people’s lives. 

My Placement:

I will be placed with Wing’s Learning Center. Wing’s is a social enterprise focused on providing quality education to underserved children in rural areas within India. They offer affordable private learning centers to low-income elementary school children. Wing's operates in an after-school setting and offers academic and soft-skills training to youth, with a special focus on technology.

Why this Site is Perfect for Me: 

This fellowship will give me the opportunity to gain hard business skills in business management, business plan development, and marketing/operations, while also allowing me to pursue my interests in education and community development.  I will be based in the main offices in Bangalore, but will travel extensively to the rural centers and work one-on-one with youth and teachers. 

Testimonials:
Please watch the following video to see what my kids have to say about me! 


How You Can Help:

While volunteering as an AmeriCorps VISTA has been invaluable experience for me, it is financially challenging for me to afford the additional expenses incurred by this trip. 

By giving any monetary amount to my campaign, you will help send a qualified individual with 2 years of non-profit experience to work in a global context. As a culturally sensitive individual with an eagerness to learn, you can rest assured that your dollar will have its maximum impact on the community I serve!

If you are unable to give, please consider following my blog which will be up soon on the IDEX website. http://idexglobalfellows.blogspot.com/

Please email me at kmorton5061@gmail.com if you are interested in knowing more about my Fellowship and what I will be doing!
