story: We are going to NPH (Nicaragua) that houses orphans from infancy to adulthood in developing countries around the world. We are going on this trip to learn from these kids, regardless of their age, whatever their willing to give and share with us. While were there we will learn about the lives the children had before coming to NPH and the lives they now live so that when we come back to the US we will be pushed to make a change in the developing world and in our lives so that we can help our brothers and sisters around the world who are in need.

story:
http://gradvertise.me #gradvertiseme

Graduating college is both a blessing and a curse. While we work hard to learn a much as we can, at the end of 4-5 years students end up with a ton of debt, and I am no exception!

I am graduating Pace University with a BBA in Global Marketing Management, and a minor in French Language. I transferred from Michigan State, and while I love the Spartans - Go Green! - I am glad I decided to attend college in NYC and get a jumpstart on my career. I have worked hard throughout my time in college: attending 6 classes each semester, starting my own jewelry company, Fringes of Faith, and working a variety of part-time jobs. While it was never easy, I was able to maintain a high GPA, be on the Dean's List, and somehow balance a school-work-life balance! My goal is to be able to pay off my loans so I can focus on doing something that will innovate, inspire and make a difference.


I am looking for sponsors to purchase ad space on my graduation cap, to be worn May 20th 2015! You can use a logo, give a shout out, or provide a funny picture! Almost anything works - nothing inappropriate please!

Your "ad" will be seen by thousands of spectators and students - what a perfect place to advertise!


You can help me on my mission in a few ways:

- Sponsor an ad on my cap (limited spots available!)

- Donate to my campaign (any amount is appreciated!)

- Share this with your friends on social media (Facebook, Twitter, etc.) 

http://gradvertise.me #gradvertiseme

- Or simply share your words of wisdom to a new college grad - me!


Sometimes the smallest help in the right direction ends up being the biggest step of your life. Thanks so much in advance for your consideration -and- thanks in advance for helping me get one step closer to my goal! Someday I hope I can return the favor. :)

story:
WE PLAN ON MAKING MORE GROW GADGETS THAT ARE IN THE PROCESS OF BEING TESTED.THESE GADETS WILL HELP MAKE THE GROW LIFE MUCH EASIER TO PLANT YOUR FRUITS ,VEGETABLES,FLOWERS AND HERBS.WE WANT TO CREATE A WHOLE LINE OF GROW GADGETS FOR SMARTER GROWS JUST STAY TUNED FOR MORE.

We are a self made company trying to show if you have an idea dont stop pushing,
I have dedicated my time and energy almost everyday to design this product.The challenges are getting the funds to create a better version of my product due to high pricing machinery needed to fully complete my design.
I face many risk if i don't invest in myself and this product .We are trying to have full control of this design and not have to worry about an outside company making and producing this product .This will help save time and money and have a well designed product for users to use.We are so excited to put this product out for all the plant growers who want to plant all year round.Any backers who gives 50$ and up
will receive  the complete grow system after we hit our goal and after we are able to get the equipment needed to ship  this kit out to our backers as fast has possible.

PARTS INCLUDED WITH MINI HYDRO BOX.

PARTS INCLUDED WITH DWC ROOT SOCKET KIT.

 

 INSIDE PARTS ,NO MOVING PARTS MEANS LONG LASTING .

 DIMENSION AND LABELS

MAKES LIFE EASIER ,GROW SMARTER NOT HARDER.

THICK BASE PLATE HEPLS SUPPORT AND BALANCE HEAVY PLANTS.

 GIVES SEEDLINGS PLANTS A HIGHER SURVIVAL RATE DUE TO THE OXYGEN THAT IS CREATED IN THE WATER OF THE HYDRO BOX.MEANS FASTER GROW AND MORE HEALTHIER ROOTS.

 DRAIN ALLOWS FASTER AND EASY WATER CHANGES WITHOUT MOVING THE BUCKET.JUST ATTACH WET/DRY VAC TO DRAIN.

 DWC ROOT SOCKET KIT ALLOWS AND SUPPORTS LARGE ROOT  MASS.

 NO MORE SIDE HOLES WHICH MAY CAUSE WATER LEAKAGE NEW WAY TO READ WATER LEVEL IN BUCKET.

 READ PH LEVEL AND REFILL BUCKET WITH OUT MOVING.EASY HOLE ACCESS FOR ALL TYPES OF PH METERS.

 INSTRUCTIONS ARE ATTACH TO BACK OF HYDRO BOX.

QUICK SUMMARY ON HOW TO USE,FOR MORE DETAILS GERMAFLO.COM

WEBSITE IN CONSTRUCTION COMING SOON

QUICK HOW TO USE CONTINUE

START FROM SEEDLING OR CLONE IN MINI HYDRO BOX

AFTER A BUNCH OF ROOTS SHOW TRANSFER TO 3-5 GAL BUCKET TO ROOT SOCKET KIT

CONTINUE TO USE OWN NUTRIENTS AND OWN FEEDING SCHDULE.

FULL DETAILS WHEN WEBSITE DROPS

AT GERMAFLO.COM STILL UNDER CONSTRUCTION

story:
The Empowerment of Art 

Living in the Kibera slums of Nairobi does not deter girls from dreaming, and having ambitions for the future. One of Us is proud to join forces with Shining Hope for Communities (SHOFCO), a dynamic NGO that has not only taken up educating the girl child, but is dedicated to empowering her with skills to face the future and own it. We're absolutely thrilled to have been invited by Shofco to conduct photography training workshops for the students of the Kibera School for Girls, which features a journalism program, perfect for the curriculum provided in our workshops. Shofco is doing an incredible job with their education programs-- their academic test scores for 2020 were above the national average. We are so excited to be able to put cameras in the hands of these bright, future leaders, and give them the tools and skills for artistic and documentary expression. The photography, digital arts and media training for students are designed to add an important component to Shofco's Girls Leadership and Education program. The two-week-long workshops are designed to give the girls an empowering platform for visual and artistic expression, while teaching them vocational skills in photojournalism image making and editing.

As a longtime educator (eight years in K-12 classrooms and 17 at the university level), and a widely published and exhibited artist and photojournalist, I've spent the latter part of my career flipping the script by putting cameras in the hands of those I might have found myself photographing in the past. I'm a strong believer in the cathartic, therapeutic, and empowering qualities of art making. Most recently, I worked with a group of people experiencing homelessness in Los Angeles on a photography workshop similar to the one we are planning here, and the results were as moving for me as they were for the participants of How We See It. This Shofco project is so close to my heart, as I spent eight years living and working in Kenya early in my career, with much of that time spent in places like Kibera, where I worked closely with street children and those selfless social workers and other service providers.

THE IMPACT

Kibera is the largest slum in Nairobi, and the largest urban slum in Africa. Sources suggest the total Kibera population may be 500,000 to well over 1,000,000 depending on which slums are included in defining Kibera. Most of Kibera’s residents live in extreme poverty, earning less than $1.00 per day. Unemployment rates are high. Persons living with HIV in the slum are many, as are AIDS cases.  Cases of assault and rape are common. There are few schools, and most people cannot afford education for their children. Clean water is scarce. Diseases caused by poor hygiene are prevalent. A great majority lack access to basic services, including electricity, running water, and medical care. 

THERE'S MORE...
A second workshop will be conducted for the SHOFCO Urban network’s SUN Magazine, with an emphasis on photojournalism skills and techniques. This is being planned along with a  photography exhibition and academic/media panel discussion at the United States International University in Nairobi, and in partnership with another Kenyan NGO, Action for Children in Conflict, to bring attention to the plight of street children. Selections from the SHOFCO workshops will be showcased in our exhibition. Kenya Airways has also signed on as a sponsor, providing generous logistical support for the project.

Learn more about the workshops and our talented team of activists and media specialists who represent the One of Us Project in Kenya. To learn more about David Blumenkrantz, please visit his bio page. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

To make this opportunity a reality for the girls in Kibera, we have budgetary and material needs that total $15,000. Primarily, we are seeking either the financial or material donations to provide our workshops with:

Nikon Coolpix or Canon Powershot cameras, 25 @ $100 each
SD cards for the cameras, 25 @ $11 each
Accessories such as cases, batteries, 25 sets @$20 each
Portable PC  laptops for Kibera Girls School, 2 @ $700 each
Adobe Creative Suite licensing to install photo editing software, $600
Printing and framing costs, $1000
Stipends to compensate Kenyan support staff, $1000
Miscellaneous expenses including t-shirts, meals/refreshments for participants, $500

PERKS
For contributions between $50-$99 you will receive a 100% cotton One of Us: Art for People t-shirt, available in S, M and L.

For contributions of $100 and up, you will receive a signed copy of Edges of Africa, a hardcover anthology of photographs and writing by David Blumenkrantz, featuring more than 200 color and black & white images taken during eight years of living and working in East and Central Africa. David's work, which features striking and intimate environmental portraits, has been published and exhibited in several countries around the world. A significant portion of the book is dedicated to coverage of street children and urban poverty in Kibera and elsewhere. Mercy Gichengi, a member of the One of Us Project team in Kenya is a former street girl herself. In this video, Mercy speaks eloquently about her own experience of rising above her childhood poverty, which she wrote about in Edges of Africa.

 

 

Risks & Challenges: The Covid Factor

These workshops were originally planned for 2020, but we've had to postpone them due to the Covid-19 pandemic. We're working closely with the educators at Shofco to monitor the situation; while Kenyan schools have experienced intermittent shutdowns, we are now confident that the schools will be open and functioning for our workshops.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't afford to make a contribution to this effort, you can still play a part by sharing this campaign on all of your social media platforms. Every little bit helps! Thank you...

Most recently, I worked with a group of people experiencing homelessness in Los Angeles on a photography workshop similar to the one we are planning here, and the results were as moving for me as they were for the participants of How We See It. This Shofco project is so close to my heart, as I spent eight years living and working in Kenya early in my career, with much of that time spent in places like Kibera, where I worked closely with street children and those selfless social workers and other service providers.
THE IMPACT
Kibera is the largest slum in Nairobi, and the largest urban slum in Africa. Sources suggest the total Kibera population may be 500,000 to well over 1,000,000 depending on which slums are included in defining Kibera. Most of Kibera’s residents live in extreme poverty, earning less than $1.00 per day. Unemployment rates are high. Persons living with HIV in the slum are many, as are AIDS cases.  Cases of assault and rape are common. There are few schools, and most people cannot afford education for their children. Clean water is scarce. Diseases caused by poor hygiene are prevalent. A great majority lack access to basic services, including electricity, running water, and medical care. 
THERE'S MORE...A second workshop will be conducted for the SHOFCO Urban network’s SUN Magazine, with an emphasis on photojournalism skills and techniques. This is being planned along with a  photography exhibition and academic/media panel discussion at the United States International University in Nairobi, and in partnership with another Kenyan NGO, Action for Children in Conflict, to bring attention to the plight of street children. Selections from the SHOFCO workshops will be showcased in our exhibition. Kenya Airways has also signed on as a sponsor, providing generous logistical support for the project.
Learn more about the workshops and our talented team of activists and media specialists who represent the One of Us Project in Kenya. To learn more about David Blumenkrantz, please visit his bio page. 
 

What We Need & What You Get
To make this opportunity a reality for the girls in Kibera, we have budgetary and material needs that total $15,000. Primarily, we are seeking either the financial or material donations to provide our workshops with:
Nikon Coolpix or Canon Powershot cameras, 25 @ $100 eachSD cards for the cameras, 25 @ $11 eachAccessories such as cases, batteries, 25 sets @$20 eachPortable PC  laptops for Kibera Girls School, 2 @ $700 eachAdobe Creative Suite licensing to install photo editing software, $600Printing and framing costs, $1000Stipends to compensate Kenyan support staff, $1000Miscellaneous expenses including t-shirts, meals/refreshments for participants, $500
PERKSFor contributions between $50-$99 you will receive a 100% cotton One of Us: Art for People t-shirt, available in S, M and L.
For contributions of $100 and up, you will receive a signed copy of Edges of Africa, a hardcover anthology of photographs and writing by David Blumenkrantz, featuring more than 200 color and black & white images taken during eight years of living and working in East and Central Africa. David's work, which features striking and intimate environmental portraits, has been published and exhibited in several countries around the world. A significant portion of the book is dedicated to coverage of street children and urban poverty in Kibera and elsewhere. Mercy Gichengi, a member of the One of Us Project team in Kenya is a former street girl herself. In this video, Mercy speaks eloquently about her own experience of rising above her childhood poverty, which she wrote about in Edges of Africa.


 
 
Risks & Challenges: The Covid Factor
These workshops were originally planned for 2020, but we've had to postpone them due to the Covid-19 pandemic. We're working closely with the educators at Shofco to monitor the situation; while Kenyan schools have experienced intermittent shutdowns, we are now confident that the schools will be open and functioning for our workshops.

Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can't afford to make a contribution to this effort, you can still play a part by sharing this campaign on all of your social media platforms. Every little bit helps! Thank you...

story:
QUICK OVERVIEW

Why We're Raising $25,000

Trendy Educational Services was birthed out of a need to drive economic change within black families and minority communities by teaching personal finance. We believe that financial literacy is ONE of our greatest weapons of defense in the fight against racial inequalities.

Our holistic approach to providing very diverse programs for the children and adult learners in every household, is a part of our plan to help break the cycle of generational poverty and create systems for building generational wealth.

In Phase 1 of our initiative, we plan to provide online financial courses for children in grades K-12 and adult learners, through our “Virtual Learning Hub!” We will also host, workshops, trainings and membership groups within this same hub. By this summer (June 2021), we plan to expand our operations to provide tutoring in reading for children (Grades K-5).

HELP US KEEP OUR TUTORING SERVICES AND OVER 50% OF OUR FINANCIAL COURSES, FREE FOR EVERYONE!

WOULD YOU LIKE TO RECEIVE FREE FINANCIAL COURSES?

DOES YOUR CHILD NEED TUTORING THIS SUMMER?

DO YOU WANT TO SUPPORT A GOOD CAUSE?

 

HELP US JUMPSTART THIS INITIATIVE AND WE'LL MAINTAIN IT!!

We are a “Beyond the hashtag” initiative and movement focused on bringing financial educators, teachers, parents, nonprofits, and others who believe in our cause ALL TOGETHER, to help build up black families & communities. 

We have the partners and a sustainability plan.

You can help us with just as little as $5 to meet our campaign goals!

WHAT WE’LL DO WITH THE MONEY

We are raising $25,000 to partner with the best individuals and organizations to bring PHASE 1 of our vision to life. We will also use technology as an innovative tool to teach and reach as many families as possible (see budget breakdown).

OUR PHILOSOPHY

We believe that financial & educational literacy go hand-in-hand and often determine whether a child will likely experience success or struggle throughout adulthood.

This is why we strive to address the needs of the entire family, in every step of the process to create financial stability and generational wealth.

WHO WE SERVE

Our online Virtual Learning Hub will host financial courses and provide other resources and activities for the entire family. Our free tutoring program in reading will primarily focus on serving the needs of minority children in low-income families and communities.

 

PAID SERVICES

We will also have a group coaching program that is geared towards supporting women in their financial health & independence. All others choose our virtual hub membership, as a way to save on any financial classes and resources not found in our free vault.

Proving a healthy balance of both free and advanced level courses for a fee, will allow us to sustain this model, beyond money raised for this campaign. We also partner with nonprofits (see one below).

Feel free to donate and join us on this journey, by taking a course or utilizing the resources that you helped us purchase and develop!

Why The Racial Gap Exist

The current wealth gap that exist today, is a direct result of structural racism. The history of  blacks being displaced, segregated and excluded, spans over many decades. Although racial inequalities among black and white families, is well documented and often stands out the most, other minorities groups like Native and Latin Americans, have been impacted too. Wealth still is unequally distributed by race to date. There are still barriers to homeownership, inequalities in education and unequal access to capital (the list goes on).

Pre-Pandemic statistics already showed that African American students (as a whole) are educationally behind their white counterparts and low-literacy is one of their obstacles to creating a successful financial future.

On the 2015 National Assessment of Educational Progress, only 18% of African American 4th graders and less than 16% of 8th graders, were proficient in reading.  Now that education has moved to a predominately virtual space, there are even more black and minority students missing out on instruction and getting further behind.

Low-literacy students often struggle to find employment or settle for lesser pay. This has a huge impact, not only on their finances but their ability to educate the next generation.

Financial Literacy

Black and minority families often struggle to build wealth and simply maintain financial stability, due to a lack of financial education. There is also a lack of REAL, RELEVANT AND RELATABLE financial education being taught in our school systems and unfortunately the cycle continues throughout generations because children are also not receiving this info at home. Again, This is surely not the only contributing factor to the racial wealth gap that exist, but it’s definitely a major one.

 

WHY WE EXIST

Providing Financial & Educational Literacy Services for The Entire Family

Children and adults who are provided with sound financial education, tend to have a higher financial literacy rate.  As stated earlier, systemic inequalities definitely have and will continue to play a role in the existing wealth gap, but financial education can definitely help shrink it!

ABOUT OUR FOUNDER

Joy Voltaire has a great passion for teaching individuals and families how to save money through budgeting, strategic shopping & planning. Before devoting her time to educating others in savings strategies, she worked full-time as a certified Special Education Teacher, in several urban areas and schools, over a 10 year period.  She holds a Bachelor of Science degree in Special Education and is currently enrolled in the Certified Financial Education Instructor Training Program (CFEI).

Joy’s professional background, along with her enthusiasm for teaching others how to save and make money is what originally motivated her to become a blogger & author. Yet it wasn’t until she stumbled across the world of live-streaming that she discovered her true calling, initially as a couponing coach and edutainer.

 Joy is the proud Founder of Trendy Educational Services LLC (TES), a company created to assist in closing the racial wealth gap by providing financial & educational literacy programs for black families & minority communities.

Presently, she has created several successful online classes, courses, and coaching programs. In addition to being an Amazon Best Selling author of the eBook: “10 Strategic Couponing Tips for Newbies.”  Joy also enjoys facilitating local workshops, in which she can educate families on a more up close and personal level.

More recently and in light of America’s “Great Awakening” in 2020, Like many others, Joy felt compelled to be more proactive in helping to address racial inequalities and injustices in a significant way. Trendy Educational Services was birthed out of a need to help bring financial equality to black families and minority communities, through a holistic educational approach.  Many of the programs her company provides, involve free tutoring & financial educational services for families in underprivileged communities.

Joy has worked with over 100 families, helping them to reduce their household expenses and manage their money properly.  She is unapologetically comical in her delivery of information but serious about getting her clients and customers positive results.

You can find Joy virtually speaking on one of her many social media platforms, teaching others how to budget, maximize their savings potential, create multiple streams of income, and simply managing their money better. Stop by and visit her, at TrendyEducationalServices.com.

 

MEET OUR FOUNDING MEMBERS

Renee Taylor, Founding member

Patrice Ham, Founding member

Gail Freeman is the Founder & CEO of Just Us Girls Camden County, A NJ Nonprofit Corp. (JUGS). Gail is NOT only a partner but she will be sitting on our Board of Directors and has been my right-hand Bizsister on this journey.

JUGS was founded by Gail Freeman, an experienced Certified Peer Recovery Specialist in drugs and alcohol, Certified Mental Health Peer and Home Health Aide. Just Us Girls is a New Jersey non-profit corporation that offers services to the homeless population.

In 2019, JUGS proudly opened Martha’s Place, a safe transitional housing facility geared toward helping women achieve self-sufficiency.

 

Sophia Antoine is a life coach dedicated to helping women to achieve balance and authentic wellness. Sophia started her coaching business to support women who are navigating the feelings that accompany low self-esteem, unforgiveness, and pushing past limiting beliefs. Through accountability and encouragement, Sophia guides her clients to rewrite their life stories so they can live a life they can be proud of. Prior to becoming a coach, Sophia was the primary caregiver for her husband after he was diagnosed with Chronic Kidney Disease, endured five years of dialysis, and underwent a successful kidney transplant surgery.

 

OUR PARTNERS 

1. Bailey's Tax & Accounting Svc LLC

    Visit: www.baileysaccounting.com

 

2. Just Us Girls, A N Nonprofit Corporation

    Visit: https://www.jugs2014.com

 

3. Courageous Coaching Corporation

     Visit: Sophiaantoine.com

 

4. CER Financial Services

    Visit: https://www.cerfinancialsvc.com

 

Product Partners

5. Sow natural PHAM

    Visit: etsy.com/shop/ShopLacedWithFaith

 

6. Laced with Faith

    Contact: sownaturalpham@gmail.com

 

PHASE 1 LAUNCH DETAILS

 

OUR OFFICIAL SOFT LAUNCH OF OUR LEARNING HUB WILL BE ON APRIL 30TH!

You will be able to see and experience a small portion of the course and services we are raising money to provide. Your donations will help us obtain the rest of the software, resources and other money needed to pay our instructors. 

 

CURRICULUM (Sneak Peek)

PROGRESS REPORTS

We believe in being transparent with our families, donors and partners. We endeavor to strengthen our trust and relationship with you, by keeping you updated on our progress. Please join our donor’s email list, to receive monthly updates throughout this year. You can also follow our Facebook and Instagram pages to enjoy visuals of our progress.  

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are on a tight budget, no worries! You can still help by doing the following:

  • Follow us on our newly created Instagram and Facebook pages!
  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Woohoo!
  • Share our campaign link with your friends and family

Thank you in advance for any support you can give our cause. We greatly appreciate you!

Together, we are making a greater impact on our children and communities!

story:
Myndset is a card game and step-by-step method based on the process of design thinking, guiding the user through the process of idea generation. Our goal is to empower everyone to solve anything by applying a simple method and create valuable ideas by thinking differently.

We have designed 5 additional cards for unique and popular Mindsets you might want to add to your Myndset Cards stack. If we reach the stretch goal, everyone who has already backed will receive the additional cards! 

As many of you are not following the iOS train, we’d like to add an Android app to our portfolio if we reach this stretch goal. The Android app would contain the same content as the iOS app, and would make the life of non-iOS ideators easier!

The game consists of 5 decks. Starting with the selection of a challenge, briefing, or goal, the user should draw random or specific cards from each of the decks that correspond to the tools or mediums that will be used to create an idea.

Each card represents a topic along with an icon and some keywords. They are designed to stimulate creative thinking, challenge the user to find alternative solutions, design behavior and help them present their fresh ideas.

Myndset in 6 steps

With Myndset it doesn’t matter who is trying to create an idea - whether they are creative directors, teachers, startups, writers or students. The method is simple, but challenging at the same time and takes the guesswork out of creating value-based ideas - in just 30 mins.

 

All you need is to draw 4 cards and invest 30 minutes of your time. Myndset creates a clear frame and a creative playing field for your ideas to come easy. See below how Myndset could’ve been used for world dominating ideas:

Accomodation on demand

Music on demand

Transportation on demand

Myndset is all about simplifying and enriching the process of developing an idea, and inspiring new ways of thinking while doing so. Instead of giving you an e-book with all the details of every cards purpose, we provide you with an app to scan our cards and obtain detailed information and learnings. Just hold a card in front of your smartphone, and watch the magic happen.

Myndset Companion App - Scan Cards

The app also contains detailed briefings and challenges just in case you have no goal to work towards.  

Myndset Companion App - Briefings

Never heard of Design Thinking? You think you’re just not „that type“ who creates mind-blowing ideas? Or, are you a seasoned Creative with years and years in designing products and experiences and are looking for further inspiration?Creativity is a muscle that needs food and training just like your body does!We have developed Myndset to be useful for cross-functional teams and individuals alike - see below what Myndset can do for you!  

Aspiring Entrepreneur:

You have the energy to dive deep into entrepreneurship, but you haven’t come across the right idea yet? 

  • Myndset will show you in 5 easy steps how to design an idea that will be useful, and unique at the same time. You will learn how the pros are creating ideas and start with your business right away! What are you waiting for?!

Consultants and Startups:

You’ve got your product or service up and running, but it’s hard to move forward and develop new strategies and products to expand your portfolio and grow? 

  • Myndset will help you tackle specific problems, shape your ideas and enable you for emotional behavior design all the way up to product development.

Business:

You’ve been executing the same events and product development strategies since years, but innovation is hard and you lack the right tools to move forward? 

  • Myndset will facilitate cross-functional collaboration and inspire your teams while playfully introducing design thinking to your organization.

Students:

You’re not sure which tool to use to create value-based and consumer-centric ideas fast and efficient? 

  • Myndset is your ideal framework before switching to a business model canvas.

Universities:

You want to provide your students with innovative teaching methods and materials, and aim to give them tools to learn about customer-centric and value-based ideation? 

  • Myndset is your go-to method to stimulate group work and magnify your students potential.

While working in the university environment as a lecturer, it became evident that it was always the students who believed they have no potential to create an idea, came up with the most brilliant ones, when they were shown this method. We developed Myndset because we believe that everyone can be a creator, and we hope to inspire many people to become involved in the change they want to see in the world.

"Imagination is more important than knowledge, because knowledge is limited." - Einstein

With Myndset you will be able to:

  • Create ideas that are valuable, engaging and meaningful
  • Playfully discover behavioral design and integrate it into your existing ideas
  • Include teams from different departments into your product development and save costs
  • Discover unexpected ideas from 133.784.560 possible combinations
  • Get to the chopper in time

2018 we had the opportunity to host a workshop with our prototype cards at the biggest international startup festival Bits & Pretzels in Munich. While testing our method and cards, we received constructive, very positive feedback and also developed ideas to save the world by preventing the plastic pollution of the sea.

We have vastly experimented with different variations of thickness, size, colors, and stampings (look, a unicorn!) thanks to our experienced local partner Stulz Druck und Medien in Munich. We want our cards to be itself inspiring and unique - they should offer an exceptional haptic experience, delicious colorful icons you’d want to lick, overall sustainability and fun to work with!

Peter from Stulz Druck has more than 20 years of experience with print, and will bring our vision to life!

Stulz Druck & Medien GmbH

 

After collecting tons of player feedback, we have decided for this to be our final product:

Card Details

Packaging Details

 

  • Instruction
  • Access to E-Learning
  • Access to Myndset Companion APP
  • 10 Vision cards: Shape the base vision for your idea to reach your goal 
  • 11 Technology cards: Trends in technology that enable your idea
  • 13 Mindset cards: Representations of typical personas that your idea is aimed at 
  • 13 Emotion cards: Mechanisms that design emotions and behavior
  • 5 Presentation cards: Alternative ideas for presentation 

 

Myndset Kit

You want to get started with Myndset but lack the funds of getting your hands on our beautiful cards with hand mixed pantone colors printed in Munich, velvety softtouch on the back and passionately stamped letterprint?

No problem, we’re here to help! Get our printable digital version and get started already. We want you to succeed! 

Printable digital version

Sometimes all you need is a new haircut and someone by your side which guides the way. Unfortunately, we cannot help with the haircut, but we have created an E-Learning program that will show you how to become instantly more creative and submerge into the world of ideation. 

E-Learning with a ton of video material

We’ll come in to talk to your team (anywhere in the Munich! Germany, and Europe on request.) and we'll go through a 2-3 hour creative workshop aimed to help people break thinking patterns and be more creative. Up to 12 people in the workshop. Everyone gets a pack of Myndset and new ways of thinking on top!

(We'll work together to schedule the workshop between July - September 2019) 

Myndset workshop for business

Myndset has been founded by Alex Holzreiter, Bene Matern, Roland Lehle, and Jasmin Karatas and we are a mixed team of experienced entrepreneurs and young designers with consulting and agency background.

The Myndset Team

Or, are you a seasoned Creative with years and years in designing products and experiences and are looking for further inspiration?Creativity is a muscle that needs food and training just like your body does!We have developed Myndset to be useful for cross-functional teams and individuals alike - see below what Myndset can do for you!  Aspiring Entrepreneur:You have the energy to dive deep into entrepreneurship, but you haven’t come across the right idea yet? Myndset will show you in 5 easy steps how to design an idea that will be useful, and unique at the same time. You will learn how the pros are creating ideas and start with your business right away! What are you waiting for?!Consultants and Startups: You’ve got your product or service up and running, but it’s hard to move forward and develop new strategies and products to expand your portfolio and grow? Myndset will help you tackle specific problems, shape your ideas and enable you for emotional behavior design all the way up to product development.Business:You’ve been executing the same events and product development strategies since years, but innovation is hard and you lack the right tools to move forward? Myndset will facilitate cross-functional collaboration and inspire your teams while playfully introducing design thinking to your organization.Students:You’re not sure which tool to use to create value-based and consumer-centric ideas fast and efficient? Myndset is your ideal framework before switching to a business model canvas.Universities:You want to provide your students with innovative teaching methods and materials, and aim to give them tools to learn about customer-centric and value-based ideation? Myndset is your go-to method to stimulate group work and magnify your students potential.While working in the university environment as a lecturer, it became evident that it was always the students who believed they have no potential to create an idea, came up with the most brilliant ones, when they were shown this method. We developed Myndset because we believe that everyone can be a creator, and we hope to inspire many people to become involved in the change they want to see in the world."Imagination is more important than knowledge, because knowledge is limited." - EinsteinWith Myndset you will be able to:
Create ideas that are valuable, engaging and meaningful
Playfully discover behavioral design and integrate it into your existing ideas
Include teams from different departments into your product development and save costs
Discover unexpected ideas from 133.784.560 possible combinations
Get to the chopper in time
2018 we had the opportunity to host a workshop with our prototype cards at the biggest international startup festival Bits & Pretzels in Munich. While testing our method and cards, we received constructive, very positive feedback and also developed ideas to save the world by preventing the plastic pollution of the sea.We have vastly experimented with different variations of thickness, size, colors, and stampings (look, a unicorn!) thanks to our experienced local partner Stulz Druck und Medien in Munich. We want our cards to be itself inspiring and unique - they should offer an exceptional haptic experience, delicious colorful icons you’d want to lick, overall sustainability and fun to work with!Peter from Stulz Druck has more than 20 years of experience with print, and will bring our vision to life!Stulz Druck & Medien GmbH After collecting tons of player feedback, we have decided for this to be our final product:Card DetailsPackaging Details 
Instruction
Access to E-Learning
Access to Myndset Companion APP
10 Vision cards: Shape the base vision for your idea to reach your goal 
11 Technology cards: Trends in technology that enable your idea
13 Mindset cards: Representations of typical personas that your idea is aimed at 
13 Emotion cards: Mechanisms that design emotions and behavior
5 Presentation cards: Alternative ideas for presentation 
 Myndset KitYou want to get started with Myndset but lack the funds of getting your hands on our beautiful cards with hand mixed pantone colors printed in Munich, velvety softtouch on the back and passionately stamped letterprint?No problem, we’re here to help! Get our printable digital version and get started already. We want you to succeed! Printable digital versionSometimes all you need is a new haircut and someone by your side which guides the way. Unfortunately, we cannot help with the haircut, but we have created an E-Learning program that will show you how to become instantly more creative and submerge into the world of ideation. E-Learning with a ton of video materialWe’ll come in to talk to your team (anywhere in the Munich! Germany, and Europe on request.) and we'll go through a 2-3 hour creative workshop aimed to help people break thinking patterns and be more creative. Up to 12 people in the workshop. Everyone gets a pack of Myndset and new ways of thinking on top!(We'll work together to schedule the workshop between July - September 2019) Myndset workshop for businessMyndset has been founded by Alex Holzreiter, Bene Matern, Roland Lehle, and Jasmin Karatas and we are a mixed team of experienced entrepreneurs and young designers with consulting and agency background.The Myndset Team

story:
Brief Overview

Comments Lab is an online resource created for educators to better provide feedback to their students.

It's efficient. It's customizable. It was built by teachers for teachers. 

Check out what we've built so far below or visit our site: CommentsLab.io

 

 

Comments Lab allows educators to create and edit standardized feedback templates. Whether a teacher needs to provide guidance on a progress report or give a weekly update to parents about social growth, each template can be manipulated to fit the occasion.  With consistent, constructive feedback, students are much more likely to realize their growth potential. This tool is fast, easy to use, and already catching on in schools around the world. 

 

With the structure of education evolving, allowing teachers to communicate directly with students effectively, regardless of location, is more important than ever. 

 

 

The Idea

My name is Felix. I'm a math teacher. 

A colleague and I realized that traditional grades, like  B+  or  78%, do little to help our students grow. Kids need specific feedback to help them learn. Unfortunately, educators lack the time to regularly provide this type of guidance, which leads to a lot of "copy and paste" or "universal" comments generated for entire classes. 

For more information about the research behind the idea of improved feedback, scroll down to the "Idea rooted in research" section.

 

Comments Lab: Today

Currently our usership consists of roughly 200 teachers from 16 different schools, spanning  from North America, across to Europe and Asia. Over 7,000 students received motivation and extra feedback using our platform last year. Here's how a few of our teachers described their experiences:

 

"In my 23 years in education, Comments Lab is hands down the most efficient method I have found for providing clear communication to stakeholders regarding academic progress and behavior. The interface is clean and mitigates common workflow issues and grammar mistakes. Easily the application cut my comment writing time by 60% and my comments are far more useful to students and their parents." 

- Tim, IB Coordinator

 

“After taking the time to set my comment lab up with classes and sentences that are applicable to my subject area, Comments Lab drastically reduced the time that I spent writing comments for my 100+ students! The nice thing is that once your lab is set up then it is going to be very quick and easy from that point forward to write specific and meaningful comments!”-

Joey, Physical Education

 

Our challenge now is improving this tool and getting it into the hands of more teachers. As word spreads and the project grows, we'll create avenues for meaningful collaboration among colleagues, departments, and schools around the world. 

 

We need your help!

What do we need to improve access and the user experience while maximizing efficiency and effectiveness of Comments Lab? Well, we asked our users. With their feedback, we narrowed out goal down to three specific, attainable goals:

 

Collaboration. We need to create a virtual teacher's lounge for educators around the world. Adding such a space to communicate ideas, work together in real time, and share templates will transform this tool from an individual experience to a collaborative, global network. We'll call this the Comment Community. 

 

Integration. Comments Lab promotes frequent, regular feedback. To streamline this process, we plan to integrate Comments Lab with Learning and Student Management Systems, such as Google Classroom, PowerSchool, and ManageBac. In doing so, we hope to provide seamless access for teachers and students to communicate directly with as few clicks as possible. 

 

Access. Right now, this tool is free! It won't always be though. We will need support from our users to keep the servers running and the data secure down the road. Currently, we pay this out of pocket. With enough users, we plan to sell ad space to generate revenue to pay the bills. Keeping this site accessible while maintaining a high standard of quality is a core part of our philosophy.

 

Projected Costs

As we're teachers, not web developers, we need to source out the construction and maintenance of our site. Upon interviewing businesses, colleagues, and friends who are familiar with the costs and maintenance of a website, our estimated costs are as follows:

 

$4000-$5000: Projected cost to develop and integrate the Comment Community, our space for teachers to share feedback templates and collaborate across departments and disciplines.

$3000-$4000: Projected cost of integrating our site with Learning Management Software. 

$200-$300: Cost of renting servers and databases per year. 

 

Total Funding Needed: $9,600 (represents combined project goals as well as two years of server, database, and site maintenance)

So far, we have built this site from concept to free standing platform using our own funds and free time. To continue our journey, we'll need your help to take this tool to the next level. The bigger we are, the more students will benefit!

 

Stretch Goal: Any funds raised over our goal will go directly into improving Comments Lab and keeping this tool free. 

 

If we don’t reach our goal: Every single dollar of this campaign will go towards funding the development of this tool. If we fall short, we plan on contributing our own money to cover the rest, as we have done so far. We believe in this project and the impact it can have on education. So much so, that we’re willing to risk it all to get it done!
 

Our ambitious date to complete this project is Dec. 1. At this time, we'll share the site for beta testing for feedback before releasing it to the world!

 

Perks

We don’t have fun swag… yet. 

Whether you are a teacher or you know someone who is, help bring our project to life while giving the ability to alter the course of their students’ education. Consider yourself not only a donor to Comments Lab but also a partner to educational innovation.

Whether you can become a supporter of Comments Lab monetarily or by helping us spread the word by sharing this campaign, each act of generosity is vital to our success.

 

Thanks for the support!

That was our pitch in a nutshell. If you'd like a more indepth view of how COmments Lab works and our timeline for this project, keep scrolling down.  
 

 

 

More in-depth info

CommentsLab.io is live! Check us out! 

So far, we’ve create a platform where teachers can quickly combine sentence fragments in a way that makes sense, both conceptually and grammatically. 

By making names, pronouns, sentence structure, and variables interchangeable, we give teachers the foundation of a standardized feedback template so they can quickly adapt it to match a student’s specific needs.

Templates can be edited, rearranged, even combined across subjects.  For each student, the feedback is broken down into specific, standardized criteria. Everything is editable, making comment writing as quick as piecing together the sentences you need. 

 

 

Pronouns and names are automatically updated for each student while sentences can be mixed and matched, allowing for each student to receive the exact feedback they need. Those little smiley faces you see represent "tones", which a user can use to sort comment strands, even using multiple tones per sentence. 

 

 

Teachers are able to stay organized by grouping students into specific classes, and then grouping classes into folders to represent terms, semester, or grade levels. 

 

Collaboration: The Community

Why work alone when you can collaborate with a team of colleagues around the world?

Think of this space as a virtual think tank, where teachers can share their own feedback templates and collaborate with others from around the world. 

The ability to access tailormade templates and adapting them to fit your needs smoothes the onboarding for teachers that may be new to the profession or those who might just need a jumpstart.

Key Characteristics of the Community:

  • The ability to upload customized feedback templates which will be sorted by Subject, Grade, and Keywords
  • Users can search the Community for relevant comment templates that fit their needs, adding as many as they want to their own Builder.

All aspects of the comment template can be explored and analyzed.

Whether you're an elementary teacher needing to provide meaningful feedback regarding many different topics, or a graduate-level math teacher providing clarity on a thesis paper, Comments Lab will be there to help organize your thoughts and manage your output. 

 

Integration: Reducing the Clicks

Learning Management Software are programs such as Google Classroom, Powerschool, ManageBac, Atlas, etc. that help schools manage student data, from schedules to report cards. 

To integrate with these platforms would allow teachers to:

  • Provide feedback attached directly to assignments, quickly, by linking Comments Lab directly with a specific LMS
  • Easily store reports for future evaluation by teachers and families on both Comments Lab and the specified LMS

 

 

Project Timeline

Through many rounds of Q&A with developers and businesses, we’ve been able to forecast the following deadlines and costs for building out our platform:

 

The idea rooted in research

Studies show the old-fashioned method of assigning numbers or letters to students to represent progress, like we’re all used to seeing on report cards, has been proven to be unsuccessful... So why are we still doing it?

Not only did we see positive results in our own classrooms after constructing Comments Lab, but it's no wonder our findings coincidentally lined up with educational best practices studies done over the past two decades. 

Check out two of our favorite pieces of educational literature regarding consistent, constructive teacher feedback, published by Temple University and Princeton. 

Through years of working with and observing colleagues, we’ve been able to identify the key traits of meaningful feedback:

  • Clear and concise language to avoid misinterpretation 
  • Ideas for growth to facilitate improvement
  • Validation of what the receiver has demonstrated, achieved, or done well
  • Realistic goals
  • Commitment to support and accountability

Sounds great, right? And pretty straightforward. 

Well, as all educators know, teachers don’t have the time to provide this kind of meaningful feedback to every student. 

 

 

Spread the word!

Please share this idea with your friends, colleagues, and family!

Copy and paste our nutshell pitch below:

Looking to support educational innovation? Comments Lab, a web based platform built by teachers, improves the efficiency and effectiveness of teacher communication with students.

Check out their Campaign Funding page to help them raise some funds to build their platform, to be shared globally! The more you contribute, the less actual teachers will have to. 

If you’re not in a position to help with a donation, support these educators by sharing this message with friends, family, and colleagues. 

Thank you for being a champion for innovation in education!

Visit our site. Give us feedback. Let us know how we can best support you!

story:
A trip around the globe

How much do we know about the impressive planet we all live in? Now, you can take an epic trip around the globe through space and time with our EARTH model and corresponding app.

The app displays information on several in-depth categories: 

Ever wondered how many gallons of water are in the ocean? 

With EARTH you can track geology, to study the formation and evolution of our physical planet.

Curious about what animals inhabited your country 1,000 years ago? 

With EARTH you can track the migration and habitats of animals past and present.

And much more!

 

Control EARTH with your voice

While you explore the globe with your hands, use our smart voice technology—named  GAEA, powered by Microsoft LUIS - to direct the app and discover a wealth of information about the earth.

Here are a couple questions you can ask Gaea across the various categories. Just say "Hey GAEA!"

and ask away...

  Or, get Gaea to navigate you around the app!

  • Hey Gaea, show me the areas of temperate grassland around the globe. 
  • Hey Gaea, let's leave the animal section and see the Earth's structure.

 

World Class Knowledge of earth led by Dr. J.R. Skok

Beyond the physical globe of EARTH, the AstroReality App contains a wealth of scientific knowledge selected to show our planet as a dynamic and interconnected system. This knowledge was developed by researchers from around the world and made public for us to share with you. AstroReality’s developers are working with our science advisor, J.R. Skok, PhD, a planetary scientist at the SETI Institute, to put the stories of EARTH into your hands.

Here is Dr. Skok sharing a taste of just one of the many datasets that we can explore with EARTH.

We made the EARTH experience incredibly easy to use for everyone—from schools who want to adopt the latest technology for their students, everyday knowledge-seekers, to model collectors, and enthusiasts. 

 

EARTH specifications

 

EARTH in the real world

We invited illustrators, journalists, and friends to meet, draw, and learn about some of the fascinating creatures we share our planet with.

 

How EARTH is made

We use poly resin density, 3D printing, and paint pigment ratios to create EARTH. Then, we refine our models to ensure the surface details—ocean, land, mountains—are clearly visible

EARTH is made with an eco-friendly paint and production process. 3D printing is extremely precise, and levels down to 0.05 millimeters—printing error has a precision of 0.025 millimeters, printing resolution reaches 4000 DPI, and up to 0.006 millimeter per pixel. We then finish with a hand painted layer on every single unit.

 

As seen in...

 

We have done this before!

EARTH comes after our first successful project of a detailed replica of the moon— LUNAR. Hailed as “the best way to learn about the moon without actually visiting it” by Gizmodo—and praised by the likes of WIRED, Mashable, and The Next Web—LUNAR allowed users to explore and learn about the moon’s rocky surface.

EARTH follows LUNAR’s AR experience, but this time with many new features and rich visualization from authentic datasets. Below is lunar and planetary scientist Georgiana Kramer explaining her experience with LUNAR.

 

Why we built EARTH

We’re passionate about our planet—it’s the only home we have. Unfortunately, Earth is going through irreversible changes that are forever changing the surface of everything we know—from global warming and glacial recession, to the extinction of its animals and wildlife.

We hope that educating everyone about the effects we have on our planet from fossil fuels, pollution, and more will ignite a conscious change and passion for bettering the world as we know it.

Who are we?

The team behind EARTH is AstroReality—a collective of scientists, astronomy enthusiasts, designers, and tech geeks, who are deeply committed to using innovative and creative technology to shape the way people interact with science.

 

Thank you!
story_txt:
EARTH is brought to life    with an AR and AI-driven app  

to help you learn about  
our incredible past, present, and future. 
  EARTH in action with the AstroReality app.


 A trip around the globeHow much do we know about the impressive planet we all live in? Now, you can take an epic trip around the globe through space and time with our EARTH model and corresponding app.

 

 
EARTH is the first-ever augmented reality-enabled globe that lets you see our planet’s changes across history.  
Just open the app and point your phone’s camera at the model for a deeply immersive learning experience. 

The app displays information on several in-depth categories: 

 
Ever wondered how many gallons of water are in the ocean? 
With EARTH you can track geology, to study the formation and evolution of our physical planet.
Curious about what animals inhabited your country 1,000 years ago? 
With EARTH you can track the migration and habitats of animals past and present.
And much more!


 
EARTH's technology takes you through time to explore our planet’s rich geographic history,
along with the current state of our world due to climate change, natural disasters, and more.

 
The deeply-layered, interactive experience covers basic geographic information such as landmarks, latitude and longitude, time zones, and regions.

 
The app also displays complex visualization across various topics such as heat maps, cloud atlases, point maps, texture maps, and more.
 
Control EARTH with your voice
While you explore the globe with your hands, use our smart voice technology—named  GAEA, powered by Microsoft LUIS - to direct the app and discover a wealth of information about the earth.
Here are a couple questions you can ask Gaea across the various categories. Just say "Hey GAEA!" 
and ask away...


 

 
Gaea is here to help with your journey across time and space.

 
Gaea displays the information you want, right before your eyes.
  Or, get Gaea to navigate you around the app!


Hey Gaea, show me the areas of temperate grassland around the globe. 

Hey Gaea, let's leave the animal section and see the Earth's structure.

 
World Class Knowledge of earth led by Dr. J.R. Skok
Beyond the physical globe of EARTH, the AstroReality App contains a wealth of scientific knowledge selected to show our planet as a dynamic and interconnected system. This knowledge was developed by researchers from around the world and made public for us to share with you. AstroReality’s developers are working with our science advisor, J.R. Skok, PhD, a planetary scientist at the SETI Institute, to put the stories of EARTH into your hands.
Here is Dr. Skok sharing a taste of just one of the many datasets that we can explore with EARTH.


 
Who is EARTH for?

We made the EARTH experience incredibly easy to use for everyone—from schools who want to adopt the latest technology for their students, everyday knowledge-seekers, to model collectors, and enthusiasts. 

 
EARTH specifications

 
EARTH's specs at a glance.

 
The model is incredibly detailed.

EARTH looks great anywhere.
 
EARTH in the real world
We invited illustrators, journalists, and friends to meet, draw, and learn about some of the fascinating creatures we share our planet with.
Attendees of the event had the chance to try our EARTH and learn all the migration and habitats of animals past and present.
"EARTH is unlike any other model—an encyclopedia for the modern world!"
- Jenny Webber, Founder of Wild Life Drawing

"Seeing the cloud overlay using AR is beautiful and enriching." 
- Annabel Maguire, Studio Lune

"It's really incredible—the details of the continents, oceans, mountains, and more are all amazing." 
- Illustrator Alec Doherty
 
How EARTH is made
We use poly resin density, 3D printing, and paint pigment ratios to create EARTH. Then, we refine our models to ensure the surface details—ocean, land, mountains—are clearly visible
EARTH is made with an eco-friendly paint and production process. 3D printing is extremely precise, and levels down to 0.05 millimeters—printing error has a precision of 0.025 millimeters, printing resolution reaches 4000 DPI, and up to 0.006 millimeter per pixel. We then finish with a hand painted layer on every single unit.

3D modeling of EARTH before printing.

Working on EARTH's AI capabilities.

EARTH before the hand-painting process begins.

Craftsmanship

The EARTH unboxing experience!

An unboxed EARTH with a small stand for display.
 
As seen in...


 
We have done this before!
EARTH comes after our first successful project of a detailed replica of the moon— LUNAR. Hailed as “the best way to learn about the moon without actually visiting it” by Gizmodo—and praised by the likes of WIRED, Mashable, and The Next Web—LUNAR allowed users to explore and learn about the moon’s rocky surface.
EARTH follows LUNAR’s AR experience, but this time with many new features and rich visualization from authentic datasets. Below is lunar and planetary scientist Georgiana Kramer explaining her experience with LUNAR. 
Our first project, LUNAR, and the AR app.

Our LUNAR model in action!

EARTH will use the same tech as LUNAR, but with countless more features.

LUNAR packaging and models.
 
Why we built EARTH
We’re passionate about our planet—it’s the only home we have. Unfortunately, Earth is going through irreversible changes that are forever changing the surface of everything we know—from global warming and glacial recession, to the extinction of its animals and wildlife.
We hope that educating everyone about the effects we have on our planet from fossil fuels, pollution, and more will ignite a conscious change and passion for bettering the world as we know it.

A highly accurate representation of our planet.

An unpainted EARTH.

Check out the beautiful details!
 
Who are we?
The team behind EARTH is AstroReality—a collective of scientists, astronomy enthusiasts, designers, and tech geeks, who are deeply committed to using innovative and creative technology to shape the way people interact with science.

 
 
Thank you!

Display EARTH in your home.
 

Or use the EARTH model has an educational tool.

Or preserve your EARTH in its beautiful box.

Close-up of EARTH!
 

​Take a monument trip around the globe, today.
Welcome to EARTH.

story:
Marshall Elementary School is a small community school located in the heart of the Mission District in San Francisco. Our kids go to school in an urban environment surrounded by concrete without a park or open space within walking distance. Our K-5 Spanish Two-Way Immersion program is blessed to have an outdoor education program, which serves as the hub of hands on-environmental science lessons. For many of our kids, this is a primary way in which they engage with the natural environment. It is one of a number of ways in which the school is trying to level the playing field for our kids and give them a world class education in a public school setting.

But we need your help! In order to keep our outdoor education program running, we need a supply fund to purchase gardening tools and educational materials. With your help, we can purchase supplies to support 1 years worth of lessons to ensure our kids keep a connection with our environment so they can be stewards as adults and take these lessons with them in their journey to higher education.

Thanks for taking the time to read this! And keep checking back to the website. We will be posting pictures of some of our activities so you can see what amazing work our teachers and students are doing with a little space and a lot of love.

story:
UNCSA's Preparatory Dance Program 2.0


  • The Preparatory Dance Program of the University of North Carolina School of the Arts is the preeminent dance education program in our area. For over 40 years, we have provided pure, classical dance education to students age 8-14 who audition for the opportunity to recieve world-class conservatory training in our state of the art facility. Upon completion of our program, our students will have achieved the tools needed in preparation to audition for the UNCSA high school dance department and the discipline they need to continue onto a healthy life, no matter what path they choose.  


    WE ARE A NONPROFIT PROGRAM, AND CURRENTLY RECEIVE NO FUNDING FROM THE STATE OF NORTH CAROLINA. 

    In 2014, the Preparatory Dance Program relaunched under new     direction. A major part of our mission became to raise money in order to increase our scholarship fund so that no child would ever need to miss the chance to receive the highest quality dance education available in our area. 

    We launched our first     successful Indiegogo campaign, and the money raised helped to create the Dayna Fox Scholarship Fund. It also helped give us more financial flexibility, so we could enhance our community outreach, solidify our presence in Winston-Salem, and continue leaping toward the future.

    This year, we are calling our our second campaign, “UNCSA Preparatory Dance Program 2.0! We are again reaching out and asking for your generosity, and we invite you to invest in the lives and education of young children. We know that with your help, we can raise $12,000! 


    Here is a list of some of the accomplishments we were able to achieve in the first year of the relaunch of the UNCSA Preparatory Dance Program: 

    -Enrollment enhanced from 55 students to 70
    -Grow our Boy's Division from 6 students to 13
    -National and local media recognition
    -Codify our ballet curriculum to better fit the specific needs and direction of our school and students
    -Expanded curriculum offering partnering, classical jazz dance, musical theater dance, acting, and physical comedy workshops
    -Increase performance opportunities from 2 performances to 9 performances a year including the sellout hits "Drosselmeyer's Nutcracker Tea", "Letters to Santa," and our first ever mixed repertoire performance, "Winter Festival."
    -Create our scholarship fund-Offer over $1,000 dollars more in scholarships in 2015 than in 2014
    -Develop and build a physical therapy program with Dr. Meghan Robinson
    -Purchase costumes 
    -Offer master class opportunities with professional dancers
    -Enhanced our marketing and advertising ability
    -Increased community outreach further solidifying our presence 

    THAT WAS JUST YEAR ONE! IMAGINE WHAT YOUR DONATION COULD HELP US ACHIEVE...

  • Your tax deductible donation will directly help us to be able to continue in this direction, making it possible for us maintain operations and expand our community outreach into areas who have never been exposed to dance. Funds can help put dance attire on a child in need and ensure that no one who auditions ever be turned away due to lack of funds. There is no limit to how far your donation can go!

We need your help! Fun Perks! (aka "swag!")

  • If 1,200 people donate $10, we'll meet our goal, (and we all have more Facebook friends than that!) Let's exceed this goal! 
  • PARTNERSHIPS
  • $100-$249: Corps De Ballet: Your name in our end of year workshop program
  • $250-$499: Demi-Soloist: Above and official UNCSA Preparatory Dance Program Logo poster, signed by the entire student body of our program!
  • $500-$999: Soloist: Everything above and official Preparatory Dance Logo T-shirt
  • $1,000-$4,999: Principal: Everything above and attend a class or rehearsal and have a Q&A with dancers and Directors (space permitting)
  • $5,000-$9,999: Muse: Same above and drinks and dessert with the Directors. (Location TBD) 
  • $10,000-above: ROCK STAR: Everything above and have students of the Preparatory Dance Program perform for your organization or club. (At the combined discretion of the Directors and Parents of the students.)

The Impact You Help Make In The Lives of Our Students and Families:

  • Our mission is to develop the entire person by developing the entire artist. Your donation helps us enable children to grow into well educated artists, future supporters of the arts, and most importantly, healthy adults. 
  • It has been proven that dance education builds character, intelligence, and camaraderie. There is a stigma that dance is an elitist art form, and we want to tear down that wall.

Risks & Challenges

  • Preservation
    The Preparatory Program has always been seen as a place where people who would otherwise not be able to afford training can find sanctuary. Without the generosity of donors such as yourself, we cannot continue to offer assistance. Thereby, we run the risk of not discovering talented, intelligent, and driven young students.
  • Quality/Safety
    There is a lot of training today that isn't safe for young dancers. Our world is marketed for instant gratification, and many times, dancers are not properly prepared to safely execute the movements they are being asked to do. Injuries occur more often when a student isn't properly prepared.  
  • Integrity
    Students/Parents need a safe place to be educated. Many schools allow their students to wear inappropriate and suggestive costuming and dance to inappropriate choreography. This hurts the dance world as well as the maturing student.

    Please help us get the word out!!!

  • Facebook, Twitter, Email, Web blasts, Phone-a-friend, SMOKE SIGNALS!
  • Check out the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Short Summary

On our visit to Jakarta last week, I came across a shocking article in the Jakarta Post about a young woman with 3 kids who died of breast cancer in a Medan public hospital. Her evil husband had absconded, and did not even turn up at the funeral, despite desperate pleas from  his kids by phone. They are now destitute, virtually homeless and the eldest (Cindy aged 14) can't go to school as she has to  find work (perhaps on the street sadly) and support her  2 siblings: girl aged 11 and boy aged 9. They are bright kids from a Christian family. 

My name is James Odiman, an Agricultural consultant  from Malaysia,  and I am determined to help the kids so that they can live and go back to school again. My own personal resources are limited to help them appreciably. Hence this crowd funding. If the contributions hit US$30,000, I reckon it would be just  enough to see the kids through high school. And give them back a life. The collected money will be held in a bank trust fund account, with bank confirmation published for anyone to see.

I appeal to your good nature and humanity to help, however humble your contributions may be. 

God bless.

http://www.thejakartapost.com/news/2015/10/11/b...

story:
“Strawbert’s Sensational Story is a great therapy tool for Feeding Therapists using a systematic desensitization approach to teaching children about food.  It helps to turn the work of learning about eating into an adventure!  This book would also be a good resource for parents with picky eaters who would like to see their children be open to trying new foods.  Laura and her illustrator have done an amazing job translating feeding therapy principles into a fun and exciting journey, which is exactly what we want children to learn about food!”

Kay A. Toomey, Ph.D.

Clinical Director, SOS Feeding Solutions @ STAR

President, Toomey & Associates, Inc.

Developer, SOS Approach to Feeding

I am a Pediatric Occupational Therapist with a family-centered practice devoted to increasing children’s positive relationship with food and overall quality of life.

My feeding therapy specialist training is centered in the SOS Approach to Feeding, an innovative 32-step children’s feeding system. Feeding therapy places a strong focus on increasing children’s exposure to a wide variety of foods in each food group to ensure that children eat the nutrients they need for optimal development. The SOS Approach to feeding is designed to increase a child’s positive interaction with food by moving them up the food hierarchy: from tolerating the food in the room to interacting with the food; smelling, touching, and tasting the food; and eventually eating the food and enjoying it!

Strawbert’s Sensational Story was created as a tool to show children that eating does not have to be a scary two-step process, but rather an exciting multiple-step adventure, exploring and building a positive relationship with food!

My goal for the Strawbert project is to publish in hardcover, paperback and ebook to get this great tool into the hands of therapists and parents of problem- feeders/picky eaters. This book is a beneficial tool that will educate parents on complex feeding issues and show children that eating can be fun and full of adventure. With your contribution we can make that happen!

What I Am Asking From You & What You Get From Me!

Strawbert’s Sensational Story has been in the works for a little over a year: The story is written, the illustrations are finished and the book is currently being supported and piloted at the Star Center in Denver, CO: the premier research institute for pediatric feeding therapy.

The Goal is to raise $4,000 by February 5th, 2016.

The funds raised in this campaign will help support the beginning of publishing and distribution costs:

$2500- covers the publishing package

$500- covers marketing expenses

$1000- covers the first bulk order of Strawbert’s Sensational Story

The Perks

For a contribution of $20.00 or more you will receive a signed physical copy of Strawbert’s Sensational Story along with a copy of the Strawbert e-book.

The Impact

With your help we will be able to get this book out into the world and into the hands of picky eaters and problem feeders. This book will play a huge part in eliminating nutritional and growth problems and increasing children’s positive relationship with food.

Other Ways You Can Help

Your support and help in spreading the word are truly appreciated. Tell everyone you know about Strawbert’s Sensational Story and this campaign so we can reach as many kids as possible!

Thank you so much for your support,

Laura Olsonoski, OTD, OTR/L

Eat. Move. Grow., LLC

Pediatric Feeding Specialist

Pediatric Occupational Therapist

story:
Stella Adler?

My name is Kyle Kash and I'm a 23 year old actor from Perth, Western Australia and I have been accepted into the prestigious acting academy of Stella Adler's Studio of Acting in New York City, for their summer program. The issue is I'm low on funds and need to pay off tuition, flights, visas and accommodation so I am safely set up and ready to go. Stella Adler is one of Constantin Stanislavski's (the grandfather of modern acting) direct pupils from the United States, and whilst she passed away back in 1992, just a year after I was born, her legacy carries on through her academy. For her, acting wasn't just about performing, it was about living passionately, imaginatively and knowing your worth, and this is the way I want to be as an artist and professional actor: so I can give back to the community through my best asset. Coming from a lower socio-economic background and single parent family, education has always been triumphed as a noble under-taking but the funding of such tasks has never been easy. This is why I need your help, this I why I need you!

Why Help Fund Me?

The question you may be asking is why should you contribute to this cause for me? Well, aside from giving me the opportunity to study at my dream school, which I have been wanting to study at for years now, is that it will allow me to have the edge I need back home to work in this competitive industry, be taken seriously, and acquire an agent that can help me get work. It will also teach me the skills I need to be truthful, convincing and immersed in the characters I play to help tell the stories of the world, for how can we act upon issues if we are not aware or emotionally connected to the stories that find the common humanity between us and others?

I've broken the costs down, and am working to raise $5,000 to aide my trip:

- $3,650, for tuition costs

- $1,000 accommodation costs

- $1,472 for flights to and from Perth and New York (not including insurance)

Now, this alone does exceed what I'm asking from you guys, but to be able to pay even some of this off would help me achieve my dreams without going severely into debt and not being able to use the skills I learn from this prestigious school when I return home. Even if I don't reach my target, being able to pay off the majority of these fees would help ease the burden of financial stress that would make this task even more daunting. My main focus is to absorb as much as I can from this course while in New York City and push myself beyond any measure I have gone before to be the best I can be and give this world my talents so I can make it a better place.

How Will This Campaign Help?

By helping me fund my trip to study in this course you will be helping me make a name for myself, build networks and connections I would previously have no access to in my current situation, and develop skills and knowledge from some of the best acting mentors in the world. I could represent not only Australia, but all of human kind, in the way I have wanted to, in the way I love and the way I feel I best contribute to this world whilst on my own pursuit of happiness. I'm a firm believer in being altruistic, and also doing what makes you happy. I'm just grateful that I feel I can achieve both in the same stroke.

By achieving my goals in this campaign I can completely immerse myself in my study without stressing about finance and money when I get back home. I will be more appealing and eligible to institutions back in Australia, as well as agencies and managers but I will also have the skills to heighten productions I work on and create. I want to be able to tell the stories that matter most to people, and I want to do them justice. If you'd like to see how much this course could benefit my doing so check out their website: http://www.stellaadler.com/

What's The Risk?

By not achieving my goals through Indiegogo, I risk not being able to make the finances I need in the short period of time I have. I am all about working hard, working positively and making sacrifices for self-improvement, however, the looming debt that would be created is entirely detrimental to having any quality of life, or hope of success in then implementing those skills once I return home if I could afford to go. In the current state of Australia, people are holding back with secure jobs (which is why I may as well do something I love anyway since everything is hard to get!) and I, absolutely and impossibly, cannot put financial strain on my family when they don't have the means to support me that way in the first place. I want to be able to achieve my dreams as independently as possible, and not allow the circumstances in which I was born dictate my goals, happiness and achievement of worthwhile ambitions. 

I've spent life working towards getting into a school like this so I can pivot myself into a reputable artist, with all the slaps and blunders that come with being a working class boy. I know there are voices I can genuinely speak for out there that aren't being heard, I just need a hand up to give back to my fellow community.

What If I'm Dead Broke?

I totally understand where you are coming from! I always try to give where possible, and often when we do we have to go without. The last thing I want to do is put you under strain because you want to help me. If you feel as though you cannot afford to give any money to help this cause, I implore you to share my campaign with your friends on social media (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Tumblr, Foursquare, Pinterest, whatever your flavour) and send e-mails to your contacts or people you may feel would really like to champion this cause. Anyone willing to help in any way and help me hit my goals would really make my day. I don't have a lot to give right now, but my heart is willing and wanting to make a difference in other people's lives so much, I can promise whatever investment you make in me will not go to waste. We all have a dream, we can all achieve them if we work together.
