Well, aside from giving me the opportunity to study at my dream school, which I have been wanting to study at for years now, is that it will allow me to have the edge I need back home to work in this competitive industry, be taken seriously, and acquire an agent that can help me get work. It will also teach me the skills I need to be truthful, convincing and immersed in the characters I play to help tell the stories of the world, for how can we act upon issues if we are not aware or emotionally connected to the stories that find the common humanity between us and others?
I've broken the costs down, and am working to raise $5,000 to aide my trip:
- $3,650, for tuition costs
- $1,000 accommodation costs
- $1,472 for flights to and from Perth and New York (not including insurance)
Now, this alone does exceed what I'm asking from you guys, but to be able to pay even some of this off would help me achieve my dreams without going severely into debt and not being able to use the skills I learn from this prestigious school when I return home. Even if I don't reach my target, being able to pay off the majority of these fees would help ease the burden of financial stress that would make this task even more daunting. My main focus is to absorb as much as I can from this course while in New York City and push myself beyond any measure I have gone before to be the best I can be and give this world my talents so I can make it a better place.
    How Will This Campaign Help? By helping me fund my trip to study in this course you will be helping me make a name for myself, build networks and connections I would previously have no access to in my current situation, and develop skills and knowledge from some of the best acting mentors in the world. I could represent not only Australia, but all of human kind, in the way I have wanted to, in the way I love and the way I feel I best contribute to this world whilst on my own pursuit of happiness. I'm a firm believer in being altruistic, and also doing what makes you happy. I'm just grateful that I feel I can achieve both in the same stroke.
By achieving my goals in this campaign I can completely immerse myself in my study without stressing about finance and money when I get back home. I will be more appealing and eligible to institutions back in Australia, as well as agencies and managers but I will also have the skills to heighten productions I work on and create. I want to be able to tell the stories that matter most to people, and I want to do them justice. If you'd like to see how much this course could benefit my doing so check out their website: http://www.stellaadler.com/
    What's The Risk? By not achieving my goals through Indiegogo, I risk not being able to make the finances I need in the short period of time I have. I am all about working hard, working positively and making sacrifices for self-improvement, however, the looming debt that would be created is entirely detrimental to having any quality of life, or hope of success in then implementing those skills once I return home if I could afford to go. In the current state of Australia, people are holding back with secure jobs (which is why I may as well do something I love anyway since everything is hard to get!) and I, absolutely and impossibly, cannot put financial strain on my family when they don't have the means to support me that way in the first place. I want to be able to achieve my dreams as independently as possible, and not allow the circumstances in which I was born dictate my goals, happiness and achievement of worthwhile ambitions. 
I've spent life working towards getting into a school like this so I can pivot myself into a reputable artist, with all the slaps and blunders that come with being a working class boy. I know there are voices I can genuinely speak for out there that aren't being heard, I just need a hand up to give back to my fellow community.
    What If I'm Dead Broke? I totally understand where you are coming from! I always try to give where possible, and often when we do we have to go without. The last thing I want to do is put you under strain because you want to help me. If you feel as though you cannot afford to give any money to help this cause, I implore you to share my campaign with your friends on social media (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Tumblr, Foursquare, Pinterest, whatever your flavour) and send e-mails to your contacts or people you may feel would really like to champion this cause. Anyone willing to help in any way and help me hit my goals would really make my day. I don't have a lot to give right now, but my heart is willing and wanting to make a difference in other people's lives so much, I can promise whatever investment you make in me will not go to waste. We all have a dream, we can all achieve them if we work together.

story:
Español Abajo

Support Accessibility at the ECWD

The Eastern Conference on Workplace Democracy (ECWD) is the premier gathering of worker cooperatives in the Eastern United States.  The conference will take place from July 10-12 in Worcester, MA.  We expose people to the concept of worker-owned cooperatives; strengthen existing worker-owned cooperatives; develop relationships between cooperatives, labor institutions, and resource organizations; and build the movement for workplace democracy.  

It is fundamental that the knowledge, resources and contacts of this conference be available to all those who can benefit from workplace democracy. We are asking you to help make our incredible conference ACCESSIBLE to low-income people, parents, and non-English speakers with your donation to support scholarships, childcare and interpretation.  All donations up to $100 will be matched 1-1 by a generous donation from the Fund For Democratic Communities, so your contribution will have an even greater impact.

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $3000 in grassroots donations for scholarships, childcare and interpretation.  When matched, this will mean $6000 in support for accessibility.  Any amount raised will help us towards this goal.

In exchange, you will get the satisfaction of making the Eastern Conference for Workplace Democracy accessible for all, along with recognition on our website and program.

Our Supporters

We'd like to recognize our grassroots supporters who contributed prior to the launch of this campaign!
  • Lisa Baskin
  • The Center for Public Policy and Administration at UMass Amherst
  • Alicia Cordell
  • Brian Donovan
  • Peter Frank
  • Noemi Giszpenc
  • Jessica Gordon Nembhard
  • Angie Gregory
  • Mary Hoyer
  • Warren Kessler
  • Joe Rinehart
  • Lisa Russell
  • Andi Shively
  • Libertie Valance
  • Emma Yorra

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Apoya la Accesibilidad en el ECWD

La Conferencia del Este para la Democracia del Trabajo (ECWD) es el principal encuentro de cooperativas de trabajo en el este de Estados Unidos. La conferencia se llevará a cabo del 10 al 12 de Julio, 2015 en Worcester, MA. Exponemos a la gente al concepto de las cooperativas de trabajo; fortalecemos las cooperativas de trabajo existente; desarrollamos relaciones entre las cooperativas, instituciones laborales y organizaciones de recursos; y construimos el movimiento por la democracia en el trabajo.

Es fundamental que los conocimientos, recursos y contactos de esta conferencia sean disponibles para todos aquellos que pueden beneficiarse de la democracia en el trabajo. Le estamos pidiendo ayuda para hacer que nuestra conferencia increíble sea accesible a las personas de bajos ingresos, los padres y las personas que no hablan inglés con su donación para apoyar becas, cuidado de niños y la interpretación. Todas las donaciones de hasta $ 100 serán emparejados 1-1 gracias a una generosa donación del Fondo para las Comunidades Democráticas (F4DC), por lo que su contribución tendrá un impacto aún mayor.

Lo que necesitamos y lo que consigues

Nuestra meta es recaudar $ 3000 en donaciones de base para las becas, cuidado de niños y la interpretación. Cuando se combina, esto significará $6,000 dólares en apoyo a la accesibilidad. Cualquier cantidad recaudada nos ayudará para alcanzar este objetivo.

A cambio, obtendrás la satisfacción de hacer que la Conferencia del Este para la Democracia del Trabajo sea accesible para tod@s, junto con un reconocimiento en nuestro sitio web y programa.

Donantes

Nos gustaría reconocer a los que ya han contribuido. ¡Gracias!

  • Lisa Baskin
  • The Center for Public Policy and Administration at UMass Amherst
  • Alicia Cordell
  • Brian Donovan
  • Peter Frank
  • Noemi Giszpenc
  • Jessica Gordon Nembhard
  • Angie Gregory
  • Mary Hoyer
  • Warren Kessler
  • Joe Rinehart
  • Lisa Russell
  • Andi Shively
  • Libertie Valance
  • Emma Yorra

story:
Short Summary

My name is Jackie Stevenson.
I started a woman owned business Spirit of Leadership Experiential Learning with Horses for personal discovery and professional development in leadership and team building.
Over 2000 clients have engaged with our horses and gained horse wisdom and inner wisdom that have contributed to their success in their personal lives and work lives.
We know not everyone who could benefit from horse wisdom will be able to join our herd at the ranch. We decided to bring horse wisdom to you to inspire your inner knowing and personal wisdom.
Our way to bring horse wisdom to you is through a deck of 52 different beautifully painted horse images with inquiry questions on the back of the cards.
The funding we need is for the production of the first 1000 decks of cards.
In exchange for your contribution you will receive a deck of the horse wisdom cards and a contribution made in your name to the Fieldstone Farm Therapeutic Riding Center and to the Cloud Foundation for the rescue of North American mustangs our heritage of wild horses

What Horses Reveal About Being Human
For generations horses have carried us farther and faster than we could travel alone. Today, horses can guide us to find our way through the challenging terrain of our lives, toward wholeness and well being. 

In the awesome presence of these majestic beings and their images, we meet ourselves in an expanded sense of freedom and awe. In relationship with horses, we touch Spirit and experience the grace of being human.

story:
THANK YOU TO EVERYONE WHO SUPPORTED OUR CAMPAIGN TO BRING WOW TALKS TO SECONDARY STUDENTS IN THE UK

WE HAVE RAISED ENOUGH TO BRING THE EXPERIENCE TO ONE SECONDARY SCHOOL AND ARE NOW WORKING ON PLANS FOR TAKING THIS FORWARD. WE HAVE NUMEROUS SCHOOLS WHO HAVE CONTACTED US REQUESTING THAT WOW TALKS COME TO THEIR SCHOOL, SO NOW WE WILL NEED TO MAKE THE SELECTION.

WE ARE SO VERY GRATEFUL FOR ALL YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS AND WILL KEEP YOU POSTED ON WHICH SCHOOL IS SELECTED.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

WOW Talks is on a mission to expose secondary school students to future career possibilities they didn't even know existed and inspire them to pursue a career they feel passionate about using an innovative and disruptive format. 

WE ARE RAISING £30K to bring our unique WOW Talks format to the first 10 schools who need it most. Each £10 you contribute brings the WOW Talks experience to 1 secondary school student. And for £3,000, you can bring the WOW Talks experience to your own school! We are offering some great Perks too! (see the right-hand column). Please support our mission to bring inspiration to 3,000 students in the UK.....WE CAN'T DO IT WITHOUT YOU!!

WE NEED YOUR HELP TO MAKE THIS HAPPEN!


What's The Issue?

The Harsh Reality:

Students who end up in careers where they are not feeling engaged and fulfilled are costing billions to the economy. 

Here’s Where WOW Talks Comes In…

WOW Talks for Schools aims to change the status-quo by awakening the passion in young people, helping them find their own unique talent, inspiring them to dream and giving them the confidence and tools to follow their own career ambitions. At this very crucial juncture in their lives, there is nothing more important than showing them that with hard work, perseverance and commitment, they can achieve whatever their heart desires.

Through our unique and interactive platform, which features role models (who not so long ago were in the students' exact seats) sharing their real life experiences and personal journeys with students, WOW Talks for Schools opens a necessary dialogue between young people and graduates. This format helps create a mindset that anything is possible!


What exactly is 'WOW Talks'?

 WOW Talks is a social impact organisation that delivers engaging live events and online video content to inspire people to reconnect with their WHY – their purpose- so they can attain greater fulfillment in their professional lives. 

How Does the Format Work?

The WOW Talks platform delivers relevant and inspiring content via both live events and an interactive online channel (www.wowtalks.tv). Each 90-minute event is run like a TV show and made up of 5 x 9-minute talks given by speakers from different industries, cultures and disciplines who are committed to creating a life doing what they love most and who share their personal stories... their Words of Wisdom (WOW).

One of the speakers is always a performer– a musician, dancer, comedian, etc. – who delivers up to 3 performances during the evening, making the event not only inspiring, enriching & insightful but also entertaining! 



See What Students & Teachers are Saying About Us:

Why Are We Here?

We need your help in raising funds to build a platform that will enable us to establish our footprint in the UK school system.  We need to raise £30,000 to enable us to bring the WOW Talks experience to the students of 10 schools in disadvantaged areas. 

By contributing to our campaign, you will be giving students the opportunity to hear first-hand that it IS possible to make a living doing what you love, and helping to provide the students with the courage and motivation needed to follow their own dreams. In essence, by sponsoring one student to experience a WOW Talks event, you could actually make a huge impact on that student's future.  Pretty great feeling, isn't it?!

How Will the Funds be Used?

It costs £3,000 to bring the live WOW Talks experience to one school. This amount covers the cost of speaker selection and coaching, management of the event on the day, professional filming and editing of the talks and development, 

All funds raised through this campaign will be put towards bringing the WOW Talks experience to secondary school students*.

*Based on the assumption that an average of 300 students will attend a WOW Talks for Schools event at any one school. We may also bring the live WOW Talks experience to students at another school in their community or through a dedicated WOW Talks for Schools festival.


The Proof is in the Pudding (as they say…)

WOW Talks isn't just an off-the-cuff idea that was thought up overnight. In fact, we have been running WOW Talks events in the real world for the past 5 years, which has given us plenty of time to test and evolve the format until we came up with a product that was truly insightful, inspiring, entertaining...and powerful!

To date we have held 45 WOW Talks events in various locations around the globe including London, New York, Berlin and Tel Aviv. The events have been held in galleries, museums, cinemas, Google Campuses and Apple stores. Our events have featured close to 250 speakers and were attended by over 6,000 people, all of whom are part of our growing global WOW Talks community. WOW Talks has a proven model – it just works!


The Team Behind the 'WOW' 

We are a team of experienced and creative business leaders (and fun-loving people!) with complementary backgrounds who have come together to form WOW Talks Global CIC because we are all passionate about creating a society where people live purposeful and fulfilled lives.

Please support us in any way you can....

There are 3 ways in which you can help support our campaign:

Support the WOW Talks for Schools campaign by contributing - it costs just £10 to give the WOW Talks experience to a student who needs it most ...just imagine the impact your contribution could have on this young person's future!

Spread the word about our mission and this campaign by telling all your friends, family and colleagues and sharing it on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn and Instagram using the Indiegogo sharing tools above.

Introduce us to your secondary school (alma mater), your child’s school, your niece /nephew’s school, your grandchild's school or a school in your community that you care about. We need your help in making schools aware of our inspiring format.

Please help us take the first step towards creating a society where people are living fulfilled and purposeful lives! Every small contribution is extremely appreciated and will go towards bringing inspiration to a young person.

We thank you from the bottom of our hearts for your support!


With gratitude,

The WOW Talks Team

#WOW4Schools

Frequently Asked Questions


Is this campaign international?

Yes! Although we are using the funds from this campaign to bring WOW Talks for Schools to students in the UK, the online content created from these events will be accessible to students worldwide. We will also be expanding our initiative to the US in the future.


Can I contribute from outside the UK?

Absolutely! Indiegogo accepts all major credit cards and payment through PayPal so as long as you have a PayPal account or a major credit card, you can contribute.


How are the funds being used?

It costs £3,000 to create a live WOW Talks for Schools experience. This amount covers the following:

  • speaker selection and coaching 
  • management of the event on the day
  • professional filming and editing of the talks

Is there a perk that allows me to bring WOW Talks to a particular school?

Yes – the ‘Inspire Your School’ perk has been set up exactly for this purpose! 

Please confirm with the school first (must be in the UK) and then send an email to kim@wowtalks.tv to let us know which school your contribution is going towards, and we’ll ensure we bring our event to the students of that school!


Large Contributions - How can I make a contribution over £9,000?

You can make contributions up to £30k via the Indiegogo platform. If you are interested in making a larger contribution to WOW Talks for Schools, please contact kim@wowtalks.tv


Are you a registered charity?  

We are not a registered charity, but we are a UK registered Community Interest Company (CIC) whereby a minimum of 65% of the profits are reinvested back into the company or used for the community it was set up to serve.


I have more questions. Who do I ask?

Please forward any other questions to dana@wowtalks.tv. We’ll get back to you as soon as we can.

story:
Short Summary

The Stirling Festival Theatre was built in 1927. It is non-profit body which is the cultural and economic heartbeat of its community. As well as exceptional live performances, the Stirling Festival Theatre also provides many services to the surrounding community such as youth programs, and summer camps. It is especially proud of its work developing theatre skills with young people. Its Young Company, a group of teenagers from Stirling and the surrounding area, receive professional training in all the skills associated with the Theatre - acting, singing, dancing, etc. This enables them to put on three or four shows a year, notably a summer Broadway musical, which runs for three weeks and draws in audiences from all over the area.

During the summer months  the hall upstairs becomes extremely hot and uncomfortable. Among its uses, perhaps the most important is as a rehearsal area for the Young Company.  To make the hall more comfortable, both for the kids and for the other uses of the hall the Stirling Festival Theatre would like to install a new air conditioner. You can help us afford it.

What We Need & What You Get

The Stirling Festival Theatre needs $15,000 to purchase and install a new air conditioning system for their upstairs hall and rehearsal area. 

  • As a theatre many of our perks will provide access to great live entertainment performances.
  • Our shows include:  Live Concerts, Christmas Pantomime, Plays and the Young Company performance of "Legally Blonde".
  • All perks can be claimed through the Stirling Festival Theatre Box Office (Address: 41 W Front St, Stirling, ON, Tel:  1-877-312-1162)
  • We know with continued hard work, dedication and YOUR help we can realize our financial goal to see this project to completion.

The Impact

Rehearsing for a live performance can be exhausting. This is intensified in the summer months with the heat and humidity. A new air conditioner will help keep this area cool and comfortable for the young people as they rehearse. This will also benefit the community since this space is also used for:

  • Play and Author Readings
  • Summer Theatre Camps
  • Reception before and after performances
  • Rental space for local groups
  • Meetings

Risks & Challenges

While we have a long way in our fundraising goal, we know we cannot stop until we have what is needed in place.  We will:

  • Continue with our marketing and fundraising efforts.
  • Continue applying for any provincial and federal grants that we are eligible for. 
  • Continue to seek out personal donors .                                                                           We are so fortunate to have a large group of very dedicated volunteers willing to work hard to see this project though.

Other Ways You Can Help 

We understand that right now not everyone who wishes to support can do so financially, however, there are still several ways you can help:

  • Please share our story with your friends and family, through email, Facebook, Twitter, word of mouth.  Any sharing is greatly appreciated.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools and help us get our story told.

PLEASE NOTE!  Charitable receipts are available for a portion of your contribution less administrative fees.  Donations of $50 or more are eligible.  Please email your name, address, and donation amount to <youngco@stirlingfestivaltheatre.com>.  A receipt can be picked up at our box office (41 W Front St, Stirling, ON) or mailed when the campaign closes. 


About Stirling Festival Theatre

Stirling Festival Theatre (SFT) is the leading arts organization in the region and is recognized as a main economic driver for the township of Stirling-Rawdon.  Stirling is a distinctly rural community at the geographic heart of the region’s farming country and is located approximately half-way between Peterborough and Ottawa.  The audience who attend the Stirling Festival Theatre annually is drawn primarily from the Bay of Quinte region, Hastings, Prince Edward and Northumberland Counties.  Under the leadership of Managing Director, David Vanderlip,  Stirling Festival Theatre presents over 100 performances each year. In addition to presenting a year-round roster of outstanding touring shows, SFT also produces a shows including at least two original Canadian plays each year.   Over the last  decade, more than $500,000 worth of renovations have been made at the theatre, including air conditioning of the main auditorium, new washrooms, a complete overhaul of the box office, new seating and sound baffling in the auditorium, excavation of the orchestra pit, and re-wiring of the complex. Shows are presented to a paying audience primarily in the main auditorium.  Music, cabarets, and dinner theatre style Murder Mysteries are  presented in Eugene Burrell Hall, a cabaret space which seats approximately 100 people. As well as being a significant arts presence in the region, Stirling Festival Theatre has a long history of nurturing the next generation of emerging artists.  There is a strong and active ‘Young Company’, whose productions  feature up-and-coming local performers. 

SFT is proud of the continual growth in our artistic and theatrical endeavours, but mostly we are delighted to say that over 45,000 people come to Stirling every year to attend small town theatre with big time talent!

story:
Short Summary

The Blake School has been an institution of excellence in education in the Plantation area since 1961. We have over 130 students from grades Pre-K through 8th grade. We pride ourselves on being a diverse and inclusive school.

The current sign in front of our school was a gift from the very first PTO back in the 1970s. It is in dire need of repair that exceeds its value. It is time for an updated and current sign that will advertise our school as a hidden treasure in Plantation.

What We Need

  • The new sign, complete with an LED electronic display is over $14,000. This includes the permit, the construction, the wiring system needed, and the cost of the sign itself.
  • The School has already pledged to purchase the sign. We, as the current PTO, would like to help them defer the cost through several fundraising venues including this Indiegogo campaign.
  • Any donations raised, no matter how small, will go directly to funding the new sign. 

The Impact

  • Our school is a special place that has meant the world to generations of students. Many alumni have grown up and sent their own children to our school. We have several multi-generation families currently attending.
  • These past, current, and future students deserve a new and updated sign that amplifies what our school is all about; excellence in education while providing a safe family environment conducive to learning.

Other Ways You Can Help


  • Please help us get the word out by sharing this campaign on any social networks you may be a part of.
  • Please remember to use the Indiegogo share tools.
